Reviews.Title: “Good Choice for Major Chain Hotel in Napa”
Reviews.Author: KAP
Reviews.Content: Positives: The property and rooms are typical Westin high-quality. Staff was extremely helpful. Close enough to downtown Napa. Negatives: There was a bit of a noise issue from the adjoining room. Expected a better upgrade as an SPG Gold. Bar and restaurant prices were exceedingly expensive. The $20 resort fee will never cease to irritate me.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth a stay”
Reviews.Author: winelvr83
Reviews.Content: We stayed here about a year and a half ago and decided to return for this visit. It continues to be a top notch resort. The room, while a little close (bed and dresser with tv are a tight fit) but other than that, it's very comfortable, clean and quiet. A Michelin star rated restaurant is part of the resort and that was delicious. Valet service is the friendliest, most helpful valet anywhere. Walk up the road to Model Bakery for breakfast or a short mile walk into town. We were able to use military rate so was more affordable than last time. Check to see if they are offering any specials.

Reviews.Title: “Super Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: AmicisTours
Reviews.Content: Our wine tour guests just love this hotel. There are a lot of very nice places to stay in Napa but what we hear from our guests and what keeps them coming back to the Verasa is the friendly staff. I have never encountered a frown or a brusque comment. It is bright, airy, spacious, friendly and the location is excellent for evenings in Napa. We are always happy to recommend the Westin Verasa when asked in advance where to stay. Walking distance to both the Oxbow and downtown, it has it all. In fact, you don't even have to walk anywhere... just dine at La Toque! Aces in my book.

Reviews.Title: “Female Business Traveler/ Family Traveler with dogs”
Reviews.Author: april m
Reviews.Content: I travel up to Napa for business frequently and sometimes need a place to stay....This is the best place for me! I feel welcome, safe (which is key) and comfortable. The room service is excellent...they have healthy options that don't break the bank. The bar downstairs is a nice place to have a drink...no creeps, just nice people that want the same thing as me....a convenient place to have a drink/apps w/o leaving the property. Beds are always super comfy and super luxurious.....We have a VERY nice bed at home with the best sheets, memory foam, etc and I LOVE the beds at Verasa. Love the suites with the kitchenette (which is very chic-looking).....they are done very well and give a semblance of home away from home. I bring a few treats to put in the over-sized fridge (a PLUS...with no stupid mini bar that charges you when you take something out!). I also travel with my husband and our two Terriers....The dogs LOVE the Heavenly dog beds....they curl up and feel right at home...which is rare because Terriers are usually all over the place and freak out in hotel rooms trying to figure everything out. The beds are placed in the room before if you let them know that dogs are coming and they went right for them. Very nice =) Hot tub is great, the greenbelt out in back is a perfect place to walk the dogs so they can do their business and sniff around. The quality of the food is top notch...they have super antioxidant breakfasts (!!!!) that tastes GREAT....And if you want more variety, Oxbow Public Martket is about 2 blocks away... Everyone that works there is accommodating...When I/we check in the bell hop waits for you, brings you up to your room, makes sure you like the room and runs and gets whatever you need right away with a smile. Customer service is excellent here, period. I stay at Verasa whenever I can and look forward to doing so...It's a necessity AND a treat!

Reviews.Title: “Nice property just needs a few extra touches”
Reviews.Author: Anomina
Reviews.Content: Overall a nice stay. The positives are the modern design, great beds, generously-sized rooms, excellent dual-head shower, and very pleasant service. And, while this place is not cheap, the rates were reasonable for this caliber of hotel, especially for the Napa area which can be outrageously expensive. A few things that could be improved. The room we had overlooked the pool and the folks enjoying the pool were having maybe a little bit too much wine :) and became quite loud as the evening went on. The management said they had strict rules for closing the pool at 11 and they did make efforts to get these folks to leave. But, it took several calls to the front desk to get this to happen and it was getting somewhat late by then. A little more attention to keeping the public areas quiet and pleasant for all -- without guests having to complain -- would be helpful. And, the rooms were a bit noisy as well -- we could hear the people above us in the morning as well as the room service carts going down the hall Overall, I'd recommend this hotel, especially if these glitches can be sorted out.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service and immaculate property with great food on-site”
Reviews.Author: calalum97
Reviews.Content: As always, Starwood serves up truly amazing service. Stayed there with my bro and family so not sure if it was on account of us both being Platinum SPG members, but we were consistently greeted with big smiles and by name. Even my dad, who's bday it was, remarked that he truly felt like he was a VIP throughout... Great pool area and restaurant (seems a waste to stay on-site for food while in Napa but it's definitely worth it. Have not stayed in the city of Napa before so something a it closer to St Helena/Youtville would have been nice but he city of Napa is nice too.

Reviews.Title: “Great Napa hotel, central location”
Reviews.Author: Travelbest717
Reviews.Content: Nice oversized rooms. Great service, modern hotel. Great for business or vacation in Napa. Hotel staff goes out of their way to make your stay comfortable. Nice pool and decent fitness center. Ask for a quieter room away from front street.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: mauigirlLansing_MI
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here recently and were very impressed with the look and style of the hotel. Staff were very nice and helpful, the bed was really comfortable and breakfast was excellent. When we return to the Napa area, we will definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Starwood Location, Property, & Platinum Recognition!”
Reviews.Author: BOLDMissionHills_KS
Reviews.Content: We just completed a three night stay at the Westin Verasa Napa in March 2012. Over the past year, we have been fortunate enough to stay at over 25 different Starwood properties. The Westin Verasa Napa is the best Westin Brand Hotel we have experienced and an excellent choice when visiting Napa and Sonoma. Here's why: Location - Last year we opted to stay in San Francisco (St. Regis), drive into Napa/Sonoma for the day, and return to the city for dinner. This was not the best plan as the drive back and forth was very long. The Westin Verasa is perfectly located within walking distance of downtown Napa and some of the best restaurants in northern California. We loved walking to dinner after a long day of driving and wine tasting. The hotel backs up to a peaceful river walk area to unwind at the end of the day. We enjoyed dining at Angele and Cole's Chop House and highly recommend them (both walkable from the hotel). We also recommend dining at The Farm and Boone Fly Cafe, which is a short drive away. If you're in Rutherford, have lunch at Auberge du Soleil for a picture perfect view. Staff - The team of employees complemented each other very well. From the valet to the front desk and restaurant servers, we were always greeted with a happy face and willingness to make our visit the best. Great Property- The hotel is smartly designed. When you arrive you are greeted by the valet which appears to be your only option for parking (the cost is included in your amenity fees). The property configuration can best be described as two connected horse shoes. One side is home to the pool/jacuzzi and the other side is quiet grassy area used for Bocce Ball. The building is three stories and newer construction. Our room included a large balcony, full kitchen, two full bathrooms, tall ceilings, and great living room area. It was lovely, perfect for entertaining, and hosting dinner. We loved our room. Platinum Recognition - As Platinum SPG Members, we have grown accustom to the best that Starwood has to offer. The loyaly program is the best in the business, The Westin Verasa did not disappoint. We were upgraded to a beautiful one bedroom premium suite, provided with a list of discounts/benefits at select restaurants and wineries, given a complimentary half bottle of wine along with a small box of chocolate. We opted for a complimentary continental breakfast (which was served at "The Bank ",their lobby restaurant) as our platinum amenity. A nice touch included personal hand-written and signed cards from the hotel staff acknowledging our stay. Constructive Feedback: -Gym: Although the gym was clean with newer equipment, it's too small. We found ourselves waiting in line to use the equipment around 8am each morning. It's time to make the space bigger and get more equipment. It's clear your hotel demographic like to exercise. Wineries - While touring Napa we highly recommend stopping at Schramsberg, Chateau Montelena, & Beringer . While touring Sonoma visit Coppola, Lankmark , and Arrowood. Overall, this property was a wonderful choice for our trip to Napa and Sonoma. It is an excellent value and we will definitely return again and again. Great job Starwood!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: YRP_21
Reviews.Content: Beautiful property in Napa, that felt very relaxing and luxurious. If you plan on taking the Napa wine train, the parking is across the street, so that would be perfect for you. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful, for the most part. The reason I gave them four stars is because our room was programed at 75 degrees and we couldn't get it to work right, to the point where we had to get up in the middle of the night to keep turning it down. Also, the alarm clock went off at 6:00 on Sunday morning-- needless to say, we didn't have an overly restful nights sleep. Which I was annoyed about.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - Bad for Platinum guests”
Reviews.Author: DJqc
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one that make's you smile as you approach. The architecture is pleasing to the eye and makes it look modern with a feeling of outdoors. There is a heated salt water pool and jacuzzi that is open year round. In the lounge is a daily demonstration of local vinters displaying their latest vintages. The staff is nice to a fault and were quite cordial. However, i found the service to be very slow. When i requested a rollerbed it took almost 30 minutes for it to arrive. I called from their business center for help with the fax... and after 25 minutes of waiting i left and asked the front desk to fax the document for me. The room itself was very nice and well appointed. The hotel itself is massive and must have had at least 200 rooms. If i stop here i'd give this place 4 stars. They lose a star for slow service. For starwood members: If you are a Platinum Starwood client as I am, you have likely become spoiled with upgrades and other special amenities. However, starwood does teach us to be that way as they continuously flaunt the benefits of being a Platinum member. For those who don't know obtaining platinum requires 25 stays or 50 nights at a starwood property. My big issue here was that this hotel was fairly empty based on comments made from the parking staff and i was not given a "real" upgrade even after i asked. I even double checked online to see if better rooms were available, which they all were. Normally, i travel for business and it is not a big deal, but on this occasion it would made a big difference to get a 2 bedroom suite. A "real" upgrade is when you get a truly superior room.... Either larger than normal or that features additional amenities. A better view (unless the view is spectacular), or a small balcony does not really qualify in my books. But what really infuriated me was that they attempted to charge me for the upgrade. So they said they could not offer me the upgrade due to availability, but they could upgrade me at the cost of $70... Wow. Starwood hotels in the U.S. and Europe have really been devaluing the benefits of being a starwood platinum member. In Asia you can be sure that you will receive the best room available. In the U.S. you need to twist their arm to get it... It should not be that way. Cheers,

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience!”
Reviews.Author: Liz P
Reviews.Content: The experience from start to finish was beyond my expectations and I am thoroughly impressed with the commitment to customer service that the staff here exudes. I was traveling with a group of friends, all of whom are in the hotel industry as am I, and we unanimously felt that the staff members at this property were fantastic. In particular, Sal in the valet department was extremely friendly and helpful as he brought our luggage up to our room and gave us excellent recommendations for dining. Another employee that deserves mention is Christian Flores at the Front Office. Christian was incredibly helpful in answering all our questions about wineries and tasting. He gave us a beautiful room and was so friendly throughout our stay. Christian as well as the entire team made our stay amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Westin!! Big hotel with small hotel feel”
Reviews.Author: foodiehotelguy
Reviews.Content: This hotel provided an excellent service expirience. We were there for wine tasting and relaxation and the staff just treated us like VIP's from the moment we got there. Rooms were excellent, bed was comfortable, and shower was perfect! Definitely recommend staying here whenever in Napa.

Reviews.Title: “Westin Napa Verasa A+++”
Reviews.Author: AMB69_11
Reviews.Content: We celebrated our 20th wedding anniversary in Napa this year and Westin Napa was excellent. The property was fantastic, the staff was exceptional and the location was ideal. We opted for the 1BR Suite and it was beautiful, roomy, and comfortable. The full size balcony was great and we had a pretty good view of the mountains. Jerome at the front desk went out of his way to make our stay a memorable one. We are looking forward to our next stay possibly this summer.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and pet-friendly”
Reviews.Author: Overlooker
Reviews.Content: We were in Napa to drop off our daughter at school; we never toured wine-country on this trip. From the moment we pulled in, the Verasa staff was very helpful and professional. Over two days, the concierge was always super-accommodating. The hotel is pet-friendly and dog food, a dog bed, and dog food/water bowls were delivered to the room (even though we had all that). The suite was extremely comfortable. There were two baths and a pull out bed on which our daughter slept. The river walk out the back door was a gift. We could be out walking the dog in about two minutes. We could walk to just about every restaurant that interested us.

Reviews.Title: “I was just OK”
Reviews.Author: hcred25
Reviews.Content: We are avid Westin fans, and have stayed with them all over the world. This is not their best resort. Amenities were so so....No on-site spa, room service was sub-par, room was kind of spartan for a 2 bedroom suite. I'm sure most people would be very happy with this Westin, but we have been to many that are much better. One side note: The Concierge Royce Ann was AWESOME! I asked her for a list of boutique vineyards and they were all perfect.

Reviews.Title: “pet friendly and a great location”
Reviews.Author: simplecity
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at this Westin for two nights with our small dog in January. This time of year was very quiet in Napa and most restaurants were closed for winter break, but the hotel accommodations were great and the staff extremely friendly. We were upgraded to a one-bedroom suite - king bed, spacious bathroom and furnished kitchenette/dining area. The suite also had a walk out terrace that had a gate to a private courtyard area near the boccie ball courts. This was a great place to let our dog out. We were drawn to this hotel because of how dog friendly it is! He was allowed to walk around most areas of the hotel (minus the food and pool areas) and they even had a heavenly bed for him - don't forget to ask for it! The location of the hotel is wonderful because it is walking distance to the oxbow market and downtown Napa. This is nice because at other hotels/inns that are closer to the vineyards, it seems there is nothing to do after 8pm. There is a small resort fee for this hotel but it includes the valet parking and internet.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, service and atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: teesmc
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights here and enjoyed every minute. The rooms were spacious and clean, very comfy king size bed. We enjoyed the outdoor hot tub after a day of wine tasting. Easy walk to great restaurants

Reviews.Title: “Nice Property ideally located”
Reviews.Author: haddad007
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ideally located in Napa near both old town and the new development along the Napa river. Restaurants are very close and 29 is 5 minutes away to start your tour of the Napa wineries. The hotel is typical Westin and perform nicely. The workout room is a bit small for the property size but a nice walk or jog around Napa will more then suffice. When busy valet parking jams up pretty badly so leave enough time. The bar is generally pretty busy and on Friday and Saturday night there was a free wine tasting. All being said we will return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in Napa valley with helpful concierge”
Reviews.Author: nyctraveljunkies
Reviews.Content: We stayed here while touring Napa for the weekend. The rooms were nice, large, and comfortable. We love the Westin Heavenly Bed and appreciate the high quality and consistency across hotels in the Westin brand. The concierge was extremely helpful; she gave us a map of Napa and pointed out which wineries were best to tour, where we could buy a picnic lunch, and which wineries were open for picnics. We had a rented car during our stay and the parking at the hotel is valet-only. The staff brought around the car quickly and were always friendly. We ate at the hotel once (for brunch) and liked the food, although the wait service was slow. We loved our visit in Napa and would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Westin, but too large & they add a resort fee”
Reviews.Author: pdx-engaged
Reviews.Content: Checked in and was told they have a complimentary wine tasting going on. Unfortunately, I missed it. Not sure how. All I did was call the hubs to let him know I'd arrived, and receive a call from management (which was also quick). I almost didn't answer the phone, since I wasn't interested in a rote welcome call. No, that wasn't why they were calling. Apparently the valet crunched the side mirror of the car. Props for being forthright and calling the rental car company to take care it. Hopefully, there won't be an issue when I turn it in. Having missed the free tasting, I grabbed a glass at the bar. Very nice wine. I'll have a review on snootful(dot)blogspot(dot)com soon. The bar has reasonably good service, but they were backing up the wait staff in the adjacent restaurant, and were occasionally absent. The tuna lollipops were very good, as was the pork belly. The resort fee is lame. I appreciate that it covers things like Internet, which Westins usually charge for, but saying it covers the pool? Lame. And if you're charging $20, then the WiFi signal in the rooms should be better. Rooms had typical Westin style, mine had a kitchenette, which could be handy for longer stays or families. My room faced the road, and I thought I'd get white noise to sleep by. Nope. There's a rail line out there too. Not frequent, but loud whistle blowing. Kinda pricey for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but could use some updates”
Reviews.Author: lwturner
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the westin napa with my husband recently for two nights. The location was very central and the building is a nice looking in a rustic shingled style. There is only valet parking but it was super quick and efficient. The lobby was a little sparse. There is only a small area to sit and hang out. Rooms are comfortable and traditional. There was a coffee maker and typical shampoo products but no real immenities aside from that. The room was extremely quiet which was a huge plus. One aspect that could use improvement is the food at the bar. Of the three things we tried, only the grilled cheese was good. The other two items were not what I'd expect from a hotel of this caliber. In general, a nice place with a nice staff but with a lot of competition in napa, the westin has some work to do before I could say great.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with nicely spaced rooms”
Reviews.Author: ann_travellinggirl
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel, which lies close to Napa city center. The rooms are huge, and was brilliant. We used the bar a great deal, and the bartenders were polite and serviceminded. Especially one of the latin girls at the breakfast was really nice to us. The pool and hot tub are great, and it is a quite lovely hotel. The conciergie was not there much, and also one of the bellboys was a little rude. But other than that, we loved it! If we go again, we would stay at the same place!

Reviews.Title: “Very good if you are on upper floor!”
Reviews.Author: PVGreg
Reviews.Content: I love this hotels location, room size, bathrooms, pool/spa and workout room. A great place to stay in the heart of Napa. I have stayed here a few times and my only issue is that the sound from the floors above can be extremely annoying. Over Christmas 2011 we had a 2 bedroom suite with a dog above us and we could hear the dog running all around the room all day and night, it was so bad we moved our room mid-stay only to have a room below small children that constantly ran around their room. Next time I will insist on a top floor. Otherwise this is the best newest hotel in the Downtown Napa area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot and Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: Kevin N
Reviews.Content: From top to bottom the staff is extremely friendly and warm. Rooms are beautiful and the property has an energetic vibe to it. Would definitely recommend the restaurant on property, "La Toque". Great food and the wine pairings are spot on. In particular I want to thank Sam, our server in the Bank restaurant. It was the start of black truffle season when we stayed at the Verasa and when Sam found out we were eating at La Toque he went over to the restaurant and told them to let us know what items would be good with the truffles. Really a small gesture, but so appreciated. The only drawback is being in downtown Napa is great and the OxBow is right there, but it will take you 20-30 minutes to get to any of the wineries in the valley.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ester32446
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights in a1 bedroom suite. Was a great room, nice bathroom, shower and amenities. Bed very comfortable. We walked into town or took a 5 minute cab ride. Hotel bar was fun and great bartenders/service. Pool area and jacuzzi very nice. Will def go back.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous, comfortable, and homely”
Reviews.Author: happy2bJohannesburg
Reviews.Content: We spent only one night at this magnificent hotel. The rooms are more than ample, however we upgraded to a suit anyway. The first suit we had was overlooking the hotel generator which was a little noisy for us, only because we wanted total silence since we were in such a very quiet peaceful part of the countryside. The next room we went to was unbelievably magnificent. The bed was so comfy we could have spent hours in it. The pool is heated for those that want to take a dip. (Our visit was in December) The staff were super friendly and so understanding when we wanted to change rooms. The bar area has a great vibe. The hotel atmosphere just makes you feel like you want to spend a week there. Unfortunately we did not have time to use all the facilities in the room. It has everything from microwave to stove to coffee machine, and is fully equipped with all necessary cutlery and crockery. Its a must when looking for a place in Napa

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bhaber
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel one night, and it was really relaxing and luxurious. Unlike many Westin hotels, you didn't have to pay to use the gym, which was a big plus. The staff were really friendly, and the rooms were large and comfortable. The one we stayed in had a full sized kitchen, and we took advantage and made our own breakfast. It's also close to a high-end food court where you can grab some lunch. If you're in the area, it's a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beware Rooms Over Entrance”
Reviews.Author: rufuswashere
Reviews.Content: Checked in relatively early (1:30pm), went to have lunch, then up to my room. I immediately realized that the room -- located right above the entrance -- had loudly transmitted conversation, music, car doors slamming, etc from people coming and going. It was remarkably uninsulated from sound. I called to ask for a room change (just for something not right over the entrance), was put on a prolonged hold, then spoke with a front desk person who said she would contact me if another room was available. I called back after approximately one hour of not hearing back, and eventually left the room to go work out. When I returned, there was a message saying that she could not move my room. In my opinion a hotel should go out of its way to accomodate what to me seems like a relatively small request, especially when it is early in the day and obviously the hotel was not yet full. Disappointing. Tip for the hotel -- fix the soundproofing on the rooms right above the entrance. On the plus side, the pool is quite nice, and the location convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Westin Verasa”
Reviews.Author: ACD19
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed 5 nights at the Westin in early December. The hotel staff was excellent, the location of the property was great, and the property was obviously well cared for! Our stay was a combination of redeeming free resort nights and purchasing an additional evening. Our room was quiet, roomy, and very comfortable - couldn't have asked for more! The location is so close to the downtown area that we walked to some of the wine bars and, really good restaurants that are close by. Highly recommend this hotel as well as this city for a really nice relaxing getaway! Bounty Hunter is a great little bar that has a great wine selection and excellent food. Just down the street from the hotel is a wonderful little bakery as well as the Oxbow Market. Plan to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location to Downtown an Oxbow Market”
Reviews.Author: NCtraveller80
Reviews.Content: Beautiful property with a pool, hot tub, exercise room and bocce court. Service was outstanding. The happy hour wine tasting was a nice touch with chair massage. It was a nice walk to downtown which is going through a renaissance with new stores openings and upgrades.

Reviews.Title: “We were pampered”
Reviews.Author: Dean S
Reviews.Content: The Westin Verasa Napa is an amazing hotel -- luxurious accommodations and very attentive, gracious treatment by the staff. Hot tub and pool very clean. Loved the bath soap!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service and great property close to downtown”
Reviews.Author: SFtravelingMama
Reviews.Content: Just had a wonderful weekend here. Amazing level of service from every staff member, great room, nice facilities (workout room and hot tub were the highlights), and walking distance from Oxbow Market and downtown. Will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Great property in Downtown Napa.”
Reviews.Author: JuanECruz
Reviews.Content: Easy access to major attractions by car. Westin is the best hotel name in Napa. Everyone was very friendly and service oriented. The lady at Concierge was super informative and Patrick at the Bell stands always going the extra mile. Valet parking, wireless internet was included in the rate. (A+). Our room was very comfortable overlooking the pool the bathroom was oversized and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: Brockrock
Reviews.Content: I don't give people a bad rating unless they really deserve it! The location, it's on a dirty river next to a train station and by America's best a Walmart! And I guess Walmart and the Westin share their employees because they were about the same amount of friendly! Room ok! Food over priced and small! I found little bugs in my room that I think we're bed bugs! Who ever owns this hotel try again because Westin your not!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in Napa”
Reviews.Author: lindros2
Reviews.Content: Although expensive, this is a great hotel. Rooms are big (many are suites/timeshare-like), location is good (although we were there during road construction - not their fault), and hotel condition is excellent. The only downside is that there was (to my knowledge) zero shuttle service. So we had to get a cab when we went out for a wine dinner (drink-and-drive in Napa is a BIG no-no).

Reviews.Title: “A Comfortable Retreat”
Reviews.Author: Roundie
Reviews.Content: This property is beautiful! Very clean and new feeling. The turndown attendant provided excellent service! When he found out I love dark chocolate, he brought me extra dark chocolates to keep in my room! Thoughtful and proactive! Will defiantly be returning.

Reviews.Title: “All bad”
Reviews.Author: Levy12
Reviews.Content: Room dirty, hallway dirty! Front desk clueless, room over priced= try again!

Reviews.Title: “Drinks for all”
Reviews.Author: larrytodd3
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying the property looks great even though it is in the middle of a war zone it stands out like a flower and it is close to downtown and this oxbow market which is great. So my partner and I pull up and are greeted by the valet they were very nice but overwelmed. We went inside and saw a concierge on both sides which was nice. I then went to the front desk to check in and the only thing I can think of is new people. It took 30 min to get through the process and I think the poor young lady sweated through the entire thing. I saw a short hispanic gentlman walk out look over her sholder smile and walk away I think he was a manager by his difference in uniform. I then asked if they were busy she said know I asked if I could be upgraded she looked around and then said no. I said can I speak to your manager she said he just went to housekeeping I said well how about the GM she said he is in a meeting. at this point it was 5:30 so I figured he went home. I said ok went up to my room which was over a loud area I dont know what but it faced the street. I went down to the bar to have a drink before i went to complain. This is were it gets really interesting my partner asked if they had a GM on property at the bar and the guy said "he is at the end of the bar" he pointed at a grayish haired gentleman. My partner was going to go over to him and I said dont worry about it lets have a good time. So after a hour we noticed he had about 6 glasses of wine and was flirting with every woman at the bar. I said i guess thats the meeting the young lady was talking about. All in all nice hotel but the GM needs to work on service instead of working on drinks at the bar. I still would come back especially since the poor girl signed me up for SPG.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: AnciaB
Reviews.Content: The hotel's location is perfect, only a 5 minute walk from Oxbow market, and about a 10 minute walk to downtown Napa. I would highly recommend it if you like to take walks instead of driving everywhere. The hotel is new and clean. Rooms are very spacious and have stoves, mini fridges, etc. Very convenient-especially if you want to stay in for dinner one night. We had a room with a view on te Napa train and were concerned at first however that did not cause us any annoyance as it only leaves twice a day. The staff is very pleasant and helpful, concierges as well. We enjoyed the hot tub at night after a day out at tastings. Overall I was hesitant about booking Westin for our trip as it had quite a few negative reviews, I'm glad I decided to take a "risk" and book as we ha a great experience. I would recommend this hotel and for those that are concerned with the negative reviews, I wouldn't be! :)

Reviews.Title: “mostly good”
Reviews.Author: tshissler
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Westin for four nights. We really liked our room and the location of the hotel. Our room was very well kept and clean. The televisions were a bit small, but not a big deal. The parking attendants and bell hops were wonderful. We liked everything about this hotel. However, their concierge service sucked. We started calling them more than two months in advance to assist us with dinner reservations. Whenever I would talk with someone, they would take my name and information, tell me that they are working on my request, and that they would get back with me. However, they never did. I called four different times and spoke with four different people, and never once received a return phone call. Four different times, I was promised an e-mail of recommended activities in the area, and never received anything. Once we arrived we never saw anyone at the concierge desk. While we were staying at the hotel, we called the concierge on two separate occasions for help with massage appointments, and were told both times that the concierge would have to get back with us. My wife and I wonder if they really have a concierge service.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: rfamily9
Reviews.Content: We hass wonderful stay at the Westin, the staff couldn't have been nicer and helpful. Just what you expect from Westin. My only critisism would be the LaTorque Restaurant was way over priced for the food. I have tasting menus often and have paid alot more for a great dining experience but this was just bad!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Holiday vibe and close to attractions”
Reviews.Author: Gina H
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Westin on our first trip to Napa - I loved the decor of the hotel, had a mountain-type feel to it, and the lobby was decorated nicely for the holidays. We did have a rather bad view of the parking lot, and noticed that had we been on the other side of the building we would have had a fabulous view - something to note when you're booking. I didn't use the workout room, but for those of you that like to stay at a hotel with a decent gym this appeared to be a good one (not a basement dungeon with one treadmill!). We did the Napa Valley Wine train across the street which was fabulous, then went into the quaint downtown for dinner one night (very Main Street USA), in all a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, would stay again and look forward to the opportunity to spend more time”
Reviews.Author: Paul S
Reviews.Content: Traveling thru town for biz with no reservation and they were very accommodating. Valet, front desk staff etc all well trained, nice decor, well maintained, heavenly bed and shower, healthy menu, great restaurant options. Look forward to trying Le Toque next time. Walked down the street to the Oxbow market for oysters, seafood stew and great wine. Nice to see both places were doing well.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: iWoosang
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the hotel for 5 nights using SPG Free Resort Nights and it was simply wonderful. As soon as I arrived at the hotel they prepared an upgraded room for me (SPG Platinum) along with a hand-written welcome note signed by the entire staff. Elizabeth at the front desk was very helpful with my needs throughout my stay and morning run with Sarah was refreshing and fun. Hotel staff truly treats every guest like a family coming over for a visit which made me feel that much more comfortable. Location of the hotel is perfectly positioned for those who wants to enjoy Napa Valley as well as San Francisco (only an hour away). When I go back to Napa in the future, I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but unless you have to have an SPG hotel, stay someplace else.”
Reviews.Author: hchigirl
Reviews.Content: 2.5 stars.... Full disclosure- we are hotel snobs. My husband and I travel a lot and he's Starwood Platinum, so we love our SPG!! We were upgraded to a suite but it was an awful view of the parking lot. This hotel was nice and the only SPG location for Napa but nothing super special like some of the other Starwood properties we've stayed. If we weren't tied to SPG, I would have preferred to stay up into wine country a bit further north. Â Pool/sauna was great for this area- nice to take a dip after a tough day at the tasting rooms! Â We didn't use the gym but it looked nice but disappointing that they didn't have a steam or sauna room attached. If you are Gold or Platinum- free apps in the evening and coffee in the mornings. They don't seem to publicize this. I recommend taking a walk up the street to the Oxbow Market for snacks, dinner, wine etc. Awesome!! .

Reviews.Title: “"Nice"”
Reviews.Author: Pepi-re-Vue
Reviews.Content: The Westin was a perfect "hub" for a Napa "tastings" vacation. Logistically, it was easy to escape town and wonder up the Valley...and, just as simple to return. The facility itself was borderline chic, in a California sort of way. The lobby and bar area (daily tastings during happy hour) were as inviting as the flame stoked fire fountains on the pool deck & patio. All in all, a first rate stay.

Reviews.Title: “A Westin or not ?”
Reviews.Author: SFDutchman
Reviews.Content: My partner (SPG Platinum level) and I (corporate events meeting planner) stayed here on a recent Thursday night. Note: We stayed one night on a SPG Free night award stay. We think that the overall feel of the hotel is very nice. The staff is very friendly and pleasant. The concierge (2 located on either side of the entrance door) were very helpful. The layout of the hotel reminds us of a resort-style Westin. Each guest is charged an "Amenity Fee" of $20 which covers Internet & Valet parking. As a Platinum member the fee is reduced to $10. We were booked for a Deluxe room - yet we were given a very small Traditional Room (which all have connecting doors to the 1-bedroom suites) and informed at check-in that they were sold out and had no Platinum level upgrades available. This happens sometimes so we were OK with this. Soon after we were in our room, we heard what sounded like a big party or reception in the room next to us at 5pm. I went to the front desk to inquire about a move and the agent informed me there was a group next door but that they were sold out. About 30 minutes later it got even louder, and we were concerned that when they returned from dinner it would get even louder. I spoke to a Manager on Duty, Laura, who was very helpful and moved us to another Traditional Room on another floor. We worked out in the fitness center, took a swim in the very nice pool (salt water) and hot tub (which is NOT noisy as was said by a previous reviewer). When we came back from dinner, we sat outside in the lovely courtyard with a glass of wine and enjoyed the fire pit. Around 12:45am, the suite across the hall from us had a party with yelling in the hallway. I called the MOD and she apologized and would send security up. It seems to us that this hotel caters to large groups - primarily during the week. We were surprised to hear, upon moving rooms that the hotel was Sold Out except for the 2 bedroom suites......which they could have moved us to when we had the noise complaints (and due to our Platinum level) but they did not. A nice touch is that every evening there is a Wine tasting in the lobby - on Thursday's there are also chair massages! Overall, a nice resort-style hotel, situated on the banks of the Napa River, which caters primarily to large groups. The staff is very friendly...but take note - the hotel is managed by a 3rd party as a Westin frnachise - so some of the Westin Quality Standards may not be met. Lastly - the Bocce Ball court was a fun extra - but no signage or information about how to play or where to get the supplies to play :(

Reviews.Title: “Well run and efficient.”
Reviews.Author: Steve A
Reviews.Content: We were at the Westin for a business conference. It is the perfect business Hotel. Well run and efficient. There was no wait to check in and the valet parking made going and coming easy. Our group had an excellent rate and we even received a free upgrade to a one bedroom. The afternoon wine tasting is a nice touch. We liked being able to walk into town from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Free wine taste, great room and wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: Georgia C
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice experience there. The staff was always very helpful providing maps, good tips and suggestions. The breakfast is "a la carte" system and could be cheaper. However they have a great salad fruit and bread selection. The wine taste is free every afeternoon and there we had had the chance to try good local produced wines.

Reviews.Title: “Suite upgrade!”
Reviews.Author: Notourhome
Reviews.Content: On a short business trip with my wife, we were pleasantly surprised with a room upgrade on check in. Our suite was spacious and well appointed with a four-person dining table. The small kitchen was perfect for heating up yummy leftovers from our dinner at Press in St. Helena. The room would have felt more open with larger windows and the overall feeling is a bit sterile. However, the separate bedroom and large sitting area were great! Would have liked two bathroom sinks in a room this large. Overall, we enjoyed the suite and would return again.

Reviews.Title: “Does this stuff only happen to us?”
Reviews.Author: Fifi58
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel primarily because they offered a two bedroom suite. My husband and I and our niece wanted a nice, relaxing room to enjoy after a long hard day of cleaning out our deceased family-member's home. We were tired, and possibly not dressed-up by any means, but we should not have been treated badly by the fellas at valet parking. The valet made a disparaging comment to our niece, to the effect, "are you staying here?" She told him that she was, and he laughed at her. Please! Could this get any worse? Yes. I went to check in and, of course, we were told that there was some kind of "mess up" with our room. The check-in clerk walked back and forth to the back room for a good 20 minutes trying to .... who knows. Meanwhile, there were at least 4 other guests being checked in, with no problems by another clerk. One of the groups checked into a two bedroom suite...just like the one we had booked. After another trip by our clerk to the back room to talk to a manager, he said that he had our room. Well, not exactly. He found two rooms that were adjoining. I asked him twice .. were we going to get these two rooms for the same price as the two bedroom suite. We were assured that we would. We were disappointed but too tired to put up a fuss. Our room was very nice; big and very nicely decorated (even tho our bathroom door would not close). Our niece was next door and a janitor had to come and unlock the doors so we could have adjoining rooms. Our niece's room had a broken light fixture and, after we had gone to bed, she found out that the television did not work in her bedroom. We received our bill under our door the next morning and we checked-out early to return to get back to our tedious work. A couple of days later, I checked my credit card bill....and guess what? We had been double charged by the hotel. What a surprise. I called the finance department and I spoke with a very apologetic woman who assured me that the charge would be reversed and was surprised that this had happened. She was very professional and actually did what she said she would do. So, I give two stars to this hotel. One star for the lady in the accounting department and one star for the room we finally got.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rgnanook
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently had the luxurious pleasure of staying at the Westin Verasa, Napa. This hotel exceeded all expectations. We have stayed in similar hotels elsewhere, but this was a truly great experince. The rooms were very spacious and well appointed, with full suite amenities (complete cooking and dining set for four). Our room, with its balcony, looked over Napa and the hotel is conveniently located at the embarkation point for the Napa Valley Wine Train. The staff went above and beyond with their attention to detail in the the cleanliness of both the rooms as well as the property in general. They were also more than welcoming in any and all interactions, whether at a point of service or in general contact passing through the common areas. We had occasion to enjoy the fine food from the onsite restaurant "La Toque" in a banquet capacity and I was thoroughly impressed. The afternoon wine & tapas sampling was a pleasure to return to after a day of traveling the valley. The "footwise" location of this hotel is ideal for those wanting to explore Napa courtesy of their feet. Fifteen minutes gets you to downtown to find delightful dining options and some interesting shopping. Five minutes puts you at the "Oxbow Market" where one will find a good selection of eateries as well as fresh produce, a bakery and butcher for in room meal preparations. This is a perfect hotel for a couple wishing to spend a some time relaxing and taking a break from rigorous schedules and regimented lifestyles. A joy.

Reviews.Title: “A little luxury in downtown Napa”
Reviews.Author: Lisgmck
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were looking for a nice hotel to stay in after a early morning hot air balloon ride over the Napa Valley. We knew the Valley itself was going to be out of our budget and decided downtown Napa was worth exploring this trip. We were lucky to have secured a great discount on a room through the Napa Valley Central Reservations Service. Our stay was lovely. They even upgraded our room to a mini suite, which included a fully-stocked modern kitchenette, a huge bathroom, a king bedroom and dining area. The view wasn't great but it was away from the elevators and quiet. The bed was very comfortable and we loved the linens and pillows. At one point we relaxed by the outdoor pool inside one of the cozy covered cabanas while the rain fell. Our only two complaints were the complimentary guest robes, both of which were too small for us though good for a few laughs and the presence of a lot of small bugs in the hot tub in the morning, although we wondered if they may have been brought in by the rain. We also enjoyed a great dinner at the bar. Although there were some timing issues with our food, our waiter, Darryl, more than made up for it with gracious service and by bringing us a complimentary appetizer, an additional glass of Cabernet and some dessert wine. The next morning, we were given a late check-out and enjoyed the tub again, even after we'd checked out, for no additional charge. We were surprised to be the only ones using it. It was a short stay but very restoring. We would certainly return again. It's also close to the Oxbow shopping district and some great downtown wine tasting rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay for easy access to Napa attractions”
Reviews.Author: Cathy0215
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful, the service is great, and its an easy walk to downtown Napa restaurants in the new River development. My room had a kitchen set up, which would be great for a longer stay. The Farmers Market and other "foodie" stores are in walking distance, so you could prepare your own meal to accompany that great wine you just bought. The pool area is lovely, the bar nice, and the adjacent restaurant has a great chef.

Reviews.Title: “Vino & Verasa...a great pair!”
Reviews.Author: 1connection
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin Verasa early August 2011 with several other couples. Wow, what a great place to stay and call home base while touring the Napa area. I would easily recommend this property to friends and family. Check-in / front desk - what a wonderful staff. Every day, regardless of time the front desk was there to help. Check-in was easy, rooms ready upon arrival, and friendly, smiling faces! Room - we stayed in a one bedroom suite. I highly recommend paying the extra and get the extra space in your room. Full kitchen, dining table that seats 6-8, and sofa area that seats 5-6. Bed met the Westin standards and bathroom / shower was awesome. We requested a room off of the pool area and had no issue with excess noise during the day or night. Lobby / lobby bar - great lobby bar that in the evening opens up to the patio and pool area. Ample seating and a very friendly and knowledgeable bar staff to help you pick a great drink after a long day touring local wineries and vineyards. They have a small happy hour for those who are Starwood guests; I enjoyed the hours o'douvres although I noticed after 2-3 days that they didn't have a lot of variety day to day. The hotel also bring in some smaller wineries to showcase their wines with free samples. Lobby bar stays open until 11-12 PM. Restaurant - we only ate at the hotel restaurant twice, but the food was good. I was slightly disappointed in the Sunday brunch. It was not that the food was bad, and in all actuality it was great, but the hotel posts the brunch menu and I for some reason had expectations that there would be a small buffet type of setting where we could try a few of the different menu items...the brunch was more like a set menu to order off of. That said, the food was good. Pool - water was a good temperature given the time of the year and we made use of the pool cabanas which are on a first come, first serve basis...but absolutely great! We spend one afternoon just relaxing in the cabana after 4 days of touring vineyards and wineries. My only complaint was that they always seemed to be low on towels in the afternoon. Great poolside bar and food service from the staff. Thanks guys! Location - perfect location. The hotel is situated about 200 yards from the Oxbow Market, which is great for getting meats, cheeses, breads and other grocery assortments. More on that later. Then to get to the small, downtown Napa area its only about a 8 minute walk. Very convenient for hitting restaurants and wine bars. Very safe walk as well; made many a trip back from downtown to the hotel after midnight. Things to do close by - I would certainly recommend that you get your staples of meats, cheeses, breads and wine at the Oxbow upon arrival. They also have a small organic grocery store in the marketplace. Oxbow is essentially an indoors marketplace of about a dozen niche, boutique restaurants and food merchants. There is a great cheese shop in there, a great place that serves amazing breakfast tacos, and a very cool drip coffee establishment. Loved it. Also close by are other great places downtown. Some of our favorite was Carpe Diem wine bar; we met the owners and want back there every night for a night cap and felt at home. Angele is a great restaurant close to Morimoto's. Loved the food at Angele and their management staff is great (they helped us with a reservation problem and got our large party seated). We ate at Zhu Zhu...great way to feed a dozen of people, and at a reasonable price too. Awesome Sangria at Zhu Zhu. The wine train station is right out the front door of the hotel but we didn't use it so I really can't render my opinion there. :) Kudos - I also have to give kudos to the staff. I sent one of my favorite shirts down to get laundered and was misinformed as to when I'd be getting it back and ended up not having what I wanted to wear for dinner (birthday celebration) due to laundry not being back on time, the hotel staff still had my shirt cleaned while at dinner, ironed, and returned before dinner was over, and they left me a cake and card apologizing for the inconvenience. This was a nice touch. In short, if you plan to stay several days in Napa and want to stay close to downtown, the Verasa is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice suite for traveling with kid, good common areas, not the greatest value”
Reviews.Author: Frequent_TravelsSF
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night in October last-minute; we usually stay at the nearby Avia but we wanted the pool/hot tub this time. Both were very nice but there is no poolside service which is a bit of a downer. Room was good size and nicely enough furnished. Add-on fees like resort fee is par for the course. We like the location because downtown Napa has lots of restaurants and Oxbow but people looking for wine country living might like to stay elsewhere. If you don't need the pool, I think the rooms are comparable to better at Avia, and Avia has friendlier service and is less expensive/better value. If you want more of a resort feel though, come here. But despite the fact that you will pay $400 per night or so at least, with taxes, it doesn't feel like the lap of sophisticated luxury so adjust your expectations. Examples: Some young people were hanging on their balcony overlooking the pool drinking a case of Coors rather loudly (and this is wine country, people). Our room view was fairly awful, overlooking a parking lot where the wine train boards. I do have an issue with Starwood to highlight - the Westin website says rooms are 12-16k starwood points per night. I recently called to book (not for this stay) and was told that it would require 60k points because it was high season and only the 1 bedroom suites were available (these are a large number of the rooms, by the way) To me, that is false advertising.

Reviews.Title: “Not exactly a grape hotel”
Reviews.Author: intheairLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: This is a relatively new Westin property, 3 years old. The lobby has lots of stone and tile and hence is deafening when they have their nightly wine tasting. you almost cannot have a conversation if there are more than a few people, and with early evening free wine from local wineries, there are more than a few. When we arrived at the small entrance way, there were many cars, no drivers, all blocking passage. Not a valet to be found and there is no self parking. We left our car and checked in. We brought our grown daughter and her roommate to accompany us for the weekend. However this is a hotel with only king beds in all the rooms, so beware if you need or want separate beds. The rooms are very small, almost European in size which is uncharacteristic for a Westin. Similarly the rooms are kind of spartan also not quite what we expected at a Westin, my wife is platinum level with Starwood, so we stay at many of them. Back to the wine tasting. They provide a nice late afternoon tasting by local wineries but for the one we attended the winery brought only one type of wine so it isn't really a tasting, more of a promotion, still nice though. BUT go outside if you want to sip your wine in peace, the noise level was impressive with about 30-40 people milling about. The location in Napa,isn't perfect but there is a wine train right across the street. Dinners at nice resturaunts are a 20 minute drive and for those that have never been to Napa and expect an idyllic countryside feeling, go to Yountville, Napa, is a car dealership strip mall disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location to walk to attractions”
Reviews.Author: dsi999
Reviews.Content: As others have mentioned, the hotel is a great hotel in a great location. We stayed Oct 12-16, 2011 and although the hotel didn't have much to do with the weather, we had perfect weather, and were able to enjoy to patio - pool area quite a bit. We visited Oxbow Market frequently (Kara's Cupcakes are delicious) and visited a few of the tasting rooms in the area as well.

Reviews.Title: “very enjoyable stay -- incredibly friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: jfmack
Reviews.Content: Had a chance to stay here during recent trip for Wine Tasting. The hotel was midscale but much more than adequate. The exercise room and pool were a great way to enjoy late October sunshine. We had both a couple of breakfasts, a lunch and a dinner at the restaurant. Convenient and well above average. What made this place even more enjoyable was the terrific staff -- from the front desk to the parking to the concierge (thank you Royce Anne). With positive and helpful attitudes like that you can't help but want to go back

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: LReego
Reviews.Content: We were in Napa for a water polo tournament and decided to try this hotel as we are Starwood members. The location, like most Napa hotels, is mixed... Napa is a blend of downright crappy properties and high-end butted up to each other... Once on the property, it is an oasis. The interior is well down and bright. The staff is excellent from check-in to the restaurant to the housekeeping staff. Our room was upgraded to a lovely suite with kitchen. We had a problem with the toilet but it was fixed within 15 minutes... super! The bed was comfy and very clean. The only negatives were that the windows and carpets at the hotel need a little cleaning and the towels seemed small and thin for a hotel of this price range. We also missed some of the normal Westin bathroom amenities like the shower gel, Q-tips and mouthwash. But overall, we would definitely stay here again and try to eat at La Toque!

Reviews.Title: “NICE HOTEL, HORRIBLE SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: Luv2Travel4Golf
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Westin Verasa while on a business trip. The accomodations were nice: bedroom, bath and suite area with a kitchenette and a balcony with a room of the outdoor lounge and pool area. The kitchenette was fully equipped w/dishes, glassware, etc. and included a sink, small refrigerator and microwave oven. As nice as the room was, the service was equally BAD. The front desk lines were very long which appeared to be a problem no matter what time of the morning, day or night it was. The front desk clerks were not warm, welcoming, or cheerful. We called down for hangers after checking in, left for 3 1/2 hours and returned to find they hadn't delivered them. Every day for the first 3 days they left ZERO bath towels when they cleaned our room. The 4th day we left early in the morning and returned @ 4:30 to find our room hadn't been cleaned yet. They didn't give us messages left for us. They didn't tell us there was a courtesy car/driver for use to destinations within 1 1/2 miles of the hotel; we found out from a driver that we hired to take us wine tasting and then when we requested the courtesy car to go to dinner, the valet called us a cab instead. One of the lights in our bathroom didn't work and wasn't fixed for 4 days despite us calling daily to complain. Its too bad the service is so bad because the location is good (5 minute walk to the downtown area where all the bars/restaurants/shopping are), accomodations are good, they have a wine tasting every evening from 5:00-7:00 in the lounge, and the outdoor lounge area is really nice. Despite those positives, I would never stay there again. There has to be equally nice accomodations where service is good in a place like Napa.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay and play”
Reviews.Author: BeckerInOK
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 days in Oct 2011. The bed was more comfortable than other hotels, the staff was great and valet parking is included in the resort fee. The restaurants were great and wine selections were good for a hotel. The hotel is right across the street from the Napa Wine Train and just a short walk to the Oxbow Market, which I highly recommend you visit. The ameneties were very nice, wish we had made time for the heated saltwater pool. Workout room is a little small and the overall price was just a little high, but all in all, well worth every penny. 4 stars because of price/resort fee, NOT for any other reason.

Reviews.Title: “Lacking the finer touches!”
Reviews.Author: Ncoasttravler
Reviews.Content: This place just doesn't make the grade. There are very few rooms, or suites with a decent view. There are some overlooking the pool. The others face the street, the parking and construction company next door, or a little unadorned courtyard. We were with a large group, and did have a suite. The kitchenette was a nice touch, but the dishtowels were not stocked regularly, nor was the dishwasher run. We had to do that ourselves. We did not have the complete line-up of toiletries we were told would be there, and upon asking it took two (2) more days until we got them. I askeed for some packets of salt or a salt shaker, and was told it would be sent right up. It never did come. They listed a store in their in-room information booklet (that was filthy, by the way), and there was none; just a few items on a hidden shelf in the lobby. Ther are no vending machines to get a soda or such, and room service was very high. I don't wish to take out a mortgage to get a soft drink. One bright point was our concierge Royce Ann. She was very pleasant, very accomodating, and knew, of what, she was recommending. Our last evening group dinner was very strange, and really mediocre: strong salmon, and one fatty short rib, accompanied by undercooked vegetables. I would not go back there for what was offered, or should I say, what was not offrered.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT MODERN NAPA HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Viola60WinterHaven
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a week at this hotel in October, 2011. Rooms are very nice -- actually a 3-room suite with a complete kitchen, bathroom with separate shower and tub. Housekeeping really stayed on top of things, replacing towels each night. The king size "heavenly" bed, complete with soft cotton sheets, made for very comfortable sleeping each night. Employees, young valet guys, are all very customer-oriented and on the ball. Our room was on the pool side, and talking could be heard from the pool area when people congregate out there, but it wasn't a problem. Being close to hundreds of wineries, you've got to expect that people are going to be drinking and having a good time. . . The location of the hotel is good, being within walking distance of several good eating spots and downtown Napa. All in all, a very enjoyable week. . .

Reviews.Title: “very small rooms, very poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: heatherita711
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin Verasa Napa this past weekend while on a girls trip to Napa. I am a platinum Starwood member and I had earned a few free resort nights so I booked the room back in June. I had 4 people staying in my room but when I called the Platinum desk I was told that the rooms had a pull out couch and a king size bed so that should be fine. A few days before my check in I emailed the hotel and asked about the likelihood of getting an upgrade. I was told that it could still happen, however, the hotel was very booked. When I arrived at the hotel it was very clear a wedding was happening that weekend and the front desk people seemed very preoccupied with the wedding guests. When I checked in the front desk clerk told me an upgrade was not available but not to worry she would still give me a room with a nice "view". I didn't complain since I knew there was a wedding there and I assumed that paying guests go ahead of guests using points for the room. When I got in to the room I was shocked. The room was very small, just a king size bed and no couch. My friends and I again didn't want to complain so we called to see if we could get a roll away bed. We were then told that our room was TOO SMALL for a roll away bed but they could bring us some sheets so we could sleep on the floor. At that point I went downstairs to the front desk to see if they could either give us a different room for that night or the 2nd night we were staying. They said they would try their best. I called again to get more sheets for the 4th person and the person on the other end of the phone said "oh for the fold out couch?" *grumble* So my friends slept on the floor of the hotel room. I became even more frustrated when we met a few couples in the elevator who had told us that they had rooms with couches even though it was just the 2 of them. One older couple told us that they were checking out and that maybe we could get their room for the 2nd night. The front desk was no help. There were other small issues I had with the hotel that I think probably wouldn't have bothered me had the room situation been okay. The actual hotel itself was nice and I enjoyed the pool and bar/restaurants but the hotel room/ and the front desk being unhelpful kind of put a damper on our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place-so so location”
Reviews.Author: Crazynello01
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent the first two nights of our honeymoon here. It was the first time staying in the area. Upon arriving I had 2 thoughts. 1. what a lovely place 2. where is everything?. The Westin is lovely, and you can tell a lot went into it. The lobby, the rooms, the back patio/pool area, etc. It is very nice. We enjoyed our stay and had very friendly and helpful staff. The pool has a few cabana tents that are first come first serve, the patio has heat lamps and a fire pyramid lined with tables, and inside there is a bar/restaurant and wine tasting at happy hour. Parking is all valet but was prompt. The location was a bit disappointing. Yes, it is an easy walk to many things including a small shopping district only 2 blocks away, but downtown Napa is several blocks and includes crossing a busy road (crosser friendly at least). I thought it was set among downtown Napa, it's more like set just off downtown Napa. We walked and it was fine, but if you don't want to walk much and not really looking to drive, this wouldn't be your best bet. If you plan to catch the Napa Wine Train this is your best spot to catch it as it is directly across the street from the Westin. We did enjoy the short walk to the Oxbow Public Market. You can get a meal, dessert, cheese, wine, gelato, coffee, etc. There is also a diner and 2 small sandwich shops. Great alternatives if you do not wish to eat at the hotel, which is a little pricey. There is construction next too and across the street from the Westin. There was no major machinery making noise or traffic jams or anything, but it made the area less pretty. The walk to Oxbow Market went past one of the spots and it was just a letdown to pass a construction site, even a small one. If you are more concerned about having a nice place with resort amenities and not so interested in having a downtown to explore, I would recommend. If you want a downtown area to explore/shop/eat at I would check out St.Helena or Calistoga (a few miles further north on the main wine drag). Pros: great accomodations, nice pool area Cons: location not in downtown, construction around

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and well located”
Reviews.Author: linkfamily6
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Westin for 4 nights in October. This is a fairly typical Westin, in that it was extremely comfortable, great beds, showers, etc. In addition, our King-bed room had a galley kitchen with a two burner stove, fridge, microwave, dishwasher, full service for at least two. This would have been a major bonus if we were traveling with our kids, so I would highly recommend it for families. The lobby bar and restaurant were nice. Service was great. Workout room well equiped. The hotel is located a couple of blocks from the Oxbow Market, which has all kinds of food stalls, fresh fruit, coffee, wine bar, oyster bar. Really cool place. We were also within walking distance of downtown Napa - about 6 or 7 blocks. It was just far enough to walk off a little dinner on the way back to the hotel. Also across the street was the Wine Train. We didn't take that tour but it would have been very convenient. Noise level was average - we could hear the train and noises from the entrance and parking lot but it wasn't a problem. I would have liked to have some type of guide to dining options, including the ones in the hotel and an area telephone book in the room but neither was provided. Overall it was a very pleasant stay and I would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous rooms but service was lacking”
Reviews.Author: greenmeadow
Reviews.Content: We had a huge suite with a large kitchen and dining room, with the usual awesome Westin bed and shower experience. I have stayed in other Westin's of this level and the room was the same or better. The first thing you realize as you arrive is you must use the valet service which since we came and went alot got tiresome although the valets were outstanding, one of them even lent us a phone charger when he saw us search the car for ours and could not find it. The WiFi did not work very well and they add a resort fee of $20 a day onto their already exceptionally high prices which I find offensive since you can't opt out of paying it. The location is adequate but the area surrounding the hotel is undergoing new development. You can walk to the Oxbow Market which is nice and cross over the bridge takes you to the downtown area of Napa. You can walk to The Bounty Hunter which has the best ribs this side of the Mississippi. the most disappointing thing was the concierge, I tried to contact them before I got there to see if I needed reservations in advance and kept getting put on hold then told to leave a message that never got returned, I even emailed but never got an answer. Once I got there, they were not very helpful, I knew more myself from my own research. We did not go to their restaurant so I can't comment on it. Our room was clean and stocked so I had no problems with the housekeeping and the bellman service was great.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but didn't quite get the cigar”
Reviews.Author: jkamens
Reviews.Content: I've rated this as very good as this is above-average hotel, but I am left somewhat unsatisfied. The rooms are clean, quiet, well kept and tasteful and while Housekeeping was terrific and Valet was a great group of guys and check-in was smooth, the hotel lacks in good service in other areas. There are not enough waitstaff at breakfast - one day I stood at the cash register with a yogurt & a cup of coffee for nearly 10 minutes waiting to be cashed out and nobody showed up. I eventually walked off with my coffee & yogurt without paying. Would have been happy to plunk my money on the counter if I could have flagged someone down to let them know it. On another day we sat by the pool on a blistering 94 degree afternoon and the engineer came and lit the fire. It was 94 degrees! After complaints from several other guests, after about 90 minutes, he was finally asked to turn the fire off. That same day, it took about 15 minutes to get our coffee & drinks order and the coffee was cold. When we added appetizers to our order it was another inordinate amount of time before they were brought out. Our server was not extremely friendly. Bad day? Check it at the door, you're in the service industry! The hotel is rather new but has had plenty of time to get up and running. I would go back again because of its convenient locality to wine country and because it is a very comfortable and clean environment. I hope next time around the staff have had time to hone their customer service skills and developed some speed.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and blah service”
Reviews.Author: Gerald J
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights here. Nice rooms. Poor quality housekeeping. Only got around to making our room after 4pm and after two requests. And all they did was throw in some clean towels and make the beds. No vacuuming etc. Concierge service no more than adequate with a bit of an attitude adjustment needed. Mispriced as dont tell you about mandatory resort level. Some guests arrived after 5pm and their rooms not ready. Not a comeback.

Reviews.Title: “Napa weekend”
Reviews.Author: jwjw57
Reviews.Content: Checked in with 4 other couples for a 30th anniversary party! I was pleasantly surprised as this is a very nice property. Room was very clean and had no problem with service. I am not giving this a full excellent review because I was the travel agent for the group and called ahead to make sure the couple celebrating the anniversary go upgraded if possible and had wanted to send them a welcome gift. I was assured they would get upgraded and a gift as well. (chocolates). The other couple they checked in with got the upgrade and no gift. They did remedy the gift part and the other couple gave them their upgraded room. I also would have like to seen a better bar menu. We came back ofter a long day of winetasting not hungry for dinner but would have liked to eat something. There was nothing on the menu that you could order that would qualify as munchees. All in all it was a good resort though I agree that it is better to stay in Yountville. Very disappointed in downtown Napa. It seems to be a pretty depressed area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bouquetoftulips
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the westin as part of our honeymoon. This is a beautiful hotel with great facilities. Only negatives are the mandatory resort fees (why would you not include it in the price if everyone has to pay it?), painfully slow Internet and the attitude of one individual on the front desk. All other employees (valet, poolside, bar and housekeeping) were very friendly. Rooms are spacious, clean and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, wished it was in Yountville!”
Reviews.Author: VancouverSrfrgrl
Reviews.Content: We stayed for only one night because we needed to stay one more night in the area and the property we were staying at could only accommodate us for two of the three nights. The room was beautiful, roomy, clean and modern. The bathroom was very clean and modern and had a nice stone tile in the shower. Toiletries smelled nice. Our room didn't have a view to speak of but we were only there for one night so it didn't really matter to us. Great little kitchen in the room but it also didn't matter to us due to our short stay. I wish I had brought my swimsuit because the pool looked great. The check-in process was smooth and friendly. Valet is included in the room fee. I really wished they were in Yountville so that we could be closer to all the wineries and restaurants in that area. We had dinner at the restaurant in this hotel but felt that the service was lacking considering the prices (fixed menus). We wondered if the slow service had to do with the fact that they include gratuity on the bill since it wasn't that busy when we were there.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyed stay”
Reviews.Author: ranegrrll
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed our recent stay. The view was beautiful and it was right next to the wine train.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: Mieka001
Reviews.Content: Rooms are Huge, excellent pool and hot tub perfect for post wine country soak. We had a funny smell in the kitchen in our room. They made some attempts to fix it, but unfortunately it came back.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, but ....”
Reviews.Author: claza_9
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very bustling the entire time we were there (two nights); however, we were not bothered by any noise in our room on the first floor, except for one whistle-blowing of the wine train. Our "view" was of the street and the train station across the way. The room was spacious and the bed very comfortable, but what's with having a sliding door to the bathroom (which gapped at one end or the other when closed) in a room that was $250 a night? It just didn't seem in keeping with the rest of this upscale property. Plus, there seemed to be no reason for valet-only parking, except as an additional money stream. The daily free wine tasting was enjoyable (one of the days the kitchen provided a petite appetizer as well). The concierge was very helpful providing walking directions to downtown and a guide to area wineries. All in all, it was fine, but unless there are rooms with "regular" doors to the bathroom, I don't think we would choose this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Gets the job done”
Reviews.Author: I_Love_LA_Okay
Reviews.Content: The Westin is a great, fairly economical choice for those napa-bound travelers who get creeped out by the whole bed and breakfast scene. The rooms are updated clean and roomy, while nothing spectacular. The lobby is cool for getting a drink before a night out. Also like that the river runs against the back of the hotel property.

Reviews.Title: “I'd go back”
Reviews.Author: ArchitectGuy
Reviews.Content: This may come as a back-handed compliment, but the very best thing about Westin Verasa Napa is that the Oxbow Public Market is a block away ! What a terrific place for families or couples to hang out, grab breakfast or lunch. Its a wonderful amenity and is reason enough to stay at this Westin. The hotel itself was very nice, above average finishes, attractive pool and amenities, including a decent gym. One low point : when I went to pour myself a "complimentary" coffee in the lobby, it was explained to me that I didn't qualify for the free coffee since I hadn't achieved the requisite Starwood level. But otherwise a very nice two day stay for my wife and daughters. I'd definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property, great stay”
Reviews.Author: MPTO
Reviews.Content: Very positive experience. We had booked on points but still gave us a great room. Staff is very helpful and property is beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Below expectations”
Reviews.Author: HUH42
Reviews.Content: I have been to several Westin hotels and this one did not meet my expectations. The was not the gratest and the service was not that great. My wife was very disapointed with the lady that "helped" her checking in. She was not nice and she did not do any effort to help us.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect accommodations for family!”
Reviews.Author: travelswithboys
Reviews.Content: We escaped to the Westin Verasa in downtown Napa for an end of summer family escape. With three teenage boys AND our dog, we were not disappointed! The rooms were spacious and had all the bells and whistles. We loved the lobby bar and the kids loved the pool. Everyone would agree, however, that the best part of the trip was walking a stone's throw from the hotel to the Oxbow Market. From morning until dusk, we ate some of the best food Napa has to offer. And, on Saturdays, there's a Farmer's Market in Oxbow's parking lot. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Good quality hotel and close to restaurants and shops”
Reviews.Author: MPatron
Reviews.Content: The Westin Verasa in the Napa Valley is a good quality hotel. The hotel is fairly new and its facilities show this. The lobby is decorated with wood and stone.
