The hotel houses a cafe/bar which serves decent food, although quite expensive. The breakfast menu is decent and has a "superfoods" section which provides excellent healthy/low fat options. The hotel also houses a very upmarket restaurant (La Toque) which has been rated one Michelin Star. Although La Toque is a superb restaurant, its price is likely to be above many patron's budget and thus hotel patrons will need to find other restaurants for meals. Having said this, the westin is located very close to Napa restaurants (e.g. Main Street) which provide excellent fare. The Westin also has an outdoor heated pool and a decent gym (although a bit under equipped for hardcore gym goers). The hotel charges for amenities. This includes the gym (added to the rate of the room) which I thought was unreasonable in today's age (with a gym being something of a requisite for most people). The amenitie charge includes internet which is great if you are there on business. The staff were courteous and helpful but I felt they were under-trained. Their knowledge of the hotel amenities and services were somewhat limited and they often had to check with their supervisors for an answer to my questions. Overall the hotel is good quality, positioned in a good location and provides the quality you would expect from a Westin. I would definitely stay there again. Gym pay Internet pay

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is nice”
Reviews.Author: mollelliott
Reviews.Content: The rooms here are very nice with terrace's, ipod home players, typical comfy bed, great bathrooms, pool is nice too. Just don't order breakfast room service. Its takes FOREVER! Also they have maps for running paths at the front desk that are terrible. They have a ton of stoplights.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Resort Close to Silverado Trail in downtown Napa”
Reviews.Author: beeperVancouver
Reviews.Content: We drove up to the hotel and thought it looked nice, but then when we got into the lobby to check in and looked everywhere, especially out to the beautiful pool area, we knew we had made an excellent decision to stay there. Our normal choice is to go to Meadowood in St. Helena, but it is more expensive for us especially since we can use Starwood Points and this is new and les than five minutes from the Silverado Trail. Plus, we walked into Napa for dinner, which made it even better. No Frette bedding like Meadowod, but the Westin bed and wonderful bedding is terrific. We had a huge suitevand could've cooked but didn't bother. Used the gym and is is fine but nothing unusual like the Sls in Beverly Hills, but we did have a nice workout. The grounds, pool, huge patio and lobby area are gorgeous. One disappointment was the appetizers served with a complimentary wine tasting. We don't eat meat and they mostly included meat which surprised s and there weren't many since the wine tasting was very popular. We were there on a weekday and the property was busy. The staff is topnotch and were surprised the resort fee which included valet parking was extremely reasonable. We'll go again to this lovely spot. Aldo, if you like outlet shopping, the Napa Mall is just up the street across the main highway.

Reviews.Title: “I Couldn't Wait to Write This Review. So Great!”
Reviews.Author: SarahSideways
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are in our early thirties, and we always need other options outside of staying only in our resort/hotel. This was perfect! It's less than a half mile walk to all the great little wine bars and restaurants. We came here as the beginning of a trip down the coast of Central Ca. I'm so glad we chose this particular hotel. It is beautiful, the staff is unbelievably friendly, I didn't have one bad meal, and the wine just floooows. :) As far as meals goâ€¦you MUST eat at La Toque inside the hotel. It has a sommelier that comes around to tables assisting in wine pairings. Try the Ricotta Chick Pea Ravioli. Holy cow, it was delicious. The whole thing was an amazing dining experience!!! The rooms are very spacious. Ours in particular had a pool view with a large balcony, a kitchenette with full dishes and silverware, stainless steel appliances, a large bathroom with a separate bath and shower, a living room with a flat screen TV, and a large bedroom with comfy pillows. It was definitely larger than most one bedroom apts. The bar stays open late, and the bartenders are really friendly. Weâ€™re pretty social people, and we didnâ€™t have a hard time meeting people to talk with â€“ patrons or staff. The hotel's outdoor patio is a great place to hang out and eat or drink, and if it gets chilly in the evening, the staff will light the heaters. Behind the patio is a decent sized pool, and there is also a large hot tub. I saw very few children when we were there, so that was kind of nice. Iâ€™m not saying that kids wouldnâ€™t have a good time also, but in general, the hotel (and city) seems a little more for adults. NOTE: All food and drinks you order already have a 15% gratuity added to it. It does show it on the receipt. Don't forget! We always like to squeeze in a workout, and their workout facility was great. Very clean with lots of cardio machines, free weights, etcâ€¦ We wanted to go on a bike ride through the wine valley and stop at some of the wineries. (I highly recommend it, but it can be a little intimidating at times riding on the side of busy roads.) Napa Valley Adventure Tours was basically next door to the hotel, so we walked there, grabbed the rental bikes, helmets, and maps, and rode off. That was really convenient. Of our entire trip, this was absolutely my most favorite stay. I love this hotel, and I loved waking up in the morning, grabbing some coffee from the lobby (bar/restaurant) and taking a walk along the trail with trees and a river directly behind the hotel. Very peaceful, and a nice way to wake up. Sometimes I wonder if the people who give places like this 1 or 2 stars are just mean ol' crabby people who are never satisfied with anything. Donâ€™t listen to them.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, Great Wine, Beatiful Location”
Reviews.Author: vinonick
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights in a suite with kitchen. Very nice Westin, great employees especially the bell guys, always there to help. Great location and nice facilities. I'm a SPG member and they treated me very well. I always stay at a Westin and / or a Starwood property, I even bought their timeshare.

Reviews.Title: “Poor house keeping AKA room”
Reviews.Author: Roy33071
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel fair view super area in the middle of all the wineries but when it comes to cleaning you room, prepare to wait until very late in the day. Ours was done after 5:00PM we had to wait in the lobby for them to finish. Not good after a day in Napa and all that wine to drink.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel/location horrible service!”
Reviews.Author: jjgSummit
Reviews.Content: Its a nice hotel, not charming or romantic but nice. Stayed in a two bedroom suite and its a great size but had to fight with staff to not have a road view. Location is nice for some things like the proximity of oxbow market but overall neighborhood is not that nice ie. Wal-mart is a two block walk. Now lets talk about the problems wihthis hotel. It canbesummed up by saying poor management. The service could not be any worse. You need to call two to three times for anything! After our third day and second talk with manager i gave up. They miss cleanimg your room, miss simple thimgs like providing soap and shampoo. There is a full kitchen in two bedroom suite but no items like per towles to clean up. Its amazing how lax this staff is. When you get fed up and complain, they give you attitude. I came here to relax, and its difficult when you have to fight for basics. Maybe its because they automatically include gratuity makes them feel like they can act like a snobby french hotel. . I am a starwood platinum and would never stay here again. Westin and spg should be embarrased by this hotel. What a shame. Who is training this staff?

Reviews.Title: “Would go back tomorrow if we could!"”
Reviews.Author: swimomtoo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin Verasa for 4 nights in July, 2011. This was our first trip to Napa. The hotel was really lovely--check in was a little hectic when we arrived on a Sunday afternoon--the hotel only has valet parking, and the driveway was filled with cars when we arrived. We checked in and went to our toom on the 3rd floor--a Starwood Prefered Guest Floor. Our room was spectacular--a king, with a mini kitchen (which we hadn't expected). This was great--we were able to keep some basics for breakfast in the fridge! The bathroom was not exactly spacious--but adequate for the two of us. We spent time at the pool each day-and it was not difficult to get a lounge chair in the afternoon--though the cabanas were always occupied when we were there. There were also a lot of families staying at the hotel--which I was shocked to see---who brings kids to Napa??? At times, the pool was noisy with kids..especially the ones whose parents weren't around! The fitness room was very small...and always crowded--for the size of hotel--it could have been more spacious. The evening wine tasting was just that...a taste---we were offered one tiny pour--that was it!! We did not eat in the restaurant--so I can't comment on that. Downtown and The Oxbow market are in walking distance--and we walked to restaurants downtown. The Wine Train is across the street from the hotel--and you can hear the chug-chug in the evening--which can be a little annoying! Overall, we were happy with our stay---also, not publicized is the one washer and dryer on the 2nd floor---it is free---but there is only one of each--but it was nice to be able to use--especially during a 4 night stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Nice Staff. Nice Room”
Reviews.Author: Traveling_LadyMaine
Reviews.Content: If you are going to stay in Napa, the Westin has the perfect location. A 2 block walk to the Oxbow Market (which is okay) and a 10 minute walk to Downtown Napa. Obviously this area was hit by the housing crash, as next to the Westin are vacant lots with trails for possible development projects. It's not pretty. Pros: PERFECT LOCATION to downtown Napa. This is a new property. Clean and nice size rooms with a kitchenette. Across the street is the Wine Train. Warm and friendly staff. There is a free wine tasting from 5 to 7 pm during the week. Cons: Shuttle service is unorganized and random. Staff does not know where the shuttle is at any particular time nor when it will be returning. A ride can not be schedule. The property allows pets. So look down at the sidewalk when walking. Some guest do not seem to pick up after their dogs, neither does the hotel. Shame: Be prepared for an amenity fee in addition to of the room rate. You will not be informed of the amenity fee until the final bill. The amenity fee is for valet parking, internet access, access to the gym and pool, etc. When making the reservation we were told these "amenities" were include in the price. I assumed that meant included in the room rate. Not included in an extra fee. The Westin should just be upfront regarding this amenity fee. Suggestions: The Oxbow market is okay. Instead I recommend eating in downtown Napa or for Breakfast hoping in your car and heading up to the IHOP or Black Bear Restaurant. We found an exceptional bakery: The Model Bakery. Get there early otherwise you'll have a limited selection.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal”
Reviews.Author: CCbostonma
Reviews.Content: No doubt. This is a beautiful property and a great choice for a day of wine tasting. As a Starwood Platinum, we were treated to a massive suite - a plus since as one of us sleeps in, the other has space for emails and the morning Jo. The restaurant has a spectacular wine list - and the food is rich. One tip - if your room check in is delayed, ask if they have a coupon for any free wine tastings nearby. We discovered a coupon for a free taste nearby - just where we spent $50 to enjoy ours....

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Napa!”
Reviews.Author: Samhope
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a long weekend at the Westin Verasa Napa. There have been some mixed reviews about this property and I wanted to take the time to write my own to tip the scales in favor of positive reviews. I would give it 4.5 circles if that was allowed. Let me start by saying that this is not a quaint B&B type place. It is a full size / full service hotel and it was great. The rooms are spacious and clean with all the Westin amenities. We were in a 1 bedroom premium suite with a balcony overlooking the pool and we had no complaints. We did not cook, but the full size kitchen came in handy when we needed ice or to keep our cheese cold. The common areas look like a lodge and give it a rustic, but high end feel. The pool was great with a mix of cabanas and lounges. I have read it is crowded - we found it only got crowded after 3pm when people were home from their tours etc. But we never could not find a place to lounge. The service was friendly and quick and the valets work hard! With almost everyone driving they have a lot of cars to get in and out of the garage and we never waited longer than 3 minutes. I know the $20 resort fee seems like a lot, but with the valet service we received I don't think it was too much - add that to free wifi and comp bottled water in the room and it is 100% worth it. All in all if you don't mind being a drive from all the quaint towns (Calistoga, St. Helena etc.) the Westin is a great choice - gorgeous hotel that lives up to the Westin standard!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dave150
Reviews.Content: We just stay here last month over the 4th of July weekend and had a great time. The hotel staff was friendly and very helpful. Got upgrade to a great room which only made our experience that much better. Very laid back feel which made the time here relaxing. Visited a couple wineries while in town and got some great suggestions from the hotel as well. Next time we visit Napa we will stay here again. A+ for the Westin Napa

Reviews.Title: “Luxury and Relaxation at its best!”
Reviews.Author: Pantelitsa0468
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous suites, tranquil surroundings, best concierge around!!

Reviews.Title: “Stay in Downtown Napa with your Dog”
Reviews.Author: writeholt
Reviews.Content: We have been visiting the Napa valley for a decade: first as a couple, then as a family & most recently with our dog. The Westin Verasa welcomes dogs and our 2 bedroom/2 bathroom apartment (with balcony) had large dining/family/kitchen areas too. Walking to Napa's revitalized downtown is easy and if you want to be touristy, the Wine Train is just across the street. Check out other upvalley hotels and you'll realized how much the Westin has to offer-luxury meets convenience at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “A Best Western Experience at a Westin Verasa Napa 5 Star price!”
Reviews.Author: trappertom
Reviews.Content: What a mess is about all I can say. I do have some good to say. The location is great, the rooms are beautiful and the valet/bell hops are outstanding. By the way their wi-fi valet and gym cost you $20 a day in a resort fee. Now onto the bad I booked my room on http://Booking.com Three nights in a suite. Before I left for vacation I called the hotel to double check my reservation. They had no record of it. A couple of calls later to http://Booking.com and they were able to give me hotel confirmation numbers. Three confirmation numbers in fact. Upon getting to the Westin, it came as no surprise that they could not find my reservation under my name. They checked the confirmation numbers and found two rooms for the first night. I explained to Sara O. at the front desk I only wanted one room for three nights. She told me it was all fixed and she had put a bunch of notes in the record so that i wouldn't have any problems. The next morning I received under my door a bill showing me checked out. Another visit to the front desk where I was assured everything was OK. Later that afternoon I got a call from the shift manager Miguel asking me why I had two rooms reserved? I was left explaining myself to Miguel. Miguel apologized profusely telling me he was going to personally make sure everything would be OK for the rest of my stay. The very next morning I had another bill under my door showing me checked out. This time I choose to ignore it. Later that same day upon returning from a day out and about in Napa we get to our room. Arms laden with the day's treasures. Yep you got it,the room key didn't work. My wife agree's to go back down stairs to get a new key (the third one in three days). Once we get in the room there is a message from Miguel telling me how everything is OK and my room key should work. I thought I would call him to let him know what ever he did didn't work. I was on hold for 6 minutes hearing their on hold message about out "intuitive" their service is. By this time I am beyond pissed. Problems I understand. They were great at sincerer apologies. They pretty much sucked at fixing the problems I was having. Doretta Welch from http://Booking.com was no help either. She offered me an apology and told me she understood. Well Doretta, no you don't understand and I don't accept yours, Miguel's or Sara O's apology.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: jcbVisalia
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel over the Memorial Day holiday for our 30th wedding anniversary. We had a one bedroom with kitchen. The room was very spacious and was fully equipped for cooking a meal if needed. Bathroom was equally spacious and luxurious. Everything was first rate here and we had a great stay! Upon our return home I realized I had forgotten some personal items in our hotel room. On the third call to the hotel I talked with Shanti Hernandez who said she would personally make sure this was looked into. By the next day she returned my call with the news that my items had been found and would be sent to my home. These were not necessarily expensive items, but she took the time and tracked them down. Thank you Shanti, this was truly personalized service!

Reviews.Title: “1st class treatment all the way!!! We already scheduled our next trip there.”
Reviews.Author: NAD32
Reviews.Content: The hotel and service was so nice we wanted to just stay at the hotel. The room was spectacular with plenty of room. I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting the Napa Valley area. The staff knew me by my first name immediatly after I checked in and they made sure I had a great time. The friendly staff assisted us in planning our days so we could see all the city has to offer and they always had great suggestions of places to eat. Thank You Westin Verasa for such a wonderful time!!! See you all in September! Nigel A. Davis, Esq.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it for a second time”
Reviews.Author: objective12
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a couple of nights in 2010 and returned this year towards the end of July for two nights. We were upgraded to a suite, and our daughter was in a studio room on the ground floor. The rooms are very spacious, clean, and have everything one needs. Great location, nice outdoor areas.We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “great spot to enjoy & to explore the wine country”
Reviews.Author: abotel
Reviews.Content: Very close to enjoyable attractions right in the city of Napa including the Oxbow Market, the vintners tasting room, and the wine train.Hotel has a lodge like feel. Service is very accomodating but somewhat amateurish. Rooms with view of the pool area or river are preferable. Suites are very spaciousGreat Michelin starred restaurant, Toque, on site!

Reviews.Title: “My new Home”
Reviews.Author: Dallaslove31
Reviews.Content: This place was amazing! we check-in to this beautiful hotel near the Napa River and never wanted to leave the staff was amazing and the food was great. The front desk checked us in and we were great by this gentleman name Justin. he walked us to the desk and made us feel like VIP. We were invited to have a fast of wine in this amazing lobby that made us feel like we were in wine country. We will come back again and again. Thank you Westin Napa

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: SteveinDallas
Reviews.Content: This is one of the better resort hotels that the Westin owns. The lobby and bar area are all beautiful and create an atmosphere of relaxation. Very open with lots of natural beauty and light. The pool and spa are beautiful with lots of cabanas. Rooms are above grade compared to the standard Westin room and a very quiet. Many suites are available and are very spacious. While Napa itself is not quite as quaint as areas farther north, the hotel makes it worth staying in Napa and the newer Oxbow market next door is a jewel for good eats.

Reviews.Title: “Great option for families. Lots of room in suite.”
Reviews.Author: gailtessier
Reviews.Content: We went through Napa on our way back north, many of the accommodations in Napa are adult orientated. This property is immaculate, great food and service. The outside is less appealing than the beauty of the interior. The bellmen, especially Balantine. Without asking he arranged xbix games for my son, sitter info, booked a dinner reservation and pointed out where to buy wine and cheeses. If you are looking for a b and b experience, this isn't for you. This is a full service hotel, not intimate but very pretty and classy. You will feel comfortable bringing your kids here. I recommend it and the pricing is competitive.

Reviews.Title: “Parents weekend wine trip”
Reviews.Author: sleeslee84
Reviews.Content: Took our parents here we stayed for three days and we went on the cheesy Napa train tour but it was fun! The food on the train is not that great---way too over rated. The hotel was great--the pool gets packed but it's a nice relaxing atmosphere. We didn't get a chance to eat at the hotel restaurant but I heard its good--might be a michelin star restaurant..eh not quite sure. The property also has a cool bocce court.

Reviews.Title: “soiled linens”
Reviews.Author: steaks11
Reviews.Content: arrived 7/18 3pm. rm 2068. diretcly across from soiled linen room and trash. Hall filled with linen bins and maids carts. light out over table,phones out.Moved to 2075. 7/20. Only one pack of coffee no backup toilet tissues. Spoke with miguel manager. No attemp to do anything. Called after checkout left message for him. No call back and he had my business card. Terrible management, should lose the starwood flag. Valet and La Toque only good thing on property.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: RR996
Reviews.Content: The Westin Verasa has large rooms and all the service and amenities you'd expect at the Westin. It was a little silly being forced to pay a mandatory $20 "resort fee" which gave free valet parking (free on the street right outside anyway) and free room Internet when rooms already are pretty pricey. One nice touch was the wine tasting coupon offered for an establishment in the town.

Reviews.Title: “Napa's Best!”
Reviews.Author: AY-Holiday
Reviews.Content: This was one if the best hotels I've stayed at. Awesome rooms and customer service. Can't comment on how accessible location is as we had pick-up for our tours but nothing seemed far at all! Only little gripe was that room service ended at 11pm which was bad for us when we checked-in after midnight from a long flight (and hungry...). But overall definitely my favorite chain! Heavenly!!

Reviews.Title: “Great for families with younger kids”
Reviews.Author: tfspanier
Reviews.Content: We spent July 4th weekend here with our two kids, ages 4 and 2. Was a great trip away, and really nice to walk to the kid-friendly dining options at the Oxbow Market, even downtown Napa is walkable. Additionally, the one-bedroom suite was large enough and was great to have the option of cooking simple kids meals. This place is a terrific option for families; we would definitely consider going back. (Even Walmart is a 5-min walk away for anything you may have forgotten, like pool toys.) The pool is on the small side, but adequate. It opens at 8am and you can bet families throw down towels on loungers and in the (free) cabanas (this ain't Vegas people). Seems a little unfair since not everyone spends the whole day at the pool. Still, there is drinks and food service poolside at room service prices. Spotted a few out-of-place couples sans kiddies, felt a little bad for them. But hey, if you're staying here during school holidays, I don't think you can avoid screaming kids poolside. This place is probably nice for couples/singles outside of school breaks. We had a city-view room, which def isn't as nice as the pool/courtyard view. Though our son did enjoy watching the Napa Wine train roll in and out across the street. We paid a hefty price to stay here, $399/night. That's not including the (per night) $55 (city tax) + $20 resort fee. Which, IMHO is way too much for the resort. (Dolphin Bay in Pismo is much nicer for a similar price.) Thankfully, they had a 3-for-2 nights special on. Remember, wine country is very, very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “What ever happened to customer service!?”
Reviews.Author: calderongrl
Reviews.Content: We just checked in about 4 hours ago and have already been treated like second-class guests numerous times. From when we first pulled in to the valet and I was left to load my own bags onto a cart to bring them to the room (staff was too busy with the Bentley parked in front of us) to when my wife called the front desk to see if a slightly larger room was available and she was given the runaround by the desk clerk, we have already made up our mind to never stay here again. We are in town to see family that we never get to visit, as we are currently living out of state, and just wanted to upgrade our room to have a bit extra space for people to sit and visit, and when my wife called the front desk, they told her they had no rooms available except for a suite, which was out of our price range. As she was talking, I then logged on and checked to see if there really were no rooms available, and there were multiple reservations available for the nights we're here for the EXACT room my wife was requesting. After hearing this, the desk clerk had to hang up to call back, as he was likely caught in his lie. He called back a minute later to tell my wife that because of the mix up, they would be upgrading anyone who booked OUR size room for free, but still wouldn't offer us the upgrade that WE WERE WILLING TO PAY FOR! Judging by the clientele we see all over the property, perhaps if we rolled up in a more luxurious car and had on a bit more jewelry, we would be treated with the decency we deserve as paying guests and Starwood Gold Members.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Swisswifey
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel at short notice, just a few days, and got a fabulous room overlooking the pool. Natalie on the reception was very friendly and welcoming - definitely an asset to the hotel. The hotel is very modern and the rooms are very comfortable. I think most of them have balconies. The bar had complimentary tastings on the evening we arrived and we hung around in the bar for a little while afterwards and got some excellent winery tips from Curt who was serving us at the bar. The hotel is a short walk away from the centre of town - maybe 10 mins - but its right next to the wine train. We had a very comfortable and pleasant stay and would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding resort experience”
Reviews.Author: travellot1570
Reviews.Content: The property is top-notch, the room and amenities were fabulous and the staff (especially at the Bank Lobby Bar) made it the above-and-beyond experience. I can't say enough good things about our stay. Everything was perfect and I will be back again. I'm a fan of Westin in general, but this was by far my best stay yet. Well done!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel @ Great Price!”
Reviews.Author: WoodlandsDoc
Reviews.Content: I took my wife for a quick four day Napa trip, in order to go to a wine dinner at a mountaintop winery, and just for relaxation. I searched accomodations very hard, and finally chose the Westin Verasa in Napa. The pics looked good, and we are familiar with Westin. Well, the place is beautiful! We arrived about 1 AM, and they were expecting us. We got a nice room overlooking the pool and courtyard. The staff was excellent! We used the Concierge twice, and she was very helpful. The bartender, Sam, found we liked good wines, so he would suggest bottles that were not on the bar menu, but were available from the restaurant's cellar. The hotel had a wonderful (giant!!) hot tub and a great salt water pool. With tax, etc., it was about $300 per night.....not bad for luxury in Napa Valley! We would definitely go back here!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: kceesse
Reviews.Content: Note this is, to my opinion, a 4-star property, so I am rating it accordingly. Pros - Great location, just a few minutes from the many wineries at Napa - Complimentary evening wine tastings - Great pool and large jacuzzi with views of the river - Very nicely decorated hotel with very rustic design elements - Complimentary valet parking and internet (quite fast) - Fitness center opens up to the beautiful hotel pool and nice sceneries - 2 bottled waters in room - Very friendly staff Cons - Rooms that are city-view are much less desirable than those facing the pool and river - $20 resort amenity fee - Hotel staff are generally slower-paced than the city, and it shows in the restaurants where everything is at a very slow paced, which means waiting 40 minutes for breakfast orders or 10 minutes for the menu and water. Service was slow, but friendly, but I can see this being a huge problem with the restaurant is full - Traditional room on the small size (around 30 sqm) - Pool is not full-timed staffed or serviced, which means there are lots of dirty towels, empty cups lying around without anyone in sight taking care of it - Valet parking is the only option (as self-parking at the adjacent lot will be subject to towed), and the valet parking staff is not always present at the lobby, and it can be frustrating at times

Reviews.Title: “Not worth going back”
Reviews.Author: flychx
Reviews.Content: We booked a 2 bedroom suite with full kitchen. We knew we were not going to cook, but wanted snack for the kids just in case. First off this is like a condo- not a suite, and service is non existent. It took us more than 30 minutes to get out drinks at the pool from the waitress. My husband had to walk to the bar and find out where they were or if they had even been ordered. At the same time she was walking back aorund and I had to gently remind her that we never got the drinks....they finally came.The afternoon wine down (wine tasting is a joke) they give you a small taste of 1 wine and charge you fpr the appetizers.....very unclassy Westin...either do it or don't. small pool for the number of guests trying to swim. we ate off property the rest of the weekend. Service at this hotel stinks... we were charged for XBox games we did return and it took 3 phone calls and NO return call to say it was corrected. I finally called back and was told it had been done- I guess their staff doesnt do follow up calls. It took bellman quite sometime to come and get the bags when we did a late check out. He did say sorry- but they forgot. and at The same time we had asked to have the car pulled around (we had to wait about another 5 minutes for the car once we got to the lobby) the hotel is new so its nice enough- but I prefer to be closer to the vineyards not in the middle of town.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel near Oxbow Market and Downtown”
Reviews.Author: smerdlapgraslbinder
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over Memorial Day Weekend and were very pleased. The rooms were lovely and comfortable. The location is very convenient - you can walk to downtown Napa or over to the Oxbow market which is a lot of fun. The big surprise was the breakfast at the cafe. Their version of eggs benedict (bendictios) is quite unique and possibly the best version I've ever had. We ate there twice because it was that good. The hotel is a good value, is fairly new and has all the appropriate amenities. Tough to beat that. They do charge a 'resort fee' which pays for a paper and the internet, use of the gym, etc. This is in addition to the room rate, so be prepared.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Wonderful Staff!”
Reviews.Author: Annsha
Reviews.Content: When we checked into this hotel, we were greated with such friendiness that we knew we had found a wonderful place! Sarah, the young lady who registered us, was so kind and pleasant and she did her best to make us feel welcome. She checked us into a lovely suite and since we had been traveling around California for a week already, we were so excited to find this 'jewel' in the lovely Napa Valley! The suite was clean, comfortable and quiet. And the Westin 'heavenly bed' was just that...heavenly! Everyone on the staff made us feel like 'royalty' and we truly wish we could have stayed more that the two nights we had booked with this exceptional hotel! We would recommend this great hotel to anyone who will be traveling to Napa in the near future, it rates exceptionally high on our list!!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Westin we've ever stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: NoOrdinaryMartha
Reviews.Content: Am and have been a Starwood member for a few years. Sheets were horrible, hav ent experienced something like that since the 80s. Pillow wz honestly worse. Hate to say the sevice was equal. Dear friend with us had flown in her wedding cake, we checked it in with app 10hrs til the celebration. The hotel not only crushed the beautiful cake but didn't offer any more than we're sorry. Very Sad!

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: Blondie2846
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, definitely lives up to the Westin standards. Room super clean and new. The mini kitchen area really helped (dinner leftovers became brunch/late night snacks). Love the westin wind-down (drinks and canapes nightly 5-7). Valet group was super friendly. Downsides - don't attempt to eat at "the Bank". We had Sunday brunch & it was the slowest service EVER. took 20 minutes to get ice water; they brought coffee without sugar - I asked 3 times for sugar, then stole it from another table. Our waitress disappeared and the restaurant was empty. I never got water or coffee refilled. It was sub-par -- do the "take away" stuff instead. Also, the gym is bad. There is one elliptical, two bikes (one was broken) and 3 treadmills. It was a pathetic attempt at a gym, and it was PACKED in the mornings. Especially for California, this was very disappointing. Also, just a heads up, there's a $20 resort fee that included free internet and valet. the internet worked intermittently.

Reviews.Title: “Love it and exceptional Service ...”
Reviews.Author: Well_Said_GB
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Westin Napa over the memorial day weekend & had a fantastic stay. The food at â€œthe Bankâ€� was great, and the brunch for Sunday was well priced. The Concierge, FD Staff & Bell men - were all willing to help us with grt wine tour suggestions, & places to dine out. We did gert upgraded to a one bedroom suite and loved the coffee maker, cooking stove, the balcony and of course the heavenly king bed. We will deff be back here.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, excellent staff, poor restaurant breakfast service”
Reviews.Author: Yorksha
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the weekend in a 2 bedroom suite. Check-in was excellent, really warm welcome and friendly staff. Room size and decor were excellent, can't really fault the room at all other than the TVs were a little small for the massive size of the room. Oh and the bathroom door in the master suite afforded little or no privacy, being too small to fit the gap! If you can get a 2 bedroom suite on an upper floor then I would advise that as these larger suites are at the ends of the corridors next to exits towards the public grounds and the river walk. There was some noise from the exit doors banging right next to our room. Not a big issue though and no noise after about 9-10pm. We didn't really mind the $20 amenity fee as it covered the valet parking and Internet use. At every other Starwood property I've visited the Internet costs extra anyway (come on Starwood, it's a basic necessity these days and offered for free by all the lower cost hotels..). We had breakfast the first morning at the hotel and the food was fine if rather basic (the Sonoma Sheraton in Petaluma does much better breakfasts). The service though was quite poor - it took us quite a while to get seated and there was lots of space - the staff were just ignoring us, it seemed like a game of dare for them "how long do you think we can leave it before they walk?". Service during the meal was poor also and we had to ask for a coffee fill-up. It was not going to be offered involuntarily. My daughter (like many other kids) has an issue with nitrates/nitrites in foods like sausage and ham. This really shouldn't be an issue at a quality place like this that should source good quality meats free of these additives. We asked whether the sausage included them and the answer from the chef was "yes". Not so good - they're sourcing cheaper product and charging high prices. One possible motivation for the poor breakfast service was that 15% service tip is included automatically in the bill - no option. Doesn't exactly motivate the staff to give of their best, and the result is clear. Don't like this automatic 15% addition, it's very poor and I haven't seen it elsewhere. The check had a space for a tip too and it was highlighted with a yellow marker pen as if to draw attention that you should pay it. Overall though - a really nice stay, lovely hotel accomodation and great reception/valet/bellhop staff, wish I had taken a note of their names so I could give them some credit. Sorry guys.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay- Good location in town”
Reviews.Author: findjul
Reviews.Content: This hotel is at a great location in the town of Napa. You can walk to restaurants and shops, and the Westin provided a terrific little pocket map with a 3 mile or a 5 mile run/walk through a nice area of town (which included a shopping area, a park, and a neighborhood). The rooms (mine was a suite) were very comfy with great bedding and towels, and it was very convenient to have the kitchenette in the room as well. The decor inside and out was chic and modern. The only thing I would improve was the wifi internet (it was free) but it was very slow. I would stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel was lovely.”
Reviews.Author: 777rose
Reviews.Content: The staff was very gracious. The rooms were well appointed. Some suggestions for managment: 1. You charge a $20.00 per night amenity fee. Put a bottle of water in the room daily. It doesn't cost much. 2. Put an outlet on the desk for items that have to be plugged in. 3. Put a plastic bag in the ice bucket, They are not always clean. 4. Check the refridgerator temp. it froze my water.

Reviews.Title: “Business meetings need apply here for best experience ever!”
Reviews.Author: ElancoFred
Reviews.Content: I work for a large Pharmaceutical company and we enjoyed our annual meeting here this year. My first experience here was in December 2010 when I met with the meeting/events Manager, who was more than helpful, and even served me coffee while she typed up my event contract. My second experience was arrival for the event in late April 2011, and the service was exceptional starting with the valet who assisted me with huge boxes full of meeting stuff, as did the meeting set-up assistants. Upon check-in, I was amazed at how wonderful the room looked, as were my guests/clients for my meeting. The next day during the meeting, everything went very well, and the food we ordered for our hotel catered lunch was fabulous! Many of my guests/clients thanked me for the wonderful menu. I remarked "it's to take credit for the hotels hard work." After lunch, one of my guests requested an additional serving to go, and they accomodated her with a smile. The inside bar area at night was very comfortable, and the ambiance was relaxing . . . coupled with the wine, it was fantastic! The beds were heavenly, the shower was drenching, and the overall experience here was something to remember! Thank you everyone at the Westin! You all did a great job for my very important event! Hopefully you will provide us with the same level of value/price next year?

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: FlamesandHabs
Reviews.Content: Dont understand negative comments. Currently staying here and service has been great. The rooms are gorgeous and staff very friendly. Hotel is walking distance to downtown bars and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't want to leave!”
Reviews.Author: WineCountryLiving
Reviews.Content: We stayed the night at the Westin. The stonework was gorgeous. My Favorite style is more contemporary. This hotel is exceptionally beautiful. It brings the outdoor elements in. I love the rooms and the hotel itself. My only complaint was that I actually heard dogs barking and walking down the hall in the hotel. That was a little ridiculous. We were also irritated that 15% gratuity was automatically added to everything from a single cocktail to a breakfast for two. We thought that was a little insulting. All in all though a gorgeous hotel and a lovely stay.

Reviews.Title: “Appalling service”
Reviews.Author: Pickyfellow
Reviews.Content: Checked in with family into a 2 bedroom suite. Design of the sliding bathroom door is such that one can look right into the bathroom toilet through the gap between the door and the wall. The guy who came to fix the problem tried to avoid doing anything by saying that is the design of the hotel. I then escalated the problem to the manager before the same guy came back to fix it. The following day, we came back from to our rooms at 5pm, expecting to take a rest before going out again for dinner. To our dismay, the rooms were NOT done up. When I reported the problem, the woman answering at the "service express" said that the time for doing the rooms each day is 9 to 530pm - meaning there is nothing wrong. Came 5:30pm, still no one came to clean up our rooms until I called and complained again. Do you need that when you are supposed to be relaxing and unwinding? No more Westin for me, I am afraid.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Great Service, Great Rooms”
Reviews.Author: ourcherishedlife
Reviews.Content: www.ourcherishedlife.com Our hotel in Napa Valley was fabulous. We stayed at the Westin Verasa Napa which is located in downtown Napa Valley. It had complimentary valet and the service was top notch. Upon check-in, our room wasnâ€™t quite ready but the service staff was so friendly and apologetic that we felt better right away. They let us sit in the sleek and modern lobby area/lounge and gave us complimentary beverages while we waited for our room to be ready. Our travelling companions, who prefer contemporary design, were fond of this hotel that was built only 3 years ago. Furnished with modern finishings and technology, our rooms were amazing. Just like in Scottsdale, we rented a large 2 bedroom villa with a full kitchen. We really liked the look of the hotel and the amenities which included an open concept exercise room (to work off all the delicious food and wine) as well as the pool that had many shaded cabanas. Yountville, where all the wonderful restaurants are located, was a 10-15 minute drive away. Word to the wise, there are hardly any taxi cabs in Napa Valley (which we thought was very strange, does everyone just drink and drive?!) so a rental car is a necessity ~ and a designated driver helps, who wants to draw straws?! Otherwise, there are limo services available as well which apparently would cost roughly the same as a taxi if you managed to find one, especially if you are commuting to and from various areas within the valley (eg. Napa, Yountville, St. Helena, etc.) ~ which is inevitable as the wineries are fairly spread out.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return!”
Reviews.Author: f00die55
Reviews.Content: Great service, friendly, no snobs on staff even though the clientele here is upscale. It's wine country so the vibe is happy and relaxed. Absolutely loved the 1 bedroom suite! Great kitchen, heavenly bed and master bath to die for. 2nd bath had a full amazing shower we never used. The best draw for us foodies was the Oxbow Market 1 1/2 blocks away. Check it out on Google and you foodies will get what I'm saying. Eat there or bring your goodies back and stock your huge fridge. Take my advice - stay here if your looking for an amazing place in wine country!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Near Downtown Napa!”
Reviews.Author: preciosa919
Reviews.Content: We stayed here two nights as a side trip while visiting San Francisco at the recommendation of a good friend. We really enjoyed this hotel. They immediately upgraded us upon check-in to a huge one bed room suite, which had a kitchen, dining area, living room and terrace! The rooms were very comfy and clean. The hotel restaurant Bank was very good. We had both breakfast and dinner here and really enjoyed it. I also highly recommend their Michelin Star rated restaurant La Toque. The food was really excellent. The staff was friendly and accommodating, and helped us with booking car services (no drinking and driving, everyone!) and with giving us tips. Would definitely recommend, however, my only gripe is that it is relatively far from wineries in Calistoga, and perhaps next time I may choose to stay somewhere more in the middle of everything.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay but online reservation changes were an ordeal”
Reviews.Author: PinballSeeker
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a great weekend in Napa. The hotel itself is very attractive and most of the service personnel were helpful and personable. The only real glitch in my stay was that I used the westin.com website to first book my reservations and then modified the original reservation from 3 rooms to 2 rooms. While I received an email confirmation for the original booking of 3 rooms, I received no such email confirmation (though it was displayed online when I did so) for the modification. Thus, upon arrival I discovered I had been charged for deposits for 3 rooms instead of 2. For whatever reason, the representatives at the hotel seemed very unwilling to offer to return the deposit for the 3rd room despite explaining the situation where i had cancelled the 3rd room in plenty of time to avoid the charge in painful detail several times to each person. It was only after I contacted westin.com itself and found a rep there to printout details for both aspects of the confirmation (which were unavailable to me on their website using any form of identification) as proof, upon which I was refunded that deposit by the hotel representatives. Needless to say, I was less than impressed with the entire fiasco, and it seems to me that there is some lack of sychronization between westin.com and the local hotel systems. At the end of the day, I won't hold the issue against the westin, as it was resolved, but I would strongly advise any parties staying at this location to make sure you have printed copies of any confirmation and especially of any modifications. Back to the hotel itself, its location is nothing to write home about but is easy access to the Silverado Trail and a short 5 minute drive to the 29 for the main winery road. The Westin Verasa had complimentary wine tasting which was nice, and the rooms themselves are spacious and accommodating. The valets were helpful and quick, and checkin was a breeze. In truth, after my ordeal with the deposit, I really wanted to dislike this hotel, but I honestly cannot. I just wish the hotel had given me the benefit of the doubt to begin with. As for surroundings, it is about a 15 minute walk to Bounty Hunter and some fabulous food. From there, I also strongly recommend the Ristorante Allegria (about a stone's throw from Bounty Hunter) for an outstanding dinner at a reasonable price. On a final note, I have also stayed at the Napa River Inn, and in comparison, the Westin is roomier and more elegant, with the River Inn having more of a B&B feel to it with a slightly better location for town. Both are nice choices.

Reviews.Title: “Great location close to downtown Napa and wine train.”
Reviews.Author: utahbobby
Reviews.Content: Great room. Friendly staff. Across street from wine train. And close to downtown Napa. Loved the room and the hotel. Will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Room”
Reviews.Author: mom2princess
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin Verasa last week for one night and I found the room to be more than I what I imagined. With a kitchenette that included a small fridge, microwave and burners, I could easily have stayed here longer, but we were only in Napa for a night. The room was spacious, beautiful and had a very nice bathroom. Everyone knows the bed is comfortable and I echo that! My only complaint, and it is minor but worth noting, was the view of the busy street that also caused a slight disruption in sleep for a short period of time. Then there was construction just across from the hotel that started rather early. Next time I would put earplugs in at night and it wouldn't have bothered me a bit. To end on a positive note, the location was great as it was in walking distance of Oxbow Market and downtown. I would stay here again mainly because the room can't be beat and the service is incredible!

Reviews.Title: “amzing!”
Reviews.Author: Lboogie123
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I actually got engaged in Nappa in August, we loved the westin! the rooms were great, the location was perfect, it was a great time

Reviews.Title: “No room at the inn”
Reviews.Author: DebYlikestotravel
Reviews.Content: Made a reservation in January for March, to celebrate a friend's birthday. When we arrived to check in on Saturday afternoon we were told they were oversold and they were moving us to a nearby hotel. Well the hotel ended up being 5 miles away. We were traveling with two other couples for a birthday celebration. The other couples were able to stay at the Westin. I will say that they comped us the room for the night and then sent an email offering a free night stay at the Westin. I'm not sure yet if we will take them up on that.

Reviews.Title: “A home away from home in Napa”
Reviews.Author: golfergal2010
Reviews.Content: We booked a 2-bedroom suite that provided more than enough room for two couples and a dog. The well-appointed suite could rival any condo with full ensuites for both bedrooms and a pleasant terrace overlooking the creek and adjacent walking path. It was a short walk into the small town of Napa and quick access to the main roads to the various wineries. We will definitely return since we discovered that Napa equals "so much wine - so little time".

Reviews.Title: “Great service, relaxing stay, top notch food”
Reviews.Author: PhenomDiva
Reviews.Content: My friends and I celebrated the New Year holiday at the Westin and had a fabulous time. We travel to Napa from Chicago 5-6 times per year and are so glad to have found the Westin Verasa. So great to have a fabulous Starwood property in the heart of wine country. I really enjoy staying in downtown Napa as there are awesome dining options and wine tasting within walking distance. Dining at La Toque is a must, as well as happy hour in Bank bar. Rooms are really comfortable as in typical Westin style.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent curb appeal, it gets better once you're inside”
Reviews.Author: Kitalexi
Reviews.Content: Our intent was to stay one night at the Westin for one night and switch to another for the weekend. That didn't last long. After "unwinding" with Unwind, tasting local Pinot Noir and Chardonnay at the complimentary tasting, we decided to stay another two nights. The first night we had dinner in "Bank", and received excellent service from Daryl and Lou, who knew the menu well and made great recommendations. The bar/lounge are is well designed and spills out onto a patio with an outdoor fireplace and a great view, allowing Bank to double its seating in when it's warm outside. We were upgraded to a King Suite with a kitchen. This room has a great view, a balcony, and lots of space. For two- it even seemed large. Westin beds never disappoint and these were no exception. Great sleep quality. Location is premium, close to old town and great restaurants and shopping. One little annoyance- the ladies voice on the elevator. With only four floors, most guests can figure out where they are. No need for her annoying reminder which floor we're on or whether we're going up or down.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: mrsslovestotravel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here at the Westin Napa Verasa from January 6-8, 2011 for a special occasion. When we checked in everyone was friendly and made sure to mention that there was complimentary wine tasting in the lobby during our stay. The room itself was great! We had a one bedroom suite with a kitchenette. The kitchenette contained a small dishwasher, a 2 top flat burner stove, a mini frig, and microwave. They also provided dishes and silverware. Never used any of it except the frig. This had the biggest balcony I have ever seen for a hotel room. The view was gorgeous too! The bed was comfortable, the shower was relaxing, and I could have stayed an entire week. The bathroom was especially big! I did notice there was no hand soap in the bathroom, but when we called they brought it right up. Close to everything and I would not hesitate to stay here again! Loved it!! Happy Traveling!!

Reviews.Title: “Value without compromising luxury”
Reviews.Author: caazmark
Reviews.Content: I dare you to find a better deal in the Napa/Sonoma valleys. Very nice hotel with a great gym, pool area, and restaurant (one of the few restaurants in America with a Michelin star). Rooms are great with the option of one and two bedroom suites (great accomodations for family). Hotel is on the southern edge of the wine country so expect to drive 10-30 minutes to the towns of Yountville, St. Helena, or Calistoga. If you want to visit different towns, wineries, and restaurants then you'd have to drive no matter where you stay so this location isn't an issue. Given the price, I almost gave this hotel a 5.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: amynade
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last weekend with a friend and loved it. Sadly it was only for one night but the next time Iâ€™m in Napa I will for sure stay there. It seems the hotel is very new. The bedrooms are spacious. There was plenty of room in the large washroom and the shower is oversized and remarkable. The service at check in was great and they were very helpful with obtaining taxis and anything else we needed. The location of the Westin canâ€™t be beat. It is walking distance to Model Bakery (try the English Muffins) and the Oxbow Market â€“ every place in the market is great. Try Grahamâ€™s Takeaway for tasty sandwiches to snack on in between your winery visits. Or check out Hogg Island Oyster Company for some great Oysters and a glass of bubbles. Great hotel â€“ I canâ€™t wait to go back and stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Pefect for visiting Napa with a toddler. Clean, modern, comfortable, great location.”
Reviews.Author: AMindfulLife
Reviews.Content: Location: Excellent, walking distance to Oxbow Public market and downtown Napa. Short drive to Yountville and St. Helena. Family Friendly: Very. Suites with kitchens, clean, balconies, pool, bocce court. Service: Valet and front desk staff are very pleasant and helpful. Room Service staff seemed slightly less friendly. Sleeping: Beds were extremely comfortable. Bathrooms: Clean. Good water pressure. Good quality toilet paper. Kitchen: Clean and well equip. Parking: Only valet, but it is free and the staff is very friendly and helpful. Not only do they have 1 and 2 bedroom suites, but the suites come with kitchens â€“ a huge plus when traveling with young kids. The hotel is only a little over 2 years old, everything still feels modern, new and clean. The staff is very pleasant and the location is great. Honestly, we felt quite comfortable there immediately and it really met all of our needs. We feel like we got a great deal as well, since they had a special where you buy 2 nights and get the 3rd free! With our Starwood membership we also had complimentary internet access. We had been hoping to stay somewhere in Yountville or St. Helena as those towns are a little closer to some of the things we want to see but staying in downtown Napa is actually quite perfect too. It is only a short drive to most things we want to see, plus downtown Napa has a lot to offer. There are many great restaurants and shops nearby, in walking distance actually! Oxbow Public Market is just a few minutes away by foot offering eclectic specialty shops, a market and interesting eateries. Across the Napa river are more restaurants and shops. We spent a lot of time at Tyler Florenceâ€™s shop and enjoyed a nice meal at Fish Story. It was also fun to walk along the Napa River listening to wild life (ducks and geese) and enjoying being outside â€“ in January! The suite was very well appointed. Flat screen TVs in the living room and both bedrooms, along with an Xbox 360 in the living room (I only saw one controller). There was even a coat closet by the door, nice since we had coats and could store shoes in it. The furniture was in great condition, modern and comfortable. It was nice to have stools to sit at the kitchen counter and a dining table. The beds were very comfortable. The bathrooms were clean and spacious. We also enjoyed the in-room movies once our daughter went to bed. For even more information read the comprehensive review on my blog, A Mindful Life, at http://blog.amindfullife.us/2011/01/20/hotel-review-westin-verasa-napa-ca/

Reviews.Title: “Everything a Westin ought to be!”
Reviews.Author: FrankDrebin
Reviews.Content: I just left the Westin Verasa Napa yesterday after a 4 night stay in a two-bedroom suite. Had a great stay with impeccible service in what was a much nicer property then I was expecting. I met an old friend of mine there, both of us travelling in from different parts of the world, to catch up, play golf and enjoy the fine food and wine of the Napa Valley. Property & Location: The location is ideal if you want to be downtown Napa. The restaurants of Main Street etc are a pleasant 5-7 min walk away so very accessible. The property itself is quite imposing but has a very 'chalet' feel to it which wouldn't put it out of place in Whistler or similar. The lobby and public areas are all very clean, modern, yet cosy and hosipitable. Facilities: I only really used the Gym once but it was a great size and well equiped. I had it to myself ([possibly due to it being end of week in the winter) There was a pool and jacuzzi which I overheard a few of the other guests saying postive things about. Room/Bathroom: For those who've experienced the Heavenly Beds well there's not much more to say then they are the BEST! This Westin did not disappoint and our room was much more a large serviced apartment then a typical hotel room with a large fully equiped kitchen, two full bedrooms with two bathrooms. Everything was modern and in great shape. We had a nice balcony off the back but since it was pretty chilly didn't get to use it too much. Food & Bev: This is where the Westin really excelled. If you are in the Napa area and looking for fine dining at its best, I would highly recommend booking into 'La Toque' which is the Michelin rated restaurant which now calls the Westin its home. We barely squeezed in on a Saturday night (9:30pm reservation) but what a meal!! The wine pairings are incredible and the food quality and portions were sensational. All the accolades of this place are incredibly well deserved and to be in the same hotel as where you are staying is a massive plus. Summary and Pros/Cons: Overall this property was fantastic and really checked all the boxes. Great service, clean modern and comfortable rooms, great location and fantastic facilities. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend it or stay there again if I found myself in the Napa Valley. Pro's: Modern, Clean, Location, Heavenly Beds, Nice big rooms, La Toque Restaurant Con's: None that jump to mind!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Always a Fan of Westin”
Reviews.Author: OrganizedTourist
Reviews.Content: My hubby and I decided to go up to Napa for a short trip. We stayed one night at the Westin Verasa. I'm a huge fan of the Westin Hotel Chain so of course, this was another great Westin experience for me. I'm also a Starwood Member so when I checked in, we were given a Starwood Preferred Guest Room. We were given a very large room with a sofa and kitchen. It was clean and comfortable and nice. The heavenly bed was superb and offered us a great night of sleep. It was close to the nearby wineries that we visited but there was some road construction right outside of the hotel which caused our GPS to direct us to the wrong location. Overall, our experience was excellent! I would definitely recommend anyone to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place - this westin gets it”
Reviews.Author: Amymow
Reviews.Content: A belated review, but I wanted to write about our stay here in October. Husband had a conference in SF so we came here for two days prior with our 4 1/2 year old daughter. We stayed in a one bedroom suite. Very spacious - loads of room, GIANT bathroom, spotlessly clean, excellent housekeeping, great amenities, good fridge and everything you need to have some wine in your room - glasses, openers, etc. We love this place. Back to that bathroom - did I mention it's huge? And not only that, it's pretty. One whole wall is made out of decroative stone. So you have a glass shower and a big tub up against this pretty wall. The double shower heads, well they are amazing and give you the shower of a lifetime. Lobby was lovely and warm and inviting. Too cool to use the pool, but it was very pretty if not on the small side. Very nice areas to lounge outside with your wine, they had wonderful fire pits going. Bar was very nice. There were free tastings in the evenings. That would be my only complaint, that there was nothing about the times of the tastings or hotel info in the room - I'm not sure why, but I couldn't find it -we had to ask about the tasting. The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful. From the valet giving us an excellent restaurant recommendation for dinner, to the helpful front desk always at the ready with maps and advice to the maid who found my well hidden cell phone charger and had already bagged it and tagged it for lost and found when I went back to claim it - well I really can say this was about the best staff I have encountered in a long time!!!! If you want modern, space, freedom to roam in a nice atmosphere then stay here. Of Note: family friendly wineries: Chateau Montelena, Sterling, Coppolas (new location - has a pool) and Castello di Amorosa

Reviews.Title: “Nice Christmas Escape”
Reviews.Author: jgregb
Reviews.Content: The hotel is relatively new in downtown Napa. The room was clean, large and well arranged. Used the workout facilities each of the three days and they were well maintained and clean. The bar/restaurant did a good job with the only meal that we at there. Only note would be to the bartending staff - while you enjoy entertaining, don't forget the service. Final note - A Big Plus - The 'resort fee', while expected, covered valet parking and high speed internet (wired and wireless) for $20 per day. This is a huge improvement over the hotels that nickel and dime you to death for these services. We recently stayed at a Sacramento downtown hotel where the valet was $30 per day and the high speed was $20 per day, per device. Those are the ripoffs that joyfully the Westin Verasa avoided. I wish more hotels would get a clue and stop gouging loyal customers for these items. We are Starwood Gold and both hotels mentioned are Starwood properties.

Reviews.Title: “What a spectacular way to do Napa! I would do it all over again and again.”
Reviews.Author: RoRoWebb
Reviews.Content: The Westin Verasa was an amazing experience. The staff was amazing and the service was perfect. I highly recommend it for pure pleasure and a nice getaway. And the best part of the whole experience is you can bring dogs. My dog gives it 4 thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “Still a good place to stay in Napa”
Reviews.Author: kkhart
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night around the holidays. We had stayed here last year and were so comfortable we booked again. The hotel is still very well kept. Everything is clean, looks new and the staff was terrific. The nearby construction seems to be wrapping up. We were upgraded to a one bedroom suite which had a kitchenette - that was a nice surprise! My husband loves the outdoor saltwater pool and hot tub. He used them even though the weather was rainy and cold - they kept the pools warm enough. This is a downtown Napa hotel - which is great for visiting all the great restaurants in town now. It was an easy 10 minute walk to diner. The hotel is located next to the Napa Wine train depot â€“ the wine train is a historic train that takes you on a vineyard tour with wine tastings and meals â€“ hardly being on the wrong side of the tracks as some reviewers noted. You will hear the train if you are outside when it starts or ends a tour. We really like this hotel and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “terrific location”
Reviews.Author: whenisthenexttrip1
Reviews.Content: very pleased with the westin verasa napa. room was clean, and nice. kept running out of towels and having to ask for them from staff. but the best part of this hotel is the location. it's only blocks from downtown napa restaurants and shops. it's very nice after being in the car all day hitting the vineyards to be able to walk into town for dinner and back! and for breakfast, walked down the block to modern bakery. yum.....

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Gem!!!”
Reviews.Author: mich408
Reviews.Content: Love this hotel, would stay here again in a heartbeat. Wasn't expecting to really be overly impressed with a Westin property but I was. Check in with front desk (Natalie) was super friendly, she gave us an update to a suite for free and some wine tasting vouchers. The front desk/valet guys were beyond cheerful. The lobby restaurant and bar was perfect to unwind in after a long day. The rooms are clean, spacious with a huge balcony, mini kitchen. Internet and parking was included in the $20 resort fee. Location was awesome. We walked everyday the 1.5 blocks to the Oxbow market and had gourmet breakfasts and a few dinners. The prices at the market was incredible for what you got. A bottle of really good wine was $12 at Co Momi and they had the most delicious pizzas. The Verasa was a pleasure to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Amenities Fee Rip Off”
Reviews.Author: ukrtravel
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a night at the Westin Napa to take a break from San Fransisco and hit some wineries (although we spent more time in Sonoma). The Westin is an excellent hotel, with a funky location. We were surprised to see it located outside of downtown, literally across the railroad tracks. Nevertheless our stay was comfortable and uneventful, except for the drunk partygoers in the lobby. At check out we were dismayed to find an extra $20 "amenity fee" tacked on to our bill, which pays for internet (didn't use), valet parking (parked across the street), and use of the business center and gym. I protested the charge since those things should be OPTIONAL! The reception staff informed me that they were actually a "resort fee" of sorts, which is just stupid. They are already charging enough for the rooms, there is no need to be dishonest.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty hotel....odd location....”
Reviews.Author: GoodFood88
Reviews.Content: This was a beautiful hotel across the river from the old part of Napa. We thought this hotel, based on the photos online, was out in the middle of nowhere and a true spa experience. We were so wrong. The hotel is actually behind some construction sites and nowhere near the middle of anything except lots of roadwork. Now, the room was great (kitchenette, couch, lots of room), it was close to the Oxbox market (highly recommended), but the pictures were definately misleading. If you are planning a trip to Napa, I would still recommend staying here as it is a lovely property, but don't count on it being out in the middle of the vineyards....

Reviews.Title: “Good solid property”
Reviews.Author: Dad_of_two35
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for two nights in September, for a kid free getaway. We chose this property because we are SPG members and were able to use points. This is not a charming property that you may be looking for when visiting this area, but it served its purpose for our stay. The property was nice and clean, very friendly staff and no issues at all with the property. In particular the concierge Royce worked with my wife to put together an itinerary for the weekend and she did a outstanding job. Ask for her by name if youâ€™re looking for this type of help. Rooms are big (we were on the 3rd floor) and we had a kitchenette fully stocked with dishes, microwave and stove. Even had an i-pod docking station. One thing that was strange was there were three separate clocks in the room and all three showed different times and none were close to being correct. Did not bother us a bit as we were really casual and not really on a schedule, but we did get a good laugh from it. On Saturday morning we walked over to the farmers market and discovered the Oxbow Public Market. I highly recommend taking some time to visit this. There is a big construction staging area between the hotel and the market so it may see a bit imposing to walk by but it is really worth the trip. Just a really nice unique little spot. Only potential knock on this hotel is that Napa is in the middle of a massive flood zone construction project that is going on right in front of the hotel. We were there on a weekend so construction was very light but mid week noise may be an issue. Overall we were pleased and if we ever go back to Napa weâ€™d most likely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely disappointed with the staff and room”
Reviews.Author: kmez50
Reviews.Content: I had called SPG many months in advance of the October 8th weekend. I was reserving 3 rooms with a river view for a 50th Birthday celebration in Napa. I was assured that all would be in order with the best available rooms for each of my guests. I called back about 2 months prior to inform SPG that I was only going to need 2 rooms. At this time I was told there seemed to be something wrong with the reservation and it appeared that I had 3 rooms and they couldnâ€™t delete the 3rd room but not to worry because it was at no cost in the system. When I pressed for more information they put me on hold and spoke to a manager. Upon return they told me they were able to remove the 3rd room and I only had 2 rooms reserved. At that time I confirmed the names of the guests to be added to the rooms just to make things easier with checking in, in case we all arrived at different times. However my husband was paying for both rooms and he held one reservation number. Two days before we left for California, SPG called my husband for his credit card information and he was told that we had 3 rooms reserved. He explained that we did not need the 3rd room and that it had been removed from our reservation some months ago. SPG seemed to be quite confused and called the hotel directly. The hotel didnâ€™t show an accurate reservation either, and there was still one room showing at no charge. After several minutes of confusion SPG realized that each of them didnâ€™t share the same information. Somehow SPG said they fixed the situation and all should be fine when we check in. Upon arrival we were not greeted with a friendly greeting. They couldnâ€™t find our reservation by our last name. They found only half of our reservation by our reservation number which we presented from the confirmation email from SPG. The other half was found under one of our friendâ€™s last name. At no point we were not recognized or asked if we were GOLD SPG members. The front desk woman was not forthcoming and couldnâ€™t answer our questions regarding our reservation. She more or less ignored us and then asked to see the ID of our other friend. We presented the ID with no understanding why but then returned it to our friend. Then she presented a card key for my friendâ€™s room. When we asked about our room she told us there was a problem with the card key machine and couldnâ€™t assign us a room. We asked what should we do and she didnâ€™t know. My husband informed her we would be in our friendâ€™s room and to please call us when she could provide a room key. After 30 or 40 minutes we called down to the front desk and was met with a rude women who didnâ€™t want to listen to why we were calling asking if our room was ready yet since we calling from a room. After a difficult conversation we were told a bellman would bring up a key card. And he did come up right away. We asked where our room was and was told it was across the hall. Upon entering th new room it was clear this was not what we reserved and it had not river view. We didnâ€™t think it was worth the effort to change rooms and just moved in. We were never apologized to and no one ever said anything about the mix up upon check in. It appeared that the attitude of the front desk folks was we were inconveniencing them. On our last day we our bill was not in order. Both rooms were not charged to my husband. The other room was showing a balance. We took both bills down upon checking out and was greeted by a very nice women who was able to rectify the situation and was able to charge both rooms to husbands credit card and actually wished a safe and good trip home. Finally someone who had been trained! After many years of being Westin and SPG members it was a very disappointing experience for my 50th birthday! Especially since the Westin marketing says weâ€™ll experience the Westin Difference! BTW The hotel itself was just ok. There is major road construction in front of the hotel which their website does not mention this. Also for expensive rooms it's nothing special especially if the staff are trained in customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Small room with connecting door!”
Reviews.Author: stoulson
Reviews.Content: Nice enough, 2 year old Westin, but.......my room was quite small with a connecting door to another room. When I went downstairs to ask for another room without a connecting door (I am a light sleeper), I was told they were fully booked and all rooms in my rate category had connecting doors! I am a PLATINUM starwood member, and they claimed there were no upgrades available and nothing they could do. They said they'd call if there was a cancellation.......no one ever called, not even to ask how my stay was. I stay at alot of Westins and Starwoods around the country, and the staff almost always calls to see if everything is OK with your stay.......not here. The room is small (almost like it's the bedroom of a suite), and the bathroom only has a shower, no bathtub. No desk, no minibar or fridge. The TV is mounted to the wall and can't be moved, so you have to sit on the bed to watch it. Lobby and public areas are nice. Pool and hot tub in central courtyard, but pouring rain so unable to take advantage of. One positive, the windows open so you can get fresh air.....

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location, Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: hst601
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed for 3 days at the Westin Verasa (we were attending a wedding at The Carneros Inn) and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Upon arrival we were delighted to find that our room was exceptionally large. The bathroom was on the smaller side but all finishings were nice. We were also pleasantly surprised to find that we had a very efficient kitchen including a fridge, sink, full set of flatware, glassware and dishes. There was also a sizable living room area and a small balcony that provided nice views. From the Westin you can walk to the Oxbow Market (we did so and really enjoyed ourselves, we had a lovely breakfast and a wonderful time sampling everything in the market!) and we never had problems getting our car from the valet in a timely manner when we decided to visit the vineyards. The pool, hot tub and outdoor area was cozy and well-appointed. We took our son for an evening swim (they claim the pool is heated and maintained at 68 degrees but it really felt much cooler. This was fine, our toddler didn't mind) and the hot tub area was "hopping", lots of thirty-somethings enjoying an evening cocktail. There is also an outdoor area where you can enjoy an evening beverage. The hotel bar was also fun; after the wedding we gathered there and had a great time. Room service was surprisingly delicious (I highly recommend the veggie sandwich) and arrived quickly. We were impressed. My only complaint is the lack of a spa. I desperately needed a massage and although the concierge is happy to set you up with a local masseuse I called the recommended spa and they were closed for the day (6pm). I would've been fine with having a sauna or steam room to relax in but alas, neither was available either. It seemed a waste to have such a relaxing environment but not have a spa. All in all it was a very pleasant stay at the Westin Verasa. Would recommend to other travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: Unendinggrace
Reviews.Content: All of the hotel staff were very friendly and welcoming. I left something in the car that I needed in a hurry, and one of the valets literally ran to the car to bring it to me in a flash. The room was beautiful, very modern and clean-looking. We only stayed for one night and I wished we were staying longer. The location was very convenient for us. Directly across the parking lot from the Napa Wine Train which is what brought us to this area. Loved the warm, friendly service and the quality of the room was well worth the price to us. We would definitely consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “A Fabulous Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: winelvr83
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin for 3 nights while we celebrated my 50th birthday touring Napa Valley. The rooms are large, I believe each one has a kitchenette and are clean, quiet and seem relatively new. The staff is very accommodating and friendly esp. the valet service who couldn't have smiled more, run to get your car faster and been more pleasant. We ate dinner in the wonderful hotel restaurant "La Toque" and it was superb. We generally do not eat in hotel restaurants but this one is wonderful (and we are foodies). We were able to bring in our own wine that we purchased at several wineries and they were very accepting of this charging a 20$ corkage fee.
