For breakfast we ate at The Bank rest. also in the hotel and it too was delicious esp. the poached eggs on corn muffins and a chorizo sauce. All in all, it was a fantastic hotel, in a perfect location directly across from the Wine Train (which we didn't take) and a quick walk to town (which you need to do to justify all the eating and drinking one does in Napa) , clean, friendly, and new.

Reviews.Title: “A luxurious home base to explore California's wine country”
Reviews.Author: lbh1611
Reviews.Content: Brand new gorgeous resort in the heart of California wine country. From the valet parking attendants to the waitstaff you are treated like royalty. Beautiful property with all the amenities you could want. Great breakfasts!

Reviews.Title: “Great labour day weekend”
Reviews.Author: Leatherfeather
Reviews.Content: We were a little nervous about the 'noise' referred to in other reviews - no idea what they were taking about. We had a fab room looking out on the river - soo relaxing! We had a great weekend staying here. Napa is a great little town with some great restaurants and a cool small town feel about alot of it. If you want to go to Mapa and not be under pressure to visit winery after winery and just relax, I would really recommend this place. Great location, great staff, nice surroundings if a little expensive!

Reviews.Title: “Low-end Westin with questionable prior reviews.”
Reviews.Author: VIPbeachguest
Reviews.Content: The previous reviews state great location but fail to mention that the area around the hotel is under total road construction. You get to it through a bank parking lot with no signs or wait in traffic to get to it the other way. Took us longer to get to the hotel from downtown Napa than it did from SF to Napa. Had two rooms. One smelled heavily of bug spray that is still leaving us with head aches. Ants were everywhere. Check in was terrible, they could have cared less. Said the pool was heated but was cold. The hot tub water was too gross to get in, it looked like a foam bath. Room service was terrible, 40 minutes for coffee. No vending machines so you had to drive down the street for snacks. Room service food took forever and had to be sent back. One of the stranger rooms that I have be given, the walls were taller than the room was wide. I give the bathroom 5 stars since it was the only thing proportional sized. But the shower had mold on the grout. The Napa river views are pretty much where the homeless people hangout and fish. I stayed at the Westin Le Meridian Shanghai and the Westin in Vancouver this year and many others over the years. This is not their best in any way. Not many other choices in Napa except one or two better than this. I would recommend not to stay in Napa. The Westin is just down the street from Wal-Mart. Too many other nicer places to stay within 10 miles or so at lower cost. The. Valet was good, but not much else.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel with a great location”
Reviews.Author: cassieblut1
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay in Napa, I would recommend this hotel. We had stayed for two noghts and had a wonderful experience. It has a great location with easy access to The Wine Train, the market, and downtown. Having never been to Napa valley, it seemed like this was a good choice and we were not displeased. My only caution to those new visitors, like ouselves, is that the town of Napa is certainly not the most quaint one in the Valley. Napa does have great restaurants, but I would choose St. Helena for its quaintness and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Mission-style Hotel in downtown Napa!”
Reviews.Author: Mallard1970
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal online for this hotel so I was somewhat skeptical, but the Westin brand is usually consistent so we went for it. What a GREAT hotel! Wonderfully decorated, nice salt water pool, 20 person hot tub, open and beautiful lobby, clean and comfortable rooms with Westin's fabulous Heavenly Bed & Bath. Quaint bakeries and restaurants within walking distance and of course, close to many wineries. Across the street from the Napa Valley Wine Train. This hotel needs to be on your list next time you're in Napa!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service at Westin Napa”
Reviews.Author: travelerit
Reviews.Content: I had two 1 bedroom suites for a wine tasting weekend. The rooms were very nice, but I wouldn't say they were spectacular. They have kind of an old school feel to them. The service is excellent though. Every request was met with utmost speed. This is very important to me. The location of the hotel is ideal, right near all of the tasting rooms and restaurants in downtown Napa. Overall, I highly recommend this hotel. It may be a little over priced, but the service makes it all worthwhile. The food is good too. The Bank restaurant and room service were beautiful. Internet access was not great, but it worked.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: AlexaR
Reviews.Content: The hotel is relatively new and beautiful. Beautiful setting and excellent location, in walking distance to downtown napa. Rooms are huge and have kitchens, living room, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Good for Napa but Nothing Special”
Reviews.Author: FlyOneWorld
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here many times. First off allow me to vent about what I find offensive. 1. A $20 per day resort fee for parking and the world's SLOWEST internet. 2. Traditional rooms have no charm and feel like a hospital. (many rooms are suites) 3. Prices are high in warm weather months for the quality received. 4. Service is very spotty especially the bell desk and valet. What you can consider in making your decision... 1. The location is within walking range of many good restaurants like Coles and Morimoto. 2. Most Napa hotels are ordinary and often overpriced. 3. The bed and shower at this new hotel are quite good. 4. The lobby and bar agreeable. 5. Since the hotel is new its still fresh. 6. The 1 bedroom suites offer a great deal of space and a full kitchen which can be helpful. My negativity is attributable to the awful internet and valet services for a $20 per day fee. Beyond that I wish the place could live up to its potential. I will not say it is a bad choice but it is far from perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Westin I have ever stayed in, maybe even worst hotel”
Reviews.Author: wino44
Reviews.Content: I come to Napa at least twice a year for long weekends and decided to try a night at the new Westin Verasa. If there is any management at all in this hotel, they must be on an extended vacation. No one has a clue how to do anything or where anything is. Starting with my phone call for directions to the hotel, they were totally erroneous. I arrived one hour early for their 3:00 PM check-in and was told very rudely by the person at the front desk, check-in is 3:00 PM, come back at 3. I had requested early arrival and did not feel one hour is that big a burden. There is absolutely no parking for checking in and they have only valet parking. Even if you are only going into the hotel for a couple of minutes, you must valet park. As Westins go, it is moderately attractive, but it is in a really crappy part of town. And it is not convenient to anything or for anything. They add a $20 Resort Fee to the daily rate and in no stretch of your imagination can this be considered a resort. I asked 3 different employees where I can find ice. None knew, but the last did get me some from the cafe. It took more that 15 minutes to check out and I was the only person. The person at the front desk had to get help to check me out and said they would have to email me my final folio because supposedly the printer kept jamming. I never did get that email folio. I was made to feel like I was an inconvenience the hotel had to put up with, not a welcome guest, let alone a welcome Starwood Gold Card member. Other than the kid who got me my car, I don't think I saw anyone smile. Ironically, when I was waiting to get my car, there were 2 people waiting in front of me. When I went and checked in at the Marriott for the rest of my long weekend, the same 2 people were coming in to check in as well. There are at least a half dozen other hotels in the Napa area that are a lot better in all respects, including staff that are truly friendly, courteous, helpful and most important, professional.

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly”
Reviews.Author: REscobar
Reviews.Content: Although our room looked out onto construction, we didn't hear it, and the accomodations were extremely comfortable. We love the Westin franchise b/c of the "Heavenly" bed/bath/etc. The staff was very friendly/attentive, bartenders did a great job, bocce was convenient/fun, met great people at the hot tub, valet staff worked their butts off, close proximity to downtown & tons of world-class wineries, and room service was great.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: careerdagger
Reviews.Content: This hotel was not only beautiful but centrally located to the revitalized downtown. A short walk to restaurants, bars and even a movie theater! The lobby was gorgeous, and the saltwater pool and spa were terrific. My husband loved the gym too. Our room which was a standard king was spacious and the ceilings were really high, making it feel luxurious. The bathroom was beautiful and the stone shower with double-headed shower heads was amazing. The front desk staff as well as the valets were very helpful and greeted us with a smile each and every time. I really appreciated their guidance on shipping all of our wine, and they have an arrangement with UPS for pick up--they took care of everything for us. We enjoyed breakfast in the hotel restaurant--not too pricey and very good. The bar at night was a lively place to hang out as well. I did not have a problem with the $20 amenities fee because this includes your parking with great valet service. Only two negatives that is in no way the fault of the hotel. 1) I was surprised to see families at the hotel. When I think of a Napa vacation, kids (and I am a parent) are not part of the vision. There were some families at the pool and they were really loud. 2) There is construction in front of the hotel (all part of the revitalization) and during the day at times you could hear the jackhammer. I would go back to this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “A Westin Bed is like heaven after a long flight”
Reviews.Author: KarenfromMelbourne
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay in a Westin, the first being in Beverley Hills after a long flight without sleep from Europe and I remember thinking the bed was the most comfortable I have ever slept in, but wondered if this was truly amazing or just my sleep deprived state. After arriving in San Fran from Melbourne, we immediately drove to Napa and checked in to the Westin. The hotel is immediately impressive due to the expansiveness and high ceilings. It has well appointed rooms with a separate bedroom and lounge. The outdoor area is gorgeous, with a big bowl of gas flames in the courtyard next to the heated swimming pool We went out immediately as we were on a short trip and wanted to see as much as possible. My husband, a regular to Napa for work had ravedabout the beer can chicken at The Bounty Hunter and it did not disappoint. You cannot go to Napa without having this chicken! It has the most amazing skin with an almost dry chilli coated texture and when you slice it, it runs with the most flavoursome juice. After squeezing as much as possible into our afternoon and evening, well out of our time zone and exhausted, The Westin bed lived up to all my memories! No wonder they have registered â€œThe Westin Heavenly Bed.â€� It is the most comfortable bed I have ever slept on.

Reviews.Title: “Nice new hotel with growing pains”
Reviews.Author: likestotravel2010
Reviews.Content: We booked a 1 bedroom suite and had requested a cot for our teenage daughter in advance. Were upgraded to a gorgeous deluxe suite with 2 full bathrooms facing the pool. We never did receive the cot even though we asked for it every night of our 3 night stay. I wonder how many they have in their inventory if any, They finally offered us an upgrade at 5pm the night before we were leaving, but we declined as it wasn't worth the effort to pack and unpack. On the positive side, it is a beautiful resort with a nice pool area with about 10 cabanas. I found the customer service service to be a bit lacking for a Westin property, more akin to a time share feeling. I don't think there is any poolside service, at least I didn't see anyone when I was there. The conceirge was nice but didn't seem all that knowledgable about the area. when we asked for restaurant recommendations we were basically given a printout of restaurants in the area, which wasn't all that helpful. The Owbox market is only a block away with a few good casual restaurants, but be aware that most of them are are not free standing. Better choice for lunch than dinner, unless you wants burgers at Gotts Roadside (try the ahi burger and sweet potato fries). Our best meal was at Mustards Grill in Yountville, great lemon garlic chicken! Overall a nice property that will be even better when the construction surrounding it is finished. Good choice if travelling with family as the suited are spacious and have full kitchens. Would stay again if came back with the kids, otherwise would probably stay in a more scenic area.

Reviews.Title: “Just Nice in Napa”
Reviews.Author: CMFM
Reviews.Content: Construction going on all around this hotel and it wouldn't have been so noticeable if they hadn't started working so darn early on a SATURDAY morning. The inside is a bit more elegant than the outside. It appears they are going for a California mountain lodge look and I expect in a few years when construction is over and landscaping matures, it will be a very nice spot. Staff was warm and friendly - very helpful in describing the amenities of the property. And providing directions on our way in. Bed was great - bathroom nice and spacious and we had kitchenette in our suite, though we didn't use it. We jogged downtown for coffee next morning and went to the farmers market down the street from the hotel on the way back. It is a great little town and this property will be a good location in the future as the area matures. You can certainly walk to downtown Napa for dinner/lunch, etc, but only in comfy shoes. If you are dressing for dinner, you'll want to drive.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Westin experience”
Reviews.Author: allplanetsearch
Reviews.Content: Our family of four (mom, dad, 5 year old and 2 year old) just stayed in a one-bedroom suite at this new Westin property. Pros: - great rooms, clean, new, well appointed - kitchenette was handy with young ones (hot plate, small fridge, dishes, and dishwasher available) - good location (easy *driving* distance to most things) - great lobby, good pool, nice/new facilities - good (albeit expensive) casual restaurant - hotel provided an in-room high chair for 2 year-old - love the Westin bed and sheets - "free" internet and parking (included in $20 daily resort fee) Cons: - Like most places in Napa, kids are the exception, not the rule...e.g., wen we went to the pool, it was all grown-ups and we worked hard with our 5 year-old to keep our voices down - I had requested a rollaway bed when making the reservation and they did not have one when I checked in (although they conceded that they had it written in the reservation!) - Their in-room service menu includes a bunch of kids stuf that they couldn't deliver when we asked for it (e.g., stepping stool and dipaer pail). Admittedly, that's random stuff to expect a hotel to have. But if they list on their in-room literature, they should have it handy (or so I think). Net, it was a pleasant stay and I'd recommend it to other families visiting the area.

Reviews.Title: “Skip the restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Thehappygourmet
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Westin Napa Valley, while the hotel room was good, the restaurant was poor. Service was good, but food food was not as advertised. Watch out for the half roasted chicken, it came out as two breasted flattened and lacking of any flavor.

Reviews.Title: “Great Napa experience with the Family”
Reviews.Author: marcdigiorgio
Reviews.Content: We just finished off a week's vacation in Napa. We stayed at the Westin Verasa. We thought we were taking on quite a bit traveling with two kids, one of which was a toddler. However, this hotel was fantastic for our situation. We had a two bedroom suite which gave us plenty of room to chill out. The full kitchen allowed us to prepare meals as there is a local Trader Joes and Whole Foods five min away. The hotel was amazing. New facilities, great pool, bocci court, onsite restaurant and bar. We always received service with a smile. We would not hesitate recommending this hotel to friends with kids or those traveling without. In terms of accommodating kids on a Napa trip. There isnt a ton that is kid specific, but everywhere we visited was extremely accommodating. Top marks to Sterling, Cakebread, and Chandon. Great wineries. In hindsight we would have skipped the Winetrain. Save your 300 bucks.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but not as charming as others”
Reviews.Author: cinyf
Reviews.Content: I have slightly mixed feelings about this hotel. The location is convenient, parking is free, the rooms (suites) were large and clean, the bathrooms were redone (clean), and the pool is nice. They had told us the suites we had would be adjoining or next door (they weren't). They told us we could add on a pull out bed (they didn't have any available). Room service (a salad) took 45 minutes. Valet was a little unorganized and guests' luggage was left unattended. Despite this, the service was pretty good; we were a pretty demanding group. We complained about the above and everything was professionally addressed - they gave us complimentary poolside drinks, comp-ed the room service. So, I thought it was fine. I would come back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: NicoleGerhardt
Reviews.Content: Right next to the Wine Train. Walking distance to Main street. Do not understand the $20 hotel service fee just to use the gym which is small. Staff was great and very friendly. Room was very comfy.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel.”
Reviews.Author: JCarlson1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is is a good location...at the southern end of the valley and right in downtown Napa. The downtown area is looking much better after the recent renovations, and is almost all brand new. The staff was very courteous and attentive. We stayed here mainly because it is a pet friendly hotel. It is however a bit too "corporate" for me; it reminded me of a hotel that should be next to a convention center. I would recommend it if you have a pet (unless Solage isn't too expensive), and it is also very family friendly. Skip it if you are looking for a romantic getaway with great views.

Reviews.Title: “Great Property, Romm and Staff. Decent location.”
Reviews.Author: AMP-BMP
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a two day weekend following two days of business in San Francisco. Terrific property and service. The hotel is a bit hidden behind some construction. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel in terrible location with poor service and should be avoided.”
Reviews.Author: Anastasia-7
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located on a back-street in a construction zone in Napa. The facility is new, well appointed and up to Westin standards but the location is totally inconvenient for walking to restaurants, etc. in Napa. Some staff appear to be poorly trained. It took almost an hour to get a simple breakfast in an almost empty restaurant after a comedy of errors. There are much better places to stay in Napa. Only very big positive was the very helpful and very knowledgeable bartender Jim who provided excellent guidance on the wineries and the region.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel and wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: PaulusHookJC
Reviews.Content: I booked a room for three nights for a quick mini-vacation to Napa. I took advantage of the stay two nights and get one free offer online which made the stay much more affordable. Check in was easy and welcoming. The porters/valets out front nearly fell over themselves trying to bring my bags in (always nice!). I was quite certain I'd booked a regular room, but ended up in a one bedroom suite, which was great! The suite was spotless. It seems like most of these rooms face the front of the hotel (With the larger suites facing the pool area?). There is construction going on so there was some noise in the early morning. I did have the window open, so the noise could have been reduced by closing it. (But I'm a city girl, so the noise actually helped me sleep!) My only complaint about the bedroom was that it got rather stuffy. The living room was quite cool, but I couldn't find air conditioning vent for the bedroom. The bathroom was heaven! Lots of fluffy towels. Dual head shower. Lots and lots of space for your things. Robes. A huge tub. Perfect. I had a friend coming to stay for the night. When I stopped at the front desk to see if I could have bed linens sent up so we could make up the pull-out couch, they asked if I'd rather have someone come and make-up the bed for me. Of course! They also took care of car services for us when we were going to Yountville for dinner. We had breakfast in the hotel the first morning. Expensive breakfast meat, but I'm totally willing to pay for good bacon! We had made reservations to eat at La Toque and it didn't disappoint! Each of us had the four course dinner with wine pairings. I think the bill came to about $140 per person with gratuity. One of the best meals we had in Napa (with Ad Hoc and Domaine Chandon competing). The Oxbow Market is a quick walk down the street. And what a find! I could have spent all day eating there!!! It was a shame we had to go out and do all of those wine tastings! :-) All in all, a beautiful stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for families at a good value”
Reviews.Author: StLouisTravelPro
Reviews.Content: Hotel has suite style rooms with a small kitchen area. Very clean. Excellent pool area that is spotless. Food at hotel is average and very expensive. Oxbow Market and many excellent restaurants are just a block away.

Reviews.Title: “Great find for families in Wine Country”
Reviews.Author: JoJosontheroad
Reviews.Content: My family of 5 stayed at the Westin for 2 days at the beginning and 3 days at the end of our 12 day California trip. The room was perfect for us, with a full kitchen and dinning area, as well as a sitting area, separate bedroom, 2 bathrooms and balcony. The service was very good especially the housekeeping staff and the bellmen. (housekeeping immediately made up the sleeper sofa for two of my kids when we told the front desk that we needed the bed space). They also did an extensive search for a missing DVD remote control which was greatly appreciated. The pool is lovely with lots of complimentary cabannas. The location was great within walking distance of the Oxbow market and great restaurants of downtown Napa. I felt this was a great place to stay in wine country with children. It offered the sophistication that many expect from Napa valley, but was very accomodating to our young family. I think its a great value for the money as many upscale places in Napa Valley include outrageous prices. We appreciated the free internet and complimentary cabanas. Only downside was the valet car service (the valet staff was great, but some mornings it seemed like everyone wanted their car at the same time and it would have been easier to take the elevator to the parking garage to get our car ourselves),

Reviews.Title: “over rated”
Reviews.Author: kathyinportland
Reviews.Content: The room was great as expected, bed above average. The value just wasn't there. First they have $20 per day resort fee, certainly not a resort . They have valet parking which is fine except you pay tips for every encounter and they add up. We thought the staff were great. The food was poor at best and quite costly. My Mom had soup which was cold and amounted to about 3 spoons full and again expensive. I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great meetings venue”
Reviews.Author: CJITSMA
Reviews.Content: Great property with a friendly, helpful, fun staff. We held a 1 1/2 day conference here and it was excellent. The weather wasn't with us, which is abnormal for the area, but between our agenda, the food, and charm of the hotel, it didn't really matter. I'd recommend the Westin Verasa to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxation and Downtown Napa at your fingertips!”
Reviews.Author: SAgurl
Reviews.Content: Absolutely loved it. I come to SF for work quite often, but never managed to make it up to Napa Valley. After reading different reviews, I decided to try the Westin Verasa since I was not sure of the proximity of where everything was located. I posted some pics with a description of the room here: http://travelladybug.blogspot.com/2010/06/napa-valley-california.html I also took the 5 minute walk to the Oxbow public Market which was really cute and tried Hog Island Oyster Co for the first time. Was amazing - more details also posted here: http://travelladybug.blogspot.com/2010/06/afternoon-spent-in-downtown-napa-oxbow.html Overall - I loved it and would definitely go back. You'll see pics of the pretty salt water pool where i spent a few hours relaxing. can't wait for another chance to visit again!

Reviews.Title: “Quick Stay @ Napa”
Reviews.Author: cherub7
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during Memorial Weekend and was "satisfied." The hotel is designed beautifully and it was very near downtown Napa. It's about 9 miles away from Yountville so it's a little bit of a drive if you want to head towards the wineries up North. Don't be discouraged though of the distance to the wineries. The drive on the 29Hwy is pretty quick and scenic. Anyway, I was in LOVE with the Westin beds. I slept like a baby with the exception of when it became dawn. Our room was located on the front of the hotel, right under/near the hotel's main trash bins. So, every morning, we heard the trash bins being picked up/dumped. Very loud and annoying. If you are going to stay there, ask to be in a room facing the back of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but stay away frm road facing rooms”
Reviews.Author: chriw
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel;, well appointed new rooms. Stay away form road facing what they call "City View" rooms . Too much road noise and you know it when the hotel has soft music playing in the rooms when you check in. The food fromn the restaurant La Toque was excellent. Hotel location is not great and not necessarily a nice walk aroudn the property. You will want to get into yor car or jump on the wine train across the street

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: roadster13
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were in Napa for one night. After looking through the long lists of B&B's that were terribly expensive we decided on the Westin. At least we knew what we would be getting for our money. The customer service was excellent. We were meeting a tour at our hotel in the morning before we checked in and they had no problems calling the company for us and inquiring about pickup, etc. All of the staff we dealt with were very pleasant and accommodating. My favorite part was eating dinner in the cafe downstairs. I am vegan while my husband is not. I was trying to make something that I could eat out of the menu choices and the waitress told me not to worry and went back and told the two chefs what I was looking for. They both ended up creating meals for me and had me decide which was best. Even though Westin hotels tend to be more expensive than some, I have always been pleased with their attention to detail and customer service so I don't mind spending a little more. Had a great stay and would do it again.

Reviews.Title: “Not the Napa experience we were expecting”
Reviews.Author: mmccormi
Reviews.Content: First off, as a Westin property, this is a nice hotel. Its new, has heavenly beds and large and comfortable rooms. the ceilings in our room were about 14 feet high which we actually found cavernous, especially with a 30 inch flat screen tv the only thing on one wall! The issue with this property is really the location. Its in a construction site and is in no way a resort although a "resort fee" of $20 is charged for internet and parking and is not optional. There is nothing romantic or charming about this place so if you are looking for a Napa experience that includes these things, I don't recommend it. The hotel manager advised me that this hotel is very high on the list of Starwood points redemption and I can understand why. I wouldn't however pay the rates they charge again - its really just another Westin charging resort type rates.

Reviews.Title: “I'll never stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: Zona_Jim
Reviews.Content: We bought a package stay and they debited our charge card 3 weeks before we arrived. That was okay, but when we arrived at 5:30, they didn't have a room for us! It took 1/2 hour to get it straightened out. They offered to buy us something in the cafe while we waited. Once we got our room, we started to go leave the cafe, and we were chased down by an employee and they shouted at us in the foyer that we needed to sign for the food. We had to explain the whole situation to them and finally convinced them to talk to the manager. They didn't have any vending machines for soda, and didn't go out of their way to try to help find one. Most of the employees I dealt with were not very accomodating or friendly. There was lots of car noise in the room, and when the wine train went by, they woke us up with their constant blowing of their horn.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Westin, but in Napa”
Reviews.Author: buckiz1980
Reviews.Content: Hotel has a good location in Napa - within 20 minutes of the main Silverado Trail / Napa Valley wineries. As my review title states, this hotel is typical of any other Westin (cleanliness, rooms, etc). The hotel is new and is located directly next to the wine train if that's something you're interested in. The food in the restaurant was quite good (we had breakfast there one morning and dessert another night). The one thing of note at this hotel is that they charge an "amenity fee" of $20 per night, whether you park a car there or not. It's no big deal, but I've never seen that at a Westin, or any other Starwood hotel before. I would stay here again on my next trip to Napa.

Reviews.Title: “This is the best place to stay in Napa!”
Reviews.Author: bostonstm
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful three night stay at the Westin. The outside entrance is very impressive but the lobby is just breathtaking. From the folks at the front desk, to the valets who always remember your name, to the waitstaff who remember the little things from one meal to the next, this property is amazing. We stayed in a one bedroom deluxe suite and it had to have been the nicest room I think we have ever had the pleasure of vacationing in - it was spacious and the decor was very clean and streamlined. We ate at the restaurant 1 morning and 2 evenings and each time the food was absolutely wonderful and the prices were more than satisfactory. Thanks to a warm weather trend, we were able to use the pool on one afternoon - and for once a pool advertised as heated was actually heated! We also used the workout facilities which were spotless and more than adequate. Our only issue - and it isnt a big one - is the concierge on duty during our stay didnt seem to have a good handle on the area - which we found odd. After 2 attempts at not getting too much information, we started to go to the front desk or the valets with our questions and they were more than happy to oblige. Finally, the proximity to Ox Bow Market cannot be underestimated. We walked there two mornings for breakfast and one night for ice cream and it was wonderful to have those options close by. All in all, we cant wait to go back. This is one resort that pictures cannot do it justice (particulary for the rooms). You would be hard pressed to find a cleaner, more comfortable and relaxing resort in Napa.

Reviews.Title: “Best Weekend Stay Ever”
Reviews.Author: SusieJue
Reviews.Content: I booked a long weekend stay, Sat - Mon, at Westin Verasa Napa using 12,000 Starwood points per night. I am a Platinum member and I was so happy to get an upgrade to a one bedroom. You get the WOW factor the moment you open the door to the room. I arrived at noon and was told that check-in was at 3 pm, so I left to go to my favorite local shopping destination, Napa Premium Outlets. To get to the Westin, take the Lincoln Ave exit instead of the First St, it's a more direct route. When I returned, the check in was speedy and efficient. I was informed of the $20. per day, resort fee, but not much else. The fee covered the valet parking, business center (one computer with free internet and printer/copier), pool, and Westin WorkOut room. The valet service was excellent and my bags arrive within a few minutes. Ballentine provided great service and showed me how to use the Xbox to watch DVD. The one bedroom unit is huge and has living area (with flat panel TV, Xbox, iPod dock), dining area (seats four), full kitchen with granite counter top, dishwasher, full refrigerator with ice and cold water in the door, electric stove and oven, microwave, toaster, dishes, pots/pans, Starbucks coffee and maker, tea and bottle water. The bedroom has Westin Heavenly bed, flat panel TV, in room safe and two robes. The bathroom is large with separate shower and tub, dual sinks. In room services include, internet for a fee, pay per view movies and spa services can be arranged. The room did not have a view, but a nice balcony. Next time I will ask for a room looking onto the river. The housekeeping did a great job, typically, they put the dishes in the dishwasher and turn it on, but this time, they unload and put dishes back into the cabinets. They were very friendly when I wanted to peek into the other size rooms to see the smaller and bigger units. Also, the turn down service has yummy chocolates on your bed and I was able to get an extra pack of Starbucks coffee! The rooms are very well done and the decor is beautiful and subtle. The restaurants are La Touque (only open for dinner) with chef Ken Frank, who moved his restaurant from Rutherford and his casual Bank Cafe off the lobby (open 7 am - 11 pm). I didn't dine at either, although they both looked very nice. The weather was beautiful and on Monday I spent the day at the pool, with only one or two other people there. I made use of one of the cabanas and was in pure heaven. There is also a whirlpool and plenty of towels. The River Walk is adjacent and there is Boccee Ball court on site too. The meeting rooms are located on the first floor. The only negative I had, was on Sunday at noon, I went to talk to the concierge and was told they would be there in the afternoon. I wanted information on the local area and the coupons that I heard about on TA. There is alot to do, including the Napa Valley Wine Train, which directly across the street and the Oxbow Public Market is at the end of the block and very short walk! There are Bicycle Wine Tours, Hot Air Ballon rides, Kayak Trips, Safari West Wildlife Preserve, Platypus Tours, not to mention the hundreds of wineries in the area. The towns of Yountville, St Helena and Sonoma are a short drive away. Target, Whole Foods and Trader Joe's is at the Trancas St exit. I had a fantastic stay and everyone was very friendly and helpful, which made for a wonderful stay and I enjoyed the one bedroom unit. The hotel manager is Justin Williams and general manager is Don Shindle, I emailed them a Thank You note, but never got a response. I will be returning for another relaxing and fun weekend stay soon!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at a nice, new property.”
Reviews.Author: yojosh
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our 4 nights at the Westin Verasa. We checked in on a Sunday and parked on the street as many of the reviews here mention the valet were a little slow. There was plenty of street parking right out front of the hotel which was nice. We were upgraded to a suite that faced the pool, which was nice. Plenty of room to spread out and the mini kitchen was VERY helpful, especially with keeping some wine and bottled water cold. The hotel is very nice, great pool and hot tub. The location was really fantastic as you're a short walk to Oxbox Market and "downtown". One complaint was that our room was never made up unless we specifically asked for it to be. As someone who travels a LOT for work and pleasure I thought this was very strange. It wasn't made clear when we checked in nor could we figure out if it was an environmental thing or they were short staffed.

Reviews.Title: “Westin Verasa Valentine's Day Weekend a Smash!”
Reviews.Author: MountPleasant
Reviews.Content: The wife and I planned a trip out to Napa for VDay weekend this year. I am a big time Starwood guy during the week for work so we used our points. The hotel is top notch! We were upgraded as Platinum members upon check-in. They put us in a Suite on the 2nd floor in a corner room. Separate bedroom, huge sprawing bathroom, small workable kitchen with stove, refrigerator, sink..and the lounge area. The architecture and use of stone inside the rooms really makes them look great. The concierge is fabulous! Use them! They have discount and "free" visit vouchers to many of the top wineries in and around Napa. You are walking distance to the Oxbow Market! They have a great raw bar! The Oxbow Wine Merchant is a great place to get some cheese to go with that wine you just picked up from your favorite spot in say Stags Leap. You can also sit in here and do tastings-they will pair their local wines with great cheese, breads, and spreads. Taylors Automatic is right next door and perfect for a quick bite! Location to the Vineyards is perfect. Getting up 29 or going up the Silverado Trail...they are both accessed within 1 mile from the hotel. You lastly have the great proximity to walking to downtown Napa! I put this hotel up there with any other Westin. The bar and open sitting area are great as well. We didn't do the heated pool but it looked great during after a long day of wine tastings.

Reviews.Title: “Not so heavenly beds”
Reviews.Author: foxam
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival I was very impressed with this hotel. It is really beautiful...mainly because it is brand new. I loved how it embraced the wine country, ie. wine bottles on display behind the check-in desk. The rooms are very spacious and very clean. My one complaint has to do with the beds and the pillows. One of the main reasons I like to stay at Westin hotels is because of their heavenly beds. This hotel does not seem to have the heavenly beds or pillows which I found odd because it is so new. The mattress was very hard and both my husband and I woke up sore with backaches. The pillows were also very hard and lumpy. All in all it is a very nice hotel but don't count on getting the full "heavenly experience". For the price of the hotel ($$$) I was disappointed that I had to sleep on a regular ole' mattress.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Resort Option in Napa”
Reviews.Author: laurengucsb
Reviews.Content: I must admit that my husband and I were on our way to a family reunion and we just needed one night in peace (January 1) before heading over to the condos with the rest of our family. We booked with out points on New Years morning and headed out from San Francisco. Since we didn't spend much time here, arriving about 3pm and only just lounging around before leaving at 10am the next morning, I can't comment on many of the features and amenities at the hotel. But I will comment on what I did experience. The hotel seems really big once your inside, long hallways of rooms. The room itself was nice, but I feel like it was really plain. I think they could have done a lot more by adding in a little 'wine country' flair. Everything was neutral colors, the room, while big enough, definitely wasn't huge. Flat screen TV, large closet and big bathroom (although not a separate tub and shower and only one sink). The staff was always friendly and the valet was pretty efficient both times we got the car. he was also helpful with directions. My husband and I both will come back to experience this hotel fully, we noticed a huge outdoor pool and large spa, but there was a complaint about the noise coming from the spa late at night. The building is in a U shape with the pool and spa in the middle and even though it didn't sound like the people in the hot tub were speaking to loudly, it carried easily to my window. Really no big complaints on this one, but again, we didn't get to experience much of it. Really looking forward to another stay in the future though, although I'm sure it will be expensive as it wasn't even a deal in off-season.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time / Place”
Reviews.Author: TruckCompany2025
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed this hotel. Very nice, convenient and friendly. I was definately pleased with my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: Number70
Reviews.Content: The Westin Verasa was a very nice hotel. The standard room had nice high ceilings with a nice bathroom. The staff was friendly and had good recommendations for dinner. The only downside is that it is at the end of a street with very little going on, so you feel slightly isolated, but it is a 10-15 minute walk from downtown Napa.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel; Service can be improved!”
Reviews.Author: kkl2856
Reviews.Content: We spent a night here during our weekend trip to Napa. . First impression upon arrival was, well, choas. Valet parking was busy and since there was only one guy working, we had to wait for a while. Couldn't find any bellman around to help with luggage. Check-in desk is close to the front door so it took a while to figure out which line of people were waiting for check-in. Once we checked in, it was quite good. The hotel is quite new, so eveyrthing looks fantastic. We got an excellent rate of $360 for a two bedroom suite with a full kitchen. It's a steal! I love the bathroom, and the heavenly bed! After wine and cheese in the room, we went to the restaurant to have a light meal. Took the waitress' advice for a cocktail, which turned out to be terrible. The manager happily took it off the bill, we were very pleasantly surprised. I don't know how often rooms are being cleaned. Every time we walked by the hallway, there were trashes lying around, which I find very unpleasant as the hotel is such a nice new property. The kitchens can be a little better stocked. Overall, it was a good stay. I can't wait to return, especially if I can find the same rate. I do hope to see improvement next time I visit.

Reviews.Title: “Not at all what we expected, horrible experience”
Reviews.Author: sindbn
Reviews.Content: So nice place, that's about it. We had a half of roll of toilet paper in our room and no replacement! Unbelievable! Two of the lights were out, and this is just not the expectation of this hotel. The worst part is that they charged us TWICE for a one night stay. They still have not got back to me about the charge. I have called them three times today with the answer "the accountant is in a meeting". With all of these problems I bet she will be in a meeting for a long time!

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel to explore the Napa Valley wine country”
Reviews.Author: DrMitch
Reviews.Content: This hotel was modern, clean, spacious. The style of the hotel is Craftsman. The entry is spacious but rather plain. There is a bar serving lots of the local wines. There is a very expensive restaurant attached the hotel. We paid for their standard room which was a suite. The King bed was extremely comfortable. There was a sofa bed that was also suprisingly(!) comfortable for a pullout. An LCD TV in both the bedroom and living room. A kitchen with all the utensils and a couple of packets of Starbucks. Spacious bathroom was beautiful with lots of marble, glass and stone. What was unusual about the room was the presence of a stationary bicycle, medicine ball, free weights, exercise ball, and lots of exercising accessories. The staff of the hotel really tried hard to please and one could sense lots of great customer service training. However, the valets (mandatory) doubled as Bell boys and there seemed to be only two per shift. Felt very sorry as they were really running their tails off to please while customers had to wait awhile on their cars. The reader should be aware this this hotel is situated just over a river and adjacent to the town of Napa. It is located on the extreme southern end of the Napa Valley. With a car it is a five minute drive to the beginning of the vineyards. The only reason I mention this is because some of the photos give the impression this might be a hotel in the country overlooking or amongst the vineyards which it is not. If you want that (and I would recommend it) consider Yountville, St. Helena, or Calistoga (note that the distance between Napa on the southern end of the valley and Calistoga on the north end is only about 35 miles on a superb road (not so superb driving if you have tasted too many wines). However, Westin does offer quality at a more affordable price then the boutique Inns and hotels deeper in the valley. Be aware that Westin has jumped on the bandwaggon with so many hotels that advertise one price but have all kinds of added fees. Thanks to Tripadvisor reviewers we knew in advance the real cost so this was not an issue (out nightly rate was $155 + $18.60 Napa tax + $20.00 amenity fee + $2.40 tax on the amenity fee so that is about 26% more than the published price). Internet and Valet are free.

Reviews.Title: “Westin Verasa makes you feel special”
Reviews.Author: Terps37
Reviews.Content: We traveled with our toddler of 17 months to Napa and spent 1 night at the Westin. The check in process was seamless and we were upgraded to the 1BR Premium Suite which was perfect for our toddler to run around. The front desk and concierge were extremely helpful and were able to help us with some insider tips on things to do. The hotel itself is being sold to individual owners but you wouldn't be able to tell since it still functions as a first class full service hotel. We had dinner at La Toque and thought the food was really good. The atmosphere is a bit formal and a bit pricey (especially the wine list). All in all, we were extremely satisfied to be located near the heart of the wineries, Michelin star restaurant on the hotel premises, spacious suite with top of the line finishes, and an excellent staff. We decided this would be the start of a great annual tradition as a getaway from all the Christmas festivities.

Reviews.Title: “not a four star yet”
Reviews.Author: sfsv
Reviews.Content: It is a nice new hotel. A bit lower quality materials compared to other Westins I stayed but fine until they wear out.. The hotel staff is not up to my expectations for a westin. The main issue seems to be managers do not understand yet what a good quality service their customers expect from them. Once the managers understand, they will be able to educate their staff but I do not think that that is happening. Now, staff is saying that they are sorry and that they are a new hotel but you do not see and effort to fix anything you happen to bump into. They have a weird policy valet only parking with a completely empty garage. If you do not want to leave your car to valet, you need to park on the city street where there is no security. But, the garage does not have any security either :-) gates are always open. Some specifics They have heated pool and jacuzzi. They pitched so well that my kid had to have it. So, we went but jacuzzi jets were not working,.Without us calling anybody, somebody came by, then a manager, then the maintenace person. Each of them had almost had the same words: Ohh! You could not work the jets? Let me give try. I told myself that there is no magic in this, you just turn a dial. It is not about me not knowing how to do it, it is just not working. They all came and they all went back. They couldn't/didn't fix it. But, did not come back and say why. My guess that it was not working for whatever reason, they knew that from the begining but did not have the face to tell to us since they are over selling it even while we were checking in. We ordered of the breakfast items two days in a row. Second day, it was fairly bad, no consistency. They have a nice restaurant. I checked out the menu and wanted to have dinner there. I mentioned to the host that my kid would not able to eats and if they can find something simple to eat. The answer was no. I asked if they can bring something from the other restaurant's menu. The answer was an arrogent no. I finally indciated that I want to have dinner there but my kid is paying he bill and need to work it out :-) Then, the host suddenly changed the tone and said they could prepare some pasta or make a meal size outof some smaller plates they have. Too arrogent for a restaurant that has only a few people for thw whole night - hotel was also near empty due to Christmas time. I ended up going to a nice country frensh restaurant in downton napa - Angele and liked it. On the day of check out, we had breakfast and charged to my room. I went to checkout counter and told them that I have an additional breakfast since the last night's bill I gave to them. The person did n even listen and said that I was done. I said I had breakfast that is not on the bill and I would like them to put that on the bill and reprint. She called the restaurant and I could see both of them talking on and waiter saw me waiting. I got the bell boy bring down our belongings with me - which is another 5-10 minutes. My bill still not ready and the girl at hte counter put the blame at the restaurant that they have not put the charge in so I just walked to the restaurant which was a few steps and asked what happened. She started to come up excuses that the others already checked me out so she could not put the meal on, etc., blaming the other staff. I asked her why should I care about these excuses and blames? I asked her to just do it, which surprisingly took less than a minute. The girl at the check out counter said that they are a new hotel and they are sorry. I reminded her that it is not about being a new hotel, and that she did not even listen to what I told her about adding my breakfast to the bill and she ignored my comment my request and said I am done. She just smiled back. There are other less important irritaing things such as hot water taking really long time (>5 minutes), changing channels on TV is full 2 seconds and you cannot zip channels through quickly, missing pillow cover, etc. But the main issue is that managers and staff do not understand they are in service business. Some arrogance which is very unjustified for a Westin motel :-), especially while hotel is practically deserted, and no effort in trying to keep their customer happy. I think somebody miseducated them that they are Westin that they are better than other hotels in the area, that they know it all via good training on what to tell the customer without thinking or listening first... It will take some time for the behaviors to change since most had the same attitude. I was explaining someof my unhappiness to the bell boy while walking out, he was feeling very sorry. He asked for my contact information so that they could follow up and make it up to me. I had to tell him that he knows my room number and the hotel has all the contact information they need (my address, my phone, my cell phone) and I can not figure out why I had to explain these type of things. Maybe, everybody working there is new to the hotel business, from staff to managers.

Reviews.Title: “A good stay in Napa”
Reviews.Author: kkhart
Reviews.Content: We spent one night here as we were coming to town for dinner at La Toque and wanted to be able to just get in an elevator afterwards. The hotel was nicer then we expected. It has been open a couple of years now and everything is sparkling clean and new. The staff is uniformly friendly and helpful. It was pretty chilly, but we braved the outdoors to use the large hot tub and nice warm pool. There is also a bocce court - if we had known we would have brought the set - although my husband said it was too cold to play. We had a standard room with a river view. Very comfortable and well maintained. It is a Westin, so they take pets and were very nice about our bringing our dog. we did see others on the property. There is a $20 per night resort fee which includes the valet parking and wireless internet service. The hotel is a about a block from the Oxbow Market which is a great place to go get coffee or to the bakery or a glass of wine and oysters. And if you are heading home, hit the different farm stands for wonderful meat and produce. For visitors from other areas - the town of Napa is historically a working class, industrial town. You will not be staying in the vineyards. But this hotel would be an excellent base to stay and then explore the valley. And do go have dinner at La Toque â€“ a Michelin one star restaurant. Yes, it is a little expensive, but this is serious fine dining â€“ you can have a French Laundry type meal at a fraction of the price. My husband is already asking when we can come stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Maddie19
Reviews.Content: This was a girls getaway. Action packed with a full itinerary. The Westin Verasa hotel was centrally located to the downtown area and within walking distances to shops and restaurants. The two bedroom deluxe suite was very comfortable and beautifully decorated. The front desk staff was friendly and courteous, and eager to answer any questions we had. The concierge arranged several outtings for us and seem to want to make our experience enjoyable and memorable. Absolutely nothing derrogatory I could say. We had a great time, and we will look forward to another girls getaway at the Westin Verasa.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect retreat after a long day of wine touring & tasting!”
Reviews.Author: clw1981
Reviews.Content: My friends and I had a wonderful stay at the Westin Verasa. This is a well-run, top notch Westin resort. Our room was beautiful. It looked out over the pool and the Napa River. We had a nice balcony with furniture, perfect for cocktail hour outside. The bathroom was spacious and I especially loved the double shower head. The full kitchen made it possible to have our own little get-togethers and entertain in our room. The concierge is helpful and instead of rattling off popular places, they ask about your interests and take the time to steer you in the right direction. This hotel is a great balance of comfortable and upscale. The place even smells great! I have stayed here twice in the past year and this place is only getting better. The valet service was a little slow the first time we went there but they've worked out the kinks. I like staying close to Oxbow so I can walk over and grab lunch or a glass of wine. I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in Napa - full service luxury”
Reviews.Author: unbound11053
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this property my last two trips to Napa. I usually look to Westin properties because they are reliable and I know that I can always expect a great stay, and the Westin Versa is no exception. The staff here is great and the rooms are elegant, roomy and comfortable. When I go to Napa, I am looking to relax and not have any worries and this is the best place for that. The team at Verasa has established some great connections with wineries and restaurants in the area and are really helpful in helping you figure out where to go. While some people would rather be up valley, downtown Napa is where the nightlife is. This Westin is in walking distance to Oxbow, a fresh marketplace (great for breakfast) and in walking distance to downtown bars. I plan to stay here every time I go to Napa. There are a lot of unique places to stay in Napa but this is a full service luxury hotel and that's what I want for my accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “Location is the only downside”
Reviews.Author: pokes12
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in many Westin hotels around the country. They generally pick prime locations for their hotels and resorts. However, this Westin is the exception. As other reviews have mentioned, it is in the town of Napa, and not in the valley. So if you've never been to the area before (as we had not been), there is a major difference. The town is not scenic at all. With that said, it does give you good access to the valley and all of the vineyards, which are a short drive away. The hotel itself is really nice (even to the degree that it appears out of place with the surrounding businesses and buildings). The room is very comfortable. And the staff is top notch, exactly what you expect from Westin. If they could pick up this hotel and move it a few miles north, it would be a 5 star hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Westin Verasa-Very Nice, but could be a little better.”
Reviews.Author: StephaniB
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here last week for our 3rd year anniversary and had a beautiful stay. Prior to our stay, I read several reviews online all giving the Westin Verasa good reviews and I must agree. The usual Heavenly Bed was great and Heavenly shower was so rejuvenating. Very nice room. One drawback, our standard room did not have a microwave or refridgerator. Not a major issue, but would have helped to keep our beverages cold, instead of having to make several trips to the ice machine for a cold drink. But still no big deal. The Hotel is very beautiful, however, we were expecting to see the hotel in a more rustic setting. Not down the street from a strip mall and traffic. (Wal-Mart is down the street and The Wine Train is right across the street). What we expected and what brought us to Napa Valley we had to drive 15 minutes away to find. Driving up to the wineries, you finally see what Napa Valley is about. This is definately not a bad choice of hotel, just wish it was in the same vicinity as the wineries although it's not too far away. All in all a very wonderful trip. The Hotel staff were all absolutely amazing and very accomodating. They were very personable and called us by our names and that made us feel welcome. Great trip, great hotel. In regards to food, La Toque, one of their onsite restaurants, has absolutely amazing food and their wine pairings were really good, but it is pricey! They were also very accomodating to people with food allergies and picky eaters like myself. The hotel restaurant inside the lobby, However, is very limited with their choice of foods and not many options are available to people like myself who do not consume red meat, pork or dairy. So eating was quite tricky as I discovered my chicken dish was cooked in lard and veal broth. Yeah! Not cool. Just wished I had asked before I consumed all of it! Thank God I'm not allergic to either. But fortunately the restaurant was able to cater somewhat to my needs and prepare meals not on the menu. So there you have it. Napa Outlet Mall about 6 minutes away! I love to shop, so this came in handy!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel and excellent service from the staff”
Reviews.Author: bandogal
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 days at the Westin and were delighted with the hotel, "The Bank" the in hotel bar and restrauant. The staff that carried our luggage and multiple wine purchases as well as parked our car were always there and quite a delightful group of fellows. We asked for early check in and were happy when it could be provided. The suite was nicely appointed and always spotless. I had read a poor review prior to leaving and I was concerned. However any prior service and staff problems seem to have been address we felt it could not have been better.

Reviews.Title: “Bad mistake.”
Reviews.Author: LKnSF
Reviews.Content: You expect wine country and you see strip malls and a parking lot. One would hope the service would override the location, wrong again.

Reviews.Title: “Wine in 2009!”
Reviews.Author: GlobalTraveler21
Reviews.Content: As a Starwod Owners, we have had the benefit of staying at some excellent properties. From the standpoint of service to guests, this one rates one of the highest. From the concierge to the valets and housekeeping, the staff was incredibly attentive. For those who plan to visit both Napa and Sonoma vineyards, this hotel is well situated. The amenities are to be expected from this level hotel. My wife & I were here to relax, enjoy excellent food and wine, couldn't ask for more - quiet room overlooking the Napa River with the beauty of Sonoma and Napa Valleys just down the road. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: winetourgirl
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a place to stay in Napa this is it! Great location and a very comfortable place to stay with a beautiful pool and an excellent restaurant , would definitely return if in the area again.

Reviews.Title: “Classy Napa Oxbow Situs”
Reviews.Author: Rosquete
Reviews.Content: Finally, a decent Starwood property in the Napa area close to Oxbow Public Market and Napa Wine Train. The suites are fabulous with 2 bathrooms & 2 showers. Flat screen TVs. Have fitness center and nice restaurant (e.g., Sunday brunch $25). Friendly and helpful service! Pet friendly. 3 and 5 mile walking/jogging paths from hotel. Get free or discounted wine tasting coupons from concierge. $20 amenity charge for valet parking, gym, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Elegance and modern luxury”
Reviews.Author: ilmatt
Reviews.Content: Me, my husband and my 11 year old stayed there during our trip to San Francisco and Napa Valley. The hotel is fairly new, modern and elegant.. We stayed in a one bedroom unit. The furnishing is tastefully decorated. The heavenly bed, we have to say we never had such a good sleep in any hotel like that. We also like the bathroom, very spacious, spa like color and decor, with nice shower heads, and very nice bath products. The color, smell and sense of the room just gave us a very calm, relax and zen feel. We also like the amenities offer by the hotel, the pool and the whirlpool. We didn't have time to use the exercise room, but we passed by it everyday and always saw it very well used by many hotel guests. The exercise room seems quite well equipped. The hotel also provided xbox which my 11 year old son loves it. We wished we have tried the restaurant of the hotel, as we saw it was quite full the 3 nights that we stayed there. But we have to split our 3 nights dinners between San Francisco and Napa and there were so many choices when I researched before the trip, so I completely overlooked the in hotel restaurant. We don't have a lot of comments regarding the service because we hardly need anything from the service staff. Overall, we're quite happy with this Westin. We have never stayed in Westin before, but after this try, I think we will always check out Westin in our future trip planning.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing.”
Reviews.Author: teenytinytina
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Westin Napa in September with a free night earned as part of the SPG program (just had to pay the resort fee that covers parking and wifi). My experience here was comparatively terrible probably because I had just stayed at some great SPG properties down in southern California (US Grant in San Diego and St. Regis Monarch Beach), but I don't think my expectations were out of line since the regular prices for these properties are comparable. We tried to check in at 3pm (pretty standard), but were told to come back in an hour as the room was still being cleaned. That's fine - we checked out the Oxbow market right down the street and had a great time and ate some really delicious treats. About 4:30, it started drizzling so we walked back to the hotel, the room was still not ready. We sat around for a bit but decided to take another room (not the same room type) since it was raining and we just wanted to settle in. By the time we got to our room it was already after 5pm. The room was nice enough - clean, large, kitchenette, separate bedroom. The two stars are for the room. Sadly, we only had a view of the parking lot of the hotel next door. In the morning, I checked the statement for our stay and it turns out they had charged us ~$90 extra. I called the front desk to settle this. They said it would be taken care of, and would deposit 2000 extra points in my SPG account for all the trouble (late check-in, error with the statement, room type not what I was supposed to get). None of this was done--my credit card statement still showed the extra charge, and my SPG account were not updated with the points. I called two weeks later and they had me leave a voicemail for someone who supposedly takes care of this stuff. I did. A week later, it still wasn't taken care of, and no one had returned my call. On my third try calling the hotel (three weeks later), I finally had someone work through it with me on the phone. The charge has been updated on my credit card, but the points still have not posted. I've wasted more time and energy on this hotel than on any other travel arrangements I've ever made, even internationally. I wasn't able to enjoy my experience during my stay OR even to try to think of any part of it fondly. Though it was just a free night that was used up, I still feel cheated. There's no way I would ever pay regular price for a night here! I might as well try to find a cheap motel to stay in, or stay at River Terrace Inn next doors (free continental breakfast, DVDs to rent out, check-in easy and on-time). In summary: it's not worth the price tag! But definitely stop by Oxbow Market next doors!

Reviews.Title: “Can I please move into the Westin Napa!!!???”
Reviews.Author: WillTraveler56
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Westin Verasa in September '09. We had a great time. I would definitely recommend this hotel. We live in downtown Boston, so when I say the room was bigger then our condo, I'm not exaggerating (we'll almost), but we were in a fantastic suite, with a full kitchen, dining room, living room, bedroom and private deck. I saw a very reasonable rate on Hotels.com and the Westin matched it. Definitely check that out. I've read some of the reviews and the location isn't bad. You can walk to downtown Napa for several restaurants and bars. You can walk to the wine train. In Napa, you need a car or transportation for the wineries any way, so I honestly think the location is fine. The hotel is also brand new. It just opened in late 2008. The hotel has two nice restaurants, a bar, very nice pool area and some fun bocce courts out back! We enjoyed the Westin Verasa, found the staff very nice and would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: kmogilevski
Reviews.Content: I will have to agree with some of the other negative reviews on here. Although the hotel has modern decor, it does not warrant the extremely high price for such an average hotel. The staff doesn't seem to be trained well. Beware that the standard rooms have only one King bed and they don't have rollaway beds, as we were told when we checked in. When we made the reservation over the phone, we told the person that three people would be staying the room and asked for a rollway bed; they said it would be no problem. When we checked in, we had to upgrade to the suite, which has a pull-out couch ($40 more per night). This type of suite was not available, so we had to upgrade to the workout suite ($50 more per night, from base price). The workout suite is nothing special. It has a medicine ball, a stability ball, some resistance bands, and a stationary bike. The resort fee is standard, everyone pays it. Why Westin doesn't roll it into the price, I don't know. It might be because it's already overpriced and if they added $20/night, it would be way too much. To summarize, we ended up paying $70/night more. Internet is included in the $20 fee, so I don't see that as free internet. I was not impressed with the "Heavenly" amenities. Yes, the bed was comfortable, but not "heavenly." The amenities and the service were average. There is a river behind the hotel. I realized the "River Walk" sign was deceiving when I walked down a path less than 0.2 miles long. Disappointing! If I visit Napa again, I'll go to a boutique hotel, B&B, or cottage in the wine country itself.

Reviews.Title: “Underwhelming and Understaffed”
Reviews.Author: OnthemoveChicago
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is fairly new but I felt like I was staying at an expensive Comfort Inn. Most of the staff were polite but generally not impressive or available. Nothing remarkable about this hotel at all. The rooms were ok and the bed comfortable. Thatâ€™s about it. It is very unlikely I will return to this hotel anytime soon nor would I recommend it. The location is not great and I suspect that there are better places in Napa to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Luxury”
Reviews.Author: SKS4
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin last week and absolutely loved it. Everything from the room to the grounds to the staff were fabulous. The location is a little different from what you might think of when you think of the Napa Valley. However, we enjoyed the "urban" location and its proximity to the Oxbow and downtown. One can easily walk there for snack, coffee, wine or shopping. Granted it's a bit further from the Sonoma wineries, but you plan ahead and leave earlier that day. Add in a stop for breakfast and you're set for the day. Don't miss the Fatted Calf up the street for some delicious meats. Buy a few slices there and then take it to the Wine Merchant at the Oxbow where you can enjoy it with cheese and wine. It was a wonderful prelude to dinner that night. Back to the hotel, the room was lovely. The bed heavenly as one always expects at the Westin. The bathroom was spacious and had the best showerhead I've seen in a long time...maybe ever. The kitchenette made for a much more comfortable trip. I wish we had more time to enjoy the pool area as it was beautiful. We just spent way too much time at the wineries for that. There are both chairs in the sun and the shade so everyone can enjoy the pool. Also some nice cabanas. The workout room was much larger than what you typically get at hotels. Of course I didn't have time to use it, but the equipment was plentiful, new and clean. Lastly, the staff was wonderful. They were knowledgeable, helpful and friendly. I look forward to visiting this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Not Really a Resort, City Location, Comfortable but SMALL Room”
Reviews.Author: PetermanCalifornia
Reviews.Content: If you are going for romance, there are better choices in Napa in more romantic settings and with a more special feel. If you want a touring base, there are better located hotels, further up the valley. If you are planning a wedding and need accommodation for out of town guests that need to depart early in the morning, there are less expensive hotels that are just as nice. It's very difficult to understand "why" you would choose this hotel for a lesiure trip to such a pretty place where there are much better located properties and many more visually appealing settings. It is not a resort as so many resorts are in the sense that there are no grounds, just a W shaped building with a pool and restaurant between one of the :Lake Tahoe 1970's ski lodge style exteriors, and a small grassy area suitable for a crawling baby or a small dog between the other. It may be appropriate for a business offsite or a group meeting for people who are local, but I would not spend my leisuremoney here. Incidentally, unlike many previous posters, and despite Starwood "status" we received the lowest category room that is not pictured on the Westin website. It did not have a kitchen or fridge or wet bar or sitting area. or bath tub! Instead of the glassed French doors pictured on the website, we had a standard rectangular hotel window. It was definitely new, which is nice, but certainly not so great that you couldn;t find something comparable up valley in a much more "Wine Country"-like setting, or much closer to places you are coming all this way to see.

Reviews.Title: “Modern & comfortable”
Reviews.Author: bruin28
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Napa Valley for the first time & ended up booking a room here. It wasn't exactly charming, quaint, warm or anything close to the B&Bs you imagine you should stay at in Napa Valley, but it was perfect for us after a long drive. The service at the front desk was good enough. They checked us in immediately even though we had arrived early. We were told that the hotel was fully booked. Initially, I was a bit disturbed by the fact that our room was on the first floor, but then I realized it was far away enough from the lobby & gym to be peaceful. I liked the high ceiling & the spacious room. The location of the hotel was convenient. Anyway, I think the hotel is great for anyone who's just looking for a new, modern, & comfortable room. I'm not a big fan of the $20 parking fee. They don't call it that, but basically, that's what it is.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection Personified”
Reviews.Author: Dabnella
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Westin Verasa could not have been better. My best friend was visiting for a gals get-away from the craziness of our lives ( ... no husbands ... no kids). Upon arrival at the hotel we were delighted to find that we'd been upgraded to a one bedroom suite overlooking the pool. That bed ... well, let's just say that it lives up to it's name ... Heavenly! Service: Our favorite bartender, a.k.a. Cabana Boy, took great care of us at the Wine Bar at Bank. I was most appreciative of bell services and "service express" for their patience with me. They were always very understanding of my losing my baggage claim/valet ticket. Every staff member we came in contact with was fabulous, smiling, and a true pleasure to speak to. Location: Let's be honest, the location is probably not the first place people think of when they look for a hotel in "Napa Valley". If you must look out your window and see the vines, this is not the place for you. However, I truly believe this location is a perfect 'midpoint' for those who have a car and a map. You have downtown Napa with fabulous dining and nightlife a couple of blocks away. Then for traveling to the wineries, the map we were given at the hotel was all we needed. We are already planning our return trip to Napa, and are going back to the Westin.

Reviews.Title: “a true treasure. Westin never disappoints.”
Reviews.Author: ambarclift
Reviews.Content: This was an A++++ hotel. From the moment we checked in we were greeted with friendly, helpful staff in a beautiful lobby. Our room was very comfortable (got to love that Westin Heavenly bed) with Starbucks coffee (with travel cups and lids! - perfect for using while heading out to the wineries), excellent bath items, and a wonderful view of the mountains bordering the East side of the Valley. Great location for heading up to Napa, or even crossing over to Sonoma; also perfect for getting into downtown Napa for any nightlife. The fitness center was top-notch with multiple machines and personal televisions built into them. The pool area was nice during the day with a nice fire in the evening. The concierge was very helpful in providing a map to the different wineries and easy-to-follow directions. Good tip for future visitors: Call down to the Valet desk to have them bring your car around 10-15 minutes before. The valet line can get a bit behind in the morning and dinnertime.

Reviews.Title: “Great Napa getaway - Dog friendly too”
Reviews.Author: klasf
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for two nights over Labor Day weekend and had an amazing time. We arrived in Napa around 1:00pm on Saturday and the let us check-in early since our room was ready. I asked if they had any upgraded rooms free, and they said they were 100% booked. This hotel is super dog friendly, in fact upon check-in they give you a little gift bag that includes a dog tag, gourmet dog treat, and some poop bags. When we got to our room we were delighted to see that we had in fact been upgraded from a studio to one bedroom with a balcony and view of the river. Also, they set out a dog bed and water/food dishes for the pup. Our room was awesome. It had a little kitchenette including a small fridge, a microwave, a dishwasher, a stove top and all the pots, pans, cutlery, wine glasses etc you need. The pool area of the hotel was lovely. They have small cabana like tents for those of us who burn. The pool and hot tub are open until 11 pm so you can take an after dinner dip. There's a nice gym and bocce ball court too, but we didnâ€™t use them. The location of the hotel in Napa is good, too. You can easily walk to down the Street to Taylors, Kara's Cupcakes, and even downtown Napa. It's also right off the highway for easy access to wineries further north in the valley. We ate at Ad Hoc, which was only about a 20 minute drive away. As for parking, there is tons of safe street parking in front of the hotel if you choose not to use the valet. We used the valet once and it was fine, took about 5 minutes. We had a great stay here and will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed bag”
Reviews.Author: WDWDolphinFan
Reviews.Content: Our 3-night stay was a mixed bag of good and not-so-good experiences. On the plus side, everything is new and nice, the lobby and outdoor grounds in the back are attractive, and the restaurant La Toque was superb - the best meal of our trip. The convenience to the Oxbow Market was also a plus. The Bank restaurant offers quick to-go croissants (including my favorite - chocolate croissants) and coffee or drinks in the morning, which we also liked. However, while I usually much prefer this type of larger, upscale hotel to a country inn experience, we had just come from a lovely inn in Healdsburg, and the differences were stark and quite disappointing. While I knew this would be an in-town setting, I wasn't really expecting such a stark setting. While rooms facing the back of the hotel have reasonably attractive views, rooms to the front and sides would look out on concrete, streets, parking lots, etc. - hardly an idyllic getaway. While the concierge at the inn had been wonderful in recommending wineries to visit and making appointments, there simply was no concierge at the Westin at all until our last night here - guests were left to simply fend for themselves. And for SPG members, don't waste your Starpoints here. Since I was using points to stay, and knew that might mean getting their lowest room category, I had carefully checked out the room types listed on their website, the lowest of which was a "deluxe" room with a kitchen and sitting area, but no balcony. When we arrived, we were given a smaller room they don't even bother offering for sale. This was a small, extremely narrow room that was clearly just the spare bedroom to a 2 or 3 bedroom suite - no kitchen, and very tight quarters.
