The Westin is a fine choice for a large group, but for a couples get-away to wine country I would go for a smaller, more personal inn in the countryside - but definitely make the trip to La Toque for dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice.”
Reviews.Author: JQWD
Reviews.Content: I have no complaints with The Westin Verasa. We booked the day before we came to Napa through Hotels.com and received an OK rate 260 a night for two nights that included free access to the business center, fitness center and valet parking. The hotel arranged both wine tours and balloon tours at a moment's notice with no hesitation. Every staff member was attentive and welcoming. On Saturday, there was a great open market across the street where we met a number of locals and enjoyed a morning pastry and coffee. The wine train was just down the road and there were a number of shops within walking distance. No, there isn't a view. There are however, lovely quiet rooms - great for relaxing with a kitchenette that exceeds the quality of what I have at home. A very relaxing stay....

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel in an amazing place”
Reviews.Author: qwiklap
Reviews.Content: I wanted to submit a review of this hotel. In a word, I find it to be one of the finest examples of a residence style hotel. Excellent facilities (brand new, contemporary and just my style), great staff (the managers and staff are great), and a perfect place to launch your Napa excursions. I am an SPG Platinum member so I was upgraded to a 1-bedroom suite at check in. The room was great (and quite large). Ours had a fully equipped kitchen with toaster, coffee maker, dishwasher, full size fridge, etc. We went out and got our own breakfast foods and made breakfast and coffee everyday (using the hotels complimentary Starbucks packs). This was a great way to start the day. The management was great and saw to our every need. They made arrangements at all the restaurants we went to and did a great job overall. I met the GM in the bar one evening -- and he seemed like a really nice guy and genuinely interested in my wife and I's comfort. I found the facilities to be top notch. The pool and Jacuzzi (open late) were both great with nice little cabanas. The gym is well equipped. The in room (complimentary) wifi seemed to work fine for me. The bar was great. No complaints on facilities. My room had an Xbox 360 in it -- I am not sure if others do -- but if you have kids and you want to keep them entertained, you could bring your games and such. On top of the room rate you do have to pay a daily service charge of $20 or so -- but this covers your valet parking. I bit of a niggle -- so I deducted a star on value. My only gripes would be the lack of an on-site spa (seems criminal to have a hotel like this with no spa in Napa), and perhaps the location (it would be great if this hotel was in Yountville -- a more central location). On the spa side -- they do have arrangements with a local day spa and will even give you lift using their hotel car and driver. There is a great little shopping center and place for food right down the street from the hotel. We went there for a meal and rented nice mountain bikes to bike around the area for a few hours (a great way to see the natural splendor of Napa). But overall -- I would highly recommend this hotel to all (especially if you like your hotels new and contemporary). I plan to use this hotel exclusively for all of my (hopefully many) returns to Napa.

Reviews.Title: “Napa Westin Versa Limits Business Traveler Success”
Reviews.Author: seotraveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a nice property with a friendly staff but for business travelers this hotel should be avoided. Business travelers who need reliable, high speed Internet access, similar to what you expect at major hotel chains will be strongly dissappointed. From my room, both the hardwire and wireless connections were extremely slow. When I complained that the service was slow, I was told that a conference at the hotel was using up most of the hotels bandwidth. I was told that the problem would go away the following day when the guests from this event leave. The same poor Internet service existed the following day. I even got up at 6:00 am in the morning to get access to important files and edit some websites, and the speed was unacceptable. Any business traveler who needs Internet access at normal speeds should avoid this property.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect example of hospitality”
Reviews.Author: QuantumCoco
Reviews.Content: There is too much to say. Had we known the best food was to be offered in their restaurant (which we found out on our last day) we would have eaten in the hotel more as opposed to looking outside in Yountville. Make sure you eat in the restaurant and get a glass of wine from their long wine list. Service was great. I asked for foam pillows, high floor, corner room, and we got that and 2 upgrades (because of my points) and though we had to wait to check in (till 3) we ate in their restaurant and had a great time. our bed was firm the view was great. We had a balcony which we sat outside and listened to the local sounds. The room had 2 rooms, my daughter watched TV on one in our room. Which we didn't watch too much as we had other things to do. We would often visit the fitness center, then go out and drive to a winery or two or three. It's very close to downtown napa which offers 7-10 great restaurants and is very convenient. It is at the south end or base of napa valley so all of the north is uncharted territory.

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service issues - no great views - comfy beds”
Reviews.Author: jann2007
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at the Westin Verasa. Overall I was not excited about the stay there. When I originally called to book, the hotel forwarded me to corporate for the booking. The lady I spoke with seemed not to be 100% there and gave me a different list of potential room views than someone I had talked to a few days before directly at the hotel. I requested a rivew view and top (third) floor room. My checkin experience was probably the worst way to start a vacation. This is when I learned I got nothing I requested even though I did so way in advance. The lady who was handling my checkin seemed really confused and/or out of it. To top it off, they had charged me for two rooms (for just me and me husband). It was a big headache to get the second room charge reversed as it was prepaid. We had two other couples travelling with us. One got a "river view" which was more of a view if you only looked way around the corner. And they also had a clear shot of a neighbor's balcony. Our view was essentially a wall (but looking around we could see part of the pool - so it was deemed a "pool view"). We also had a closeup view of our neighbor's balcony. Honestly, I don't require an awesome view....it just would have been good to have expectations managed rather then selling it as "review views" and (the non-existent) "vineyard views" by corporate. The bed was VERY COMFORTABLE. We had a one-bedroom suite. The sofa bed did not have any sheets (unacceptable in my book). What's the point of having a sofa bed if it's not ready? The bathroom was nice - loved the double-headed shower. But at night, it felt as though the hotel either shut off or altered the overall room temperatures. It seemed you had to reduce the temp to the mid sixties just for it to stay comfortable. The common areas for hanging out were good. Plenty of space outside in the courtyards and the wine bar. The hotel location was good. It was nice to stroll to Model Bakery each morning and get a World's Best English Muffin. But if I had to do it again, I would not stay at the Westin Verasa. I have stayed at Westins before that are much much much nicer than this one. I expected more; and would happily pay more expensive B&B prices to be further up in near St Helena, etc. to be closer to the action of the good wineries and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Did you got the letter in the mail? Collection letter for forgotten charges 9 months after”
Reviews.Author: mattrob30
Reviews.Content: From Westin Collection department (my first letter of such in my life) with an Intrawest letterhead saying I left my room without paying... the resort fee of 23 odd dollars. I know we could have a long talk about those fee but is it not worse to collect people 9 months after because of a mistake from the hotel. I would not dare to ask for points after that period of time and especially for such a trivial amount. Watch yall, you gonna get the nasty letter soon because it seem to have been a widespread mistake as the letter was not even personalised. Called Corporate Service at Starwood, which I encourage you to do as it automatically require formal complaint response from the hotel GM. If they are flodded with complaints, maybe they will understand that were more business oriented and that the man-hour invested will offset the money collected. I feel like the hotel must feel when a guest leave with the towels: its cheap especially when your staying in a 4 star.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful venue - we will return”
Reviews.Author: Pb650
Reviews.Content: We stayed on a Friday night after attending a wedding nearby. Absolutely perfect rooms - spacious, very clean, and very stylish. Superior shower pressure, quiet A/C system, and the windows actually opened! The bed was astoundingly comfortable. We overlooked the pool area, which was quiet, and very pretty to look at. The hot pool is enormous, and like the cold pool is very very clean. We enjoyed a late night snack at the Bank bar - delicious appetizers. The wine list at the Bank was extensive, offering many many half-bottles of wine - we would have liked to see more wines by the glass, but that's not a major quibble. The gym was classic Westin - large, well appointed, clean, and outfitted with the very latest treadmills - I'd return just for that. We'll definitely return for a longer stay. Also, while there, be sure to stop at the Oxbow Market down the street which has amazing food purveyors showcasing the freshest ingredients. At Oxbow, definitely try the fresh Napa fare at Folio - great food and an equally wonderful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Westin Verasa needs to Clean House on Customer Service!”
Reviews.Author: som-mom
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Napa for 2 days with our son who was attenting the CIA for his Sommelier training. We are Westin owners and were very excited to visit the new Westin in Napa...until we got there and even after we checked out. We have stayed at many Westin/Starwood properties and never had such a low level of customer service. Sure, the hotel is nice and new, but when you have such horrible service it ruins everything. I was never able to speak to a consierge because I was always told they wouldn't be in until later. The front desk often times did not answer their phone when we called from our room and when we called from outside the hotel. One morning we went to breakfast at The Bank Cafe and it took forever for someone to acknowlege that we were waiting for a table even though they glanced our way several times. After breakfast we went to the very tiny concierge desk (more like a podium) where a gentleman sat. We asked for his assistance and he told us he was just resting there. I then asked if he worked there and he replied "what do ya need?" RUDE! Calling for our car was always a nightmare because there doesn't seem to be a dedicated line for valet. When we asked who to call for valet they just told us to call the front desk, but they didn't always answer. The hotel seems to be very understaffed and that may be part of the problem. When we received our bill the day of checkout, there were charges from the prior guest that had our room and for The Bank Cafe. We did not put any charges for dining on our room...they were always paid with cash. After several conversations with the front desk, the bill was corrected. I was told upon check out that I would be contacted by the hotel manager that afternoon and left my contact info. Two days later, I still had not been contacted by the manager. I was also told that I would have part of my starpoints that we used for our stay returned to my account. I called the hotel back and left a voicemail to which the manager finally returned my call. He was very polite and appologized for the unfortunate experience we had. He promised to email me his contact info. After many more phone calls to the hotel I still have no contact info. I have spoken to a couple people at the hotel that promised my starpoints would be taken care of and it never happened. It's too bad I have had to waste so much of my time trying to deal with the hotel staff. I should have gone directly to Starwood Corporate. Bottom line: The customer service is appaulling!

Reviews.Title: “Great property, questionable customer service”
Reviews.Author: tradewarrior
Reviews.Content: The Westin Verasa Resort in Napa is a beautiful property in a very convenient location. The property is very elegant and is typical of most Westin properties. However as a Starwood member I was very dissappointed with the service I received. First, I was ignored at the front desk even though there were several employees available. After I made my presence completely obvious, they made excuses for ignoring us. Not a big deal, but combined with the rest of the problems it was typical of my experience. I paid extra for a one-bedroom suite with a balcony, and the room was great. However, when I went out on the balcony, my view was of two massive air conditioning units that were blowing full blast my whole stay. Since I informed them that this was a special occasion I thought it was totally inconsiderate. Also, eating in the restaurant was a mixed bag. The food was great, but they were out of several items on the menu and it took over 10 minutes to get a waiter to come over to our table. One more thing. Room service stops at 11PM. If you are a night owl like me, you better plan ahead. In my opinion, this is a beautiful property but the customer service side needs much improvement. If you can deal with that you will be fine.

Reviews.Title: “F A B U L O U S (under the circumstances)”
Reviews.Author: imelise
Reviews.Content: Flew in from Minneapolis to San Fran-stayed at the Clift where the noise of the streets and the less than perfect staff live up to their names. Down to the Wharf for crab, and then on our way to Napa to the Westin where I would spend the next 24 hours with severe food poisoning. Missed all of Saturday, wine tour and picnic with my friends to celebrate my 40th b-day. As ill as I was, and I was quite sick...I am SO THANKFUL to have been at the Westin!!! Truly a wonderful, peaceful, relaxing, enjoyable and rejuvenating experience. A TRULY SUPERB staff!!! A special thanks to Eugene for the chicken soup! The atmosphere is warm, inviting, & comfortable. Thank you for helping me make the best of it all!!!! Dibs on a redo, less the crabby cakes. XO Elisa :)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay at the Westin in Napa, Ca.”
Reviews.Author: vinoreno
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed for 2 days at the Westin in Napa, Ca. Our stay was perfect in every way!! The hotel is very new and is a beautiful property located near downtown Napa, along the river(to the back of the property) and across from the wine train station. It was easy to walk down the block to restaurants, The Oxbow Market, and even to the downtown Main St. area where all the restaurants and many wine tasting rooms are. I booked our stay through Hotels.com and got the best value ($189-midweek) for the Deluxe King Room with a kitchenette. The Traditional Room doesn't have the kitchenette. We saw the 1 bedroom with a FULL kitchen and it was very spacious!! Room: We had a pool view room on the 3rd floor. It was very plush, clean, and beautifully decorated in earth tones. The heavenly bed was so comfortable. The room had a small sofa, coffee table, small table with 2 chairs, 4 drawer dresser with flat screen TV (movies were pricey- $15.99), I- Rise clock radio- I-Pod player, in room safe (complimentary use), closet (robes to use). The bathroom had black granite countertops and slate wall in the shower. All the bathroom amenities- hair dryer, hair products, make up mirror, large mirror on the wall. The best feature was the kitchenette. It had a small fridge, 2 burner cooktop, small dishwasher, and the cabinets were stocked with everything to cook with- utensils, toaster, pans, blender etc. There was a one cup drip coffee maker with Starbucks coffee that was complimentary. The fridge had 6 sodas and there were goodies/snacks on the dresser, however, those were all for purchase. The counter tops were also black granite. Pool: The pool area was very nice!! The hot tub was large. There were about 8 cabanas with soft padded loungers and other lounge chairs around with pool towels on each. There was drink service out at the pool. Lobby and Service: The entrance and lobby are beautifully decorated. The restaurant/bar is there and the doors are all glass and open up to the pool area. It makes the lobby open-air style like I've seen in Hawaii. I didn't eat at the restaurant, nor did I eat at La Toque Restaurant that resides at the Westin now. It is one of the finer restaurants in town and very pricey, but highly rated!! You can have 2-5 course dinners there with wine pairings. Outside near the pool were sitting areas with a beautiful water feature/fire pit. The service was great and all staff very accommodating and friendly from everyone we encountered!! Other Amenities: There is a business center with use of the computer internet and copy machine, and also free wireless in the rooms. The small fitness center had free weights and plenty of machines. There is a workout walking path the hotel has established with cards that show you the route. Close by: Soscol is the main street running in front of the hotel. To the right on Soscol you will find Walmart and a Safeway, Ross, Trader Joes etc -turn left on Trencas Ave.-5 minutes by car. To the left on Soscol, there is a Super Target, Dennys, I-Hop, Banks and assorted other stores- 5 minutes by car. Also it is an easy jount up Hwy 29, the main wine road or over to the Silverado Trail. Also golf is nearby at Napa Kennedy Park and not too much further to Chardonnay Club or Eagle Vines Golf Clubs. We were so very pleased with our accommodations and experience that we would stay there again and highly recommend this property!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, excellent service, wonderful amenities and a good value”
Reviews.Author: karma1007
Reviews.Content: I have to express my shock and dismay that travelers are not giving the Westin Napa a five star average across the board. My wife and I do quite a lot of traveling for business and also during our free time as we enjoy adventuring. From start to finish the Westin Napa was very enjoyable. It is an awesome location and super close to all the the city has to offer. You can walk to the Oxbow public market which has everything from a tasty bakery and oyster bar to a kiosk where you can rent bikes and kayaks. Historic downtown Napa with all of it's boutiques, delicious restaurants, bars and shopping is only a few short blocks walking distance from these spectacular digs. The facility itself is organic, modern and classy but very comfortable and in no way pretentious. We did not eat at Ken Frank's world famous La Toque (recently relocated to the hotel) this time around but have in the past. The new La Toque is gorgeous and we would highly recommend it. When the wife and I dined there a year or so ago, we found it to be one of the top culinary experiences of our lifetime and we are quite the foodies. Though we did not swim in the beautiful pool or take a leisurely nap in the resort style cabanas, or play a game of bocce ball, or in anyway take advantage of the many outdoor spaces the Westin has to offer, we were very impressed at the thoughtful layout as we walked the grounds. Our light, bright and spacious studio room was very well appointed. We were on the South (???) side of the hotel closest to the bend in the river and the Ox Bow Public Market. We sipped fresh cups of Starbucks coffee (available in your room) from our balcony on multiple mornings while we soaked up the tranquil river and mountain views. The beds are indeed Heavenly as are the shower heads, plush towels and robes. We had no need for the in room safe, but thought it was a great idea for those that have that need. We loved the large LCD television (super picture) and used the in room X-box to watch a few episodes of Entourage. It was great that the Westin had a fully stocked kitchen (dishwasher, microwave, utensils, plates, stove, fridge, etc.) and we used it to reheat some yummy leftovers and create a few wine oriented appetizers and prepare some fixings for our picnic. The Westin concierge was wonderful and made delightful recommendations for dinner and shared with us some of her favorite wineries and experiences around the area. We felt like she really listened to us and got a good feel for who we are and what we were looking to enjoy, as we thoroughly enjoyed all her suggestions. The other Westin staff team were also equally attentive and knowledgeable about the local area and more importantly the hotel itself. I called the front desk on at least three occasions with questions about the TV, dvd player, room service and check out procedures. Each time I spoke to the front desk they were fast, friendly, polite and I honestly felt trying to make our experience memorable. You will find the Westin Napa Verasa to be gorgeous, convenient, well appointed, wonderfully staffed and a great value for your money. We have highly recommended this hotel to our friends, family and fellow TripAdvisors.

Reviews.Title: “Bachelorette/Wedding Weekend Fabulosity”
Reviews.Author: kittykatherine22
Reviews.Content: I was here this past weekend for a bachelorette party and I must say that the staff was amazing at dealing with us. When we were making too much noise in our suite, they moved us into the lobby to continue our bachelorette party without bothering other guests (they also offered us an alternate room, with a cleaning fee- which we declined). The suite was large and beautiful and had the most amazing shower ever. My bed was so comfy that I didn't even mind sharing. The hotel was amazing about getting us anything we needed from champagne glsases to extra towels. They have a huge and very nice hot tub. Even though our room was very expensive, I think it was really worth it for the outsize service and beautiful room. If I could afford it, I would stay here whenever I'm in napa!

Reviews.Title: “Great Room but watch for $20 fee”
Reviews.Author: mikefuji
Reviews.Content: The room and grounds of this hotel are very beautiful. Though i was annoyed with the mandatory $20 a day fee for "activities". This includes vallet parking which was more annoying than anything else when there is ample street parking. I would rather get my own car than wait for it. The bacce ball courts were also a discrace since the balls were all broken and several were missing. If you are going to charge the fee, keep up with it. But the beds were very comfortable and the rooms were big. Plus the double headed showers were a nice surprise.

Reviews.Title: “Check your bill!(or as they say,your folio...)”
Reviews.Author: scoper
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here from 3 nights at the end of may. The rooms are. Roomy and nice-with a mini kitchen and even a range as well as cutlery and in room cover. Try to avoid having a room facing the always busy road. As far as parking you have no choice-the valet surcharge is tacked on to your room bill. Did not eat at their restaurant- highly recommend Tra Vigne and Bouchon. Unfortunately my whole experience at this hotel has been tainted by how they treated a billing error. I was doubly charged for my 3 nights at nearly $600 per. I only discovered this after I arrived home. Before leaving I asked for a copy of my folio and was told it would be e mailed to me. Buyer beware! Insist on a paper copy of your bill and look at every line before you check out! At any rate, it turns out that the hotel is still refusing to refund $390 which was a deposit put down on the initial reservation. A simple explanation and a refund would have sufficed! My travel agent,who tried to reason with the hotel's business manager is also quite perplex at their total disregard for customer satisfaction. I guess their reasoning is that since I'm 3000 miles away- who cares. The whole experience has left me disillusioned with the Westin Napa hotel and with Starwood properties. If I had not happened to check my credit card statement, no one would have notified me of any error! $390 is not a huge deal- it's the principle of being taken advantage of that bugs me. Needless to say, the next time I return to Napa I will stay elsewhere-there are other fine hotels in Napa who likely treat their customers' complaints with more respect than this, and care about their image.

Reviews.Title: “Verasa, Vice-Versa, Unversed, Sporadic, Yet Nice”
Reviews.Author: Perigrinator
Reviews.Content: The Westin Verasa is a beautiful hotel with a very polite, nice staff, but needs improvement because the service is sporadic (yet polite). The Good: Nice, clean, rooms; beautiful lobby; nice bar/restaurant area; good location for the up and coming Napa area. The Bad: Service is sporadic; lots of confusion; differing prices; mis-quotes on prices; very bad chauffeur service; employees not knowledgeable. The Ugly: Price mix ups that took two weeks to resolve. Here's what happened: we checked in, granted, on a busy weekend, but they had our room and booking confused - with people in line behind us becoming increasingly irritated, they asked if we could 'wait' until they checked in the other parties. I told them definitely not - finally, they resolved the mix-up but had the wrong price for the room (I had booked a special on the website for one night for full price, one night half price and they not only had the wrong quote for the first night - twice the booking rate, but the full price the second night). They did resolve this, however. We then went to the room which was beautiful. We went to take the promised "free" chauffeured car to dinner and they told us "it would be better to walk hire a car because there's a 15 minute wait..." This, after I had confirmed the 'free" ride when we checked in and they even told us what time to come down. I complained to a manger and voila, a car showed up. Unfortunately, the driver practically begged us for a tip and told us they didn't pay him enough and he had been hired at the last minute just for the weekend because the hotel had booked up at the last minute. Sadly, this entire situation was repeated the second night of our stay - almost identical situation - different driver, same story - except this driver got lost and I had to help him find our restaurant! More: We went to the bar/restaurant and had lunch our first day and it was fine - food was pretty good, no issues. Also had breakfast first morning there. Problem: the hotel charged us for breakfast and it was supposed to be included in the rate! We argued and they gave us the first morning breakfast, but not the second. Then, when we checked out, there was a charge on the bill from the bar that was not ours - it was charged when we were in town having dinner! The hotel said "we can't do anything - the bar is separate - you'll have to call the manager..." So, after two weeks of phone tag with the manager and having the restaurant where we dined call him and tell him we were there when the charge was made, they credited our credit card! Final Evaluation: Despite the above, this IS a nice hotel - it was all bearable because the hotel personnel were so polite and nice about each issue. I would go back, but, unfortunately, not at the prices they are now charging. We were given a special rate because the hotel was just opening - prices have doubled - I am not kidding - doubled - since we stayed there. The hotel even called us to say "hey, did you enjoy your stay and will you come back?" I told them we would love to but the prices were not justifiable when one can go to the Napa River Inn or River Terrace (just next door, not as plush, but inexpensive!) for half the price. They offered us a "special" but it was still $299 a night. This is a nice property, but it is not worth more than $250 a night - and yes, I realize this is the Napa Valley - but the competition is not charging any more than that and the hotel and the location (while a good location - it is across the Napa River) are not worth what they are now charging.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel if you get the right price and the location works...”
Reviews.Author: miaent
Reviews.Content: Each room is privately owned and the Westin is the operator of the property and rents out the rooms. I don't know if they are wholly or fractionally owned. In any event know it is one of those types of properties. It is beautiful and new but know you are basically staying in the town of Napa rather a more secluded area like meadowood or Silverado. Knowing this, the property is intelligently positioned to where you don't know you are a 100 feet from the main street/highway (4 lane road). The pool is in the back of the property which is woodsy because the Napa River is right there. Not the most beautiful river but all you see is trees anyway. There are great cabanas around the pool and cocktail service.The rooms are big, beautiful and new. We paid $245 a night for a basic suite (kitchenette, seperate bedroom and bathroom). It was a little cheaper than the standard rate because we did a non refundable reservation. This hotel worked for us as it was clean, fun to hang out by the pool, was busy with both couples, singles and Families and walking distance to downtown Napa. It is basically a great, centrally located hotel. If you are looking for seclusion and more of the country serenity, then it might not be for you. We would of loved to stay at Meadowood or Calistoga Ranch but would of paid over double....at least. The Westin turned out to be a better choice because we could jog into town for breakfast and walk to Downtown Napa for dinner. This hotel is for you if you can get for $250 a night versus $650 at some of the other secluded resorts. I would definitely go back. Oh yeah, $20/night ammenity fee for parking, etc..

Reviews.Title: “Napa girls weekend!!!!”
Reviews.Author: vanessp
Reviews.Content: I have never written a review before but felt compelled to do so in honor of the Westin Verasa. They were absolutely amazing. The entire staff was friendly, helpful and attentive. Anytime we had a request it was taken care of promptly and with a smile. The rooms are awesome, the location great and reasonably priced. I will be back!!!! We had 4 women in a one bedroon suite and had more than enough room--the bathroom was enormous!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Awesome Location!”
Reviews.Author: Chad B
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights during the week so the traffic and people were not in abundance like they are on the weekends. The stay was just perfect! The hotel is conveniently located walking distance from everything downtown Napa (all of the wine tasting rooms, restaurants, shops, etc.) and next door to the Oxbow market (a lot of season and fresh foods that make it easy to bring anything back to the hotel and enjoy with a bottle of wine)! It was fun just walking around downtown Napa in the afternoon finding new places (and not have to worry about driving back to the hotel after one too many wine tastings)! In terms of location, it's an easy drive to/from Silverado Trail and highway 29. There are also a bunch of stores (e.g. Trader Joeâ€™s, Whole Foods, a bunch of pharmacies, etc.) to stock up on anything you need for your stay. Can't beat the location. The service was phenomenal! We ordered room service multiple times and it the most time it took was 15 minutes for our three person order (and the food was very good!). The wait staff, valet, concierge, etc. are all very friendly and knowledgeable about the hotel and the area, and are always willing to help out/assist. We told the front desk that we had a child that may be sleeping, so everyone that came by knocked softly on the door and was quiet while doing their jobs. Lastly, the pool, spa and fitness room are top notch for the Napa area. We used all of the facilities and enjoyed everything! The only complaint that I can think of is that very often weekends fill up in advance, so you have to plan your stay further out than most places. I highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Worth a stay”
Reviews.Author: Marginwalker
Reviews.Content: My family of four spent one night here for a combo birthday/Mother's Day quick trip. Our room was upgraded to a suite, which gave us plenty of room. The hotel was exceptionally clean and well maintained; the room was well appointed and quiet. It's not a particularly elegant place in design, but it's not unpleasing either. The pool area was nice for a relaxing break from wine tasting and sight-seeing; there were plenty of pool towels available and nice lounge chairs. When we checked in we noticed our room lacked sufficient towels and the sofa bed wasn't made up; we made a call to reception, and all was taken care of efficiently. Not many toiletry amenties were supplied--just basic shampoo and one bar of soap, but it was fine for one night. The staff were all friendly and patient. We did not eat at the hotel. The location is perfect for anyone wishing to explore downtown Napa, which has some wonderful wine tasting rooms and restaurants (try the Vintner's Collective!). The nearby Oxbow Marketplace is fun for picking up picnic supplies to bring to wineries. We especially enjoyed the bread we got at the Model Bakery.

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe the bad reviews!! FABULOUS HOTEL!!”
Reviews.Author: Linds281
Reviews.Content: Please do not listen to the previous poor reviews. This is a BEAUTIFUL new hotel located in downtown Napa. The service is impeccable in every way possible. The concierge bends over backwards to ensure you have a fantastic stay. The restaurant La Toque (located in the hotel) is absolutely amazing. The rooms are modern, spacious and extremely comfortable. I have had numerous out of town guests stay at The Westin and all of them have had rave reviews as well.

Reviews.Title: “Central location, great service, perfect place to enjoy Napa Valley!”
Reviews.Author: NYDP
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time at the Westin Verasa Napa! This facility is less than a year old, and it was in superb condition. The hotel is designed with the feel of being on a vineyard, combined with modern trendiness, as typical with the Westin name. All the facilities were clean and the rooms were spacious and bright. Most importanty, the staff couldn't have been better. We were there for a special occasion, and they went above and beyond to make sure that we had everything that we needed to make it special. We would definitely return and recommend this hotel to anyone!!! P.S. Thanks again to the concierge and the front desk staff! We appreciate everything!

Reviews.Title: “The Westin in Napa knows how to make you feel like a celebrity”
Reviews.Author: MarkyMarkTampa
Reviews.Content: I have stayed all over the world, from Dubai to Vancouver and the Westin Verasa is one of the most amazing places I have had the pleasure to stay at. From the moment I pulled up to the valet to Eugene that checked me in, to Chuck in the restaurant and the hotel manager Justin that personally escorted me to my room - I felt like a celebrity! Hats off to a great hotel and hotel staff, what an amazing time!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in the Napa Valley”
Reviews.Author: asthetix
Reviews.Content: This is our third visit to the Westin since it opened in the Fall. We come to the Napa Valley often since i often have business in the SF bay area. Without a doubt, the Westin is the best place in the valley to stay now. The other hotels are dated by comparison. In addition, i have had none of the service issues other reviewers seem to have had. On the first visit when the hotel first opened, there were a couple of small issues with our room but were quickly resolved when i called. The La Toque restaurant was fantastic. Expensive but if you are looking for a top quality experience, go no further. On our first visit, we were placed in a first floor room overlooking the front of the hotel. At first, i was disappointed because i thought i would like a room facing the river. However, we have actually requested this room on return visits. Theses rooms have very high ceilings which give the rooms a more spacious feel. In addition, we dont have to wait for the elevator and are close to the fitness center and the lobby. The room is quiet. I think it is probably quieter than rooms facing the courtyards. The hotel is also within walking distance to the new Ox Bow market which is a great place for gourmet foods and wine. The historic downtown area is also within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property, but awful service...Westin has really missed the boat!”
Reviews.Author: sara1327
Reviews.Content: Prior to going on our recent trip to Napa, I read the reviews on this property and was hoping that the negative reviews were abnormal and more of an isolated event. I couldn't have been more wrong, and the complaints couldn't have been more correct!! The service at this property was AWFUL!!! Let me start with the positive, the property is beautiful, very clean, and in a great location. The beds are so comfortable and the concierge was helpful with restaurant selections. On the flip side, if you want to leave the property, be sure to request your car from valet AT LEAST 30 MINUTES PRIOR....I am not exaggerating. The hotel was no where near capacity and each time we requested our vehicle it took 30 minutes at a minimum. We had to request our vehicle 4 times while the valet guys stood around and chatted with each other looking at us like we were odd for standing outside for so long. Not to mention, you have to pay a $20 per day fee for this valet, which is ABSOLUTELY AWFUL. We parked on the street because we had to catch a flight and were concerned we would miss it due to the painfully slow valet. Also, do not plan on eating breakfast at The Bank unless you have a lot of time to waste while you wait for a table with 10 other people and half the restaurant is empty!! Overall, I have stayed at many Westin properties and this by far is the WORST Westin as far as service is concerned. It is really a shame because it is gorgeous and in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, decor, and food...not enough service”
Reviews.Author: BarryOxford
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful location in an excellent location in Napa. At the south end of the valley, but only minutes to Yountville, Oakville, St. Helena, etc. Located in downtown Napa if you are looking for dining or shopping there. The rooms are lovely. I've stayed there three times and always been upgraded to a 1 bedroom suite with a full kittchen, nice living room and dining room space with either a balcony or nice ground floor outdoor sitting area each time. Nice new stainless steel applicances and nice bathroom(s) with decent sized bathtubs and nice separate showers. The decor is very fitting for Napa, as mentioned by another reviewer with natural colors, and comfortable appointments selected over stylish modernity. The rooms have nice sound systems that work with your ipod and xboxes along with the standard flat screen tv's. The service at the hotel is great and works hard...however, there isn't nearly enough of it!!! The person at the front desk is often trying to manage the valet and the concierge at the same time. I've stayed at westin's less than 1/2 this size (such as Palo Alto, Key West to note 2 recent ones) who had at least twice the service staff despite commanding much lower rack and overall room rates. As a result the staff ends up dropping the ball on requests for service brought to the room, you often wait too long for the valet parking service, and you never find anybody managing the concierge desk. Shame on Westin and the SPG group for mismanaging what is an otherwise excellent property. Best, Barry SPG Platinum member.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with our stay”
Reviews.Author: PRRecBooks
Reviews.Content: Wow, sounds like there were some issues with some previous customers. All I can say is that my husband and I had a terrific weekend here during the Mustard Festival. It's a brand new hotel, beautifully decorated. Staff was sparse but accommodating. Laura in the bar/restaurant was great, and we got a tour by her at Hess (where she also works) on Sunday while we were there. Check in was easy. They upgraded us from a regular room to a suite with a nice outside seating area (though it was a bit cold to enjoy). Valet was fine. The concierge pointed out some terrific breakfast and lunch places in the area. Really, we enjoyed ourselves and thought the hotel was comfortable and beautiful!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in Napa”
Reviews.Author: HCL-Davis
Reviews.Content: We haven't stayed in a Westin in quite a while, so we cannot compare this location to other Westins but I overall we had a very good - excellent stay. We stayed primarily for a romantic weekend night in Napa and the atmosphere and feel of the hotel was very Napa - incorporating natural colors, textures, and wood / stone to the lobby and the room. We stayed in a Deluxe room which to our surprise was a well-stocked kitchenette including stovetop ( 2 "burners" I think), microwave, refrigerator, dishwasher, and some kitchen cookware and kitchenware. The bathroom was nicely sized with a dual head shower. And our view of the courtyard was pleasant and quiet. Front staff check-in and checkout was efficient and cheerful. The onsite restaurant, LA TOQUE, is FABULOUS! And hands down the best dining experience and food we have EVER had so it was great that we didn't have to leave the resort to go for dinner. It is pricey, but we thought worth it. Two issues we noted were: 1. We don't think there is much to do in terms of where the hotel is located - I think Oxbow Public Market and the Napa Wine Train Station are close, but I didn't really see much surrounding the hotel itself. 2. The $20 / day resort fee is a nuisance. I don't understand why this continues to be a trend at hotels that are "resorts." It covers valet parking, the use of their exercise facilities (which we didn't check out), and bocce ball. Of the resort fee, we only took advantage of the mandatory valet parking (no self parking).

Reviews.Title: “Poorly Managed”
Reviews.Author: carolbeths
Reviews.Content: The only reason this gets any stars at all is that after 2 hours, Eugene (the security manager) finally gave us a room that was acceptable...and by acceptable, I mean a room with 2 beds, since that's what we had originally booked. My friends and I came here for my 25th birthday party. Given the current economy and the off-season, we thought we paid enough (over $200) for a standard room with two beds. Upon checking in, we were informed that we had been "upgraded" to a room with one king-sized bed--for four adults!--because our original room had been given away. We requested to be booked in our original room, and asked for the Manger on Duty, Antonello, who subsequently refused our request. When we said that we didn't want the upgrade, he became visibly upset and informed us that if we wanted a second bed, we should book a second room at our own expense. He insisted that every single room in the hotel with more than one bed was booked, and that at 97% capacity he could only book us an extra room at our cost. We should also note that the Westin gave away our original room with two beds, and Antonello defended this by saying that the reservation was only made for 2 adults. We had put four adults on the reservation, but even so--we pointed out that there would be several occasions on which two adults would want to sleep separately. Antonello simply responded, "that would be their problem." The manager seemed completely unconcerned that with one bed, two girls would be left to fend for themselves on the couch and the floor, despite the fact that one girl in our party was sick. When we brought this up, Antonello sarcastically suggested that we could book the second room on his credit card. Antonello repeatedly lied to us, saying there was nothing he could do until the Security Manager, upon seeing us make a scene in the main lobby, started to book us a superior room with two beds the instant we described the problem. It took us several hours to get to Eugene, who was the first person to treat us like customers, at which point we FINALLY got a room akin to what we had originally reserved. Given that it was already 11:30 P.M, it was clear the room wouldn't have been sold otherwise. It felt demeaning that we had to make a scene to get a room with two beds as originally ordered. The hospitality industry is one that is sensitive, particularly in this type of economy. It didn't seem like it would even remotely be an issue to be accommodated with a second bed (when a second room was entirely unoccupied) after 11:30 at night. We were astounded that the management argued with us, after giving away our original room, and we were appalled. Despite the quality of the room we were given in the end, we would not stay here again to deal with the hotel staff. Don Shindle, you should be ashamed; with management like this, it's no wonder this was the only hotel with vacancy the weekend of the Napa Marathon. NOTE: there is also a $20 mandatory resort fee for parking, spa use, and internet. Revenue enhancement to the nth.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, poor service”
Reviews.Author: JosiahMan
Reviews.Content: Good location if you want to check out Oxbox Market, do some wine tasting downtown and (recommend) eat at the new much acclaimed Ubuntu. They opened recently but service was poor, especially checking in and out. Valet lost our ticket and it took twenty five minutes to get our car.

Reviews.Title: “Great room and service”
Reviews.Author: garthbernstein
Reviews.Content: I am a business owner and was impressed by the quality of the service. In town with my mom to visit with family, and the room was great. I highly recommend the hotel, as the staff focused on the details. Great bar with food and wine. I am a business owner myself, and was happy to see the focus on service. The only downside is the "amenity fee" of $20 per day added on to the bill at the end of the stay. That should of been disclosed prior to the stay, or at least call it $20 for parking instead of "free valet parking" the hotel offers.

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly beds make this hotel heavenly :)”
Reviews.Author: bebe624
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in December 2008 for a company function. The hotel is new which is nice because everything in the room, the lobby, the restaurant felt like it had never been used. The room was nice but the hotel only has 3 floors so try to ask for a room near the elevator otherwise you will be walking for a very, very, very long time to and from the elevator. The room was great, but I have to say that the shower & bed won me over. Like I said maybe because it's a new hotel but I felt like the bed had never been slept on. It was so heavenly that I would love to buy one of these beds for my own bedroom one day. Had dinner at La Toque. The service was great but the food was so-so for the price. Also was a little bummed that the hotel bar closed at 11:30 pm. We ended up taking a cab to downtown Napa to have a few more drinks and finish off our night. Overall it's a nice hotel and I would stay here again, but probably not eat at La Toque again. P.S. They had FREE wi-fi is always a nice bonus at a hotel. :-)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MTCA_8
Reviews.Content: This was an excellent hotel and it is a few months old. We stayed there and booked a traditional room. We were upgraded to a one bedroom suite upon arrival. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The rooms are great with all new ammenities.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Hotel with 5 Star restaurant on premises.”
Reviews.Author: apickytraveler
Reviews.Content: Brand new hotel with Heavenly Beds in a reviving Napa downtown area. Like another reviewer wrote, we stayed at this hotel when it was newly opened after a week. The staff were all sweet and tried hard but definitely could used some training. I suspect with some experience under their belt, it will be fine. Other than the wait staff, this is a wonderful hotel and location for a romantic weekend. There's so much to do besides just wine tasting, like shopping, walking around the Copia, Bocci Ball. It's right next to the Wine Train and Oxbow Market. I love the prixe fixed lunches at Julia Child's restaurant or for a less expensive lunch, try Taylor's the hamburger joint. If you're a food junkie, like I am, the restaurant at the hotel is soooooooo delicious. I think it's probably pricey (we didn't pay) but it's worth it I was amazed because we were part of a very large group and everything was sooooo good. I forgot to mention that breakfast there was also terrific. Not your regular pancakes and bacon. There is too much to do for the short time we were there so we're definitely having to plan another trip soon.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent property and location”
Reviews.Author: stanfordprof
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed there too and really enjoyed it. The location offers a convenient base to explore Napa Valley, but also many fun places to walk to (Oxbow Market, Copia, many wine tasting rooms, shops, restaurants in downtown Napa). Being right on the Napa River is quite unique. The property is really nice (Westin style and amenities) and relaxing. We also got upgraded to a 1-bedroom suite overlooking the pool courtyard, which was wonderful (there are some rooms overlooking the road that would not be as nice). La Toque is one of the best restaurants in Napa (Michelin star). As a brand new hotel, I can see how some things are not fully ironed out, but we were treated very well by the staff. Westin Verasa is our new favorite place to splurge on in Napa!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT stay at the New Westin Verasa!”
Reviews.Author: Eastcoastgal01
Reviews.Content: Tried to book a last minute stay in Napa during Crush & our favorite (Carneros Inn) was booked along with all other nicer hotels. Decided to to give this new hotel a shot & were glad we did! After reading last review I just had to post as our experience was completely different! Arrived 10/3/08 & departed 10/9/08. Staff was so polite, pleasant, and accomdating at all times! They truly went out of their way to say hello & offer to help. We arrived early & were upgraded to 1 bdrm suite. Room had free basket of snacks, great view of pool, and was never stayed in before! There was a stocked kitchenette with fridge which was great for our wine & cheese we bought as it had knives, wine opener etc. Napa has nice sun but a bit chilly for me to swim, though we did enjoy the HUGE hot tub by the pool which was in fact very hot. One of our favorite restaurants, La Toque moved to the premises & we had a fabulous meal there. We ate there on Wed nite which was slower, although everyone else was eating inside, they still offered us dinner on the covered patio and sat us right by the fireplace which they started up just for us along with the heaters. Both the dinner and the atmosphere were absolutely fabulous! A must do even if you stay elsewhere! The hotel was only 2 weeks old so of course there were a few minor & rapidly fixed gaffs--one day our room wasn't made up even though we were out early & not back til 4:30. When I reported & told them we wanted to rest before dinner, they offered to do at my convenience when we left for dinner. They forgot extra toilet paper 1x which again was easily fixed with an apology & a smile, etc, etc. Hotel was so conveniently located--within walking distance (they do have a car too) to many Napa restaurants & the Oxbow market & a great burger place are just a few steps away. We truly enjoyed our stay & will be back! Was it 5 star, no & not supposed to be but I'd give it 4 & think they are doing a great job for a new hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Westin Price without Westin Quality Service”
Reviews.Author: blazingal
Reviews.Content: Short Version: Room: Not clean at check-in Pool: Freezing Hot Tub: Warm at best Room: Nice to have a kitchenette Tv: Not functional, even after a maintenance visit Service: Staff needs more training We booked a night at the Westin Verasa to enjoy swimming in the hot Napa sun, order room service, and watch an On Demand movie. We almost struck out on all 3 accounts. The pool was extremely cold and the hot tub was was probably 75-80 degrees at the most. The flat screen television in our room was broken; it kept freezing in mid-program. A maintenance worker came and replaced a computer chip in the tv. We asked him to activate the On Demand system and he instead instructed us on the proper use of the remote control. We asked him to check to make sure it was working. Once he confirmed that there was no On Demand service, he made a call and then informed us that the On Demand system was not working hotel-wide. We returned from dinner, switched on our "fixed" tv, and found that it was still not funcional. We were moved to a new room at 8:15PM. En route to the new room, another bell hop asked why we were moving. After we told him the tv didn't work, he said "That sucks". We were upgraded to a 1 bedroom suite. It was a good thing the new room was a suite, because only 1 of the 2 televisions was working. The tv in the bedroom was totally dead... so much for watching tv from the comfort of a Heavenly Bed. After we were finally settled for the night I called room service and ordered 2 desserts from the dessert menu from the hotel bar. The woman that answered the room service line took the order without hesitation. About 5 minutes later she called our room confused and asked where I had seen mention of the desserts I'd ordered. After correcting my pronunciation of the hotel restaurant, the woman confirmed my order. There were at least 2 other instances of the staff's lack of training. In both of the other cases the staff guessed at the responses to our questions rather than checking with someone to make sure they were correct. This may be pretty typical stuff for a new hotel, but we figured that the Westin would have offered pretty intensive training and brought in some well trained staff from other hotels. We were disappointed. Next time we'll probably stay at the River Terrace Inn. It is less expensive, has similar decor and some better amenities (including spa tubs), less pretense, and far better service.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel and Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: cubalibre3
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay through expedia.com which apparently gave us a great rate -- as we were told by the hotel staff. The hotel itself is impressive -- beautiful lobby and swimming area (although we did not have time to use it). They have just opened their doors and they are really making the extra effort to get the kinks out and to accommodate your every need. I would definitely encourage you to ask for a free upgrade to see if they have anything. Also, be careful which room you get. Our room faced the generator and the constant humming was bit annoying. Also, in the middle of the night we heard the a few trucks collecting trash and things. We were put in upgrade becaue the bell hop brought us to the wrong room, so we decided to stay in the room because it was a suite. The bathtub was great, as was the shower. The room had a nice fridge and a kitchenettte, which seemed nice to have -- we atleast used the fridge. The bed is a bit firm for my taste, but maybe it is because it is so new. They have flat screen tvs and iclock that you can plug your ipod into. The speakers aren't that, but I thought it was not a nice touch. The rooms also come with free wireless acess and free limosine service (but of course you have to tip the guy). I have never stayed at another hotel in napa, but I thing staying here for two days was quite nice and I would highly recommend it.

HotelInfo.Name: The Westin Verasa, Napa
